title: Counsellor (Masters level)
description:
Company description

The Therapy Place Counselling Group is a growing team of counsellors located in downtown Nanaimo, BC.

Our hub is a flexible and fun place to work, learn, connect, and grow!

Job description

Welcome to The Therapy Place Counselling Group (LTD)

We have openings for one full time or part time (minimum 3 days/wk) counsellor.

Applicants must possess a minimum Masters degree in Arts, Counselling, Education, Nursing, or Social Work, and be eligible for registration with either the British Columbia Association of Clinical Counsellors (BCACC), the Canadian Counselling and Psychotherapy Association (CCPA), or the British Columbia College of Social Workers (BCCSW).

This is a contract positions with a fixed percentage per client work. Contractors are provided with clients, advertising, business cards, and a comfortable, furnished office. Contractors must provide their own computer and must possess a degree of some proficiency and comfort with computers. We are ideally looking for counsellors with a minimum of 3 years of experience post-graduation. Hours are flexible (fitting in their hours between the hours of 9am and 9pm), but contractors would ideally be available for work Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays (and optionally, Sundays or Monday evenings).

Given the uncertain economical climate presented by the current pandemic, the Therapy Place can provide no guarantee of minimum hours/pay; however, contractors can likely expect a minimum of 25 client hours per week within a few weeks of starting.

Please contact Ron Depner by email if you would like more details, or send your resume.

Work remotely

  • Possible

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Salary: $60,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

COVID-19 considerations:
We are following a Covid-19 Worksite safety plan to keep our team and clients safe. Measures may include appropriate distancing, PPE (where preferred or required), office sanitation, hand sanitizer, and online video/phone counselling where necessary.

Education:

  • Master's Degree (preferred)

title: newExecutive Director
description:
LitFest, Canada’s first and only nonfiction festival, is seeking a full-time Executive Director to fulfill its mission and mandate. LitFest’s current executive director, Fawnda Mithrush, will step down in June 2022 to open this opportunity for an emerging leader in the literary arts and nonprofit sector.

Past guests of LitFest include Malcolm Gladwell, Tanya Talaga, and Lindy West. This is an exciting opportunity for a person with a background in arts or event planning to liaise and work with literary rockstars in Canada and beyond.
Closing date: Open until filled
Start date: May 2022, or once a suitable candidate is available.

Salary range: $60,000 to $75,000, commensurate with experience

Four weeks vacation and health benefits package are included.
LitFest’s Mission & Mandate
The Alberta Book Fair Society (ABFS), as producer of LitFest, aims to work with the Board of Directors to:

  • bring nonfiction writers together with readers at its annual 11-day festival, held each October in Edmonton, AB, as well as at semi-regular events held throughout the year
  • provide audiences with great nonfiction experiences
  • promote the City of Edmonton and its writers during the Festival, and
  • provide public opportunities for the development of the craft of nonfiction writing.

Alberta Book Fair Society is a registered charity and nonprofit society. Since 2006, LitFest has developed festival programming that reflects the diversity and innovation of contemporary nonfiction writers from Canada and around the world.
Executive Director (ED) Job Description
Reporting to the Board of Directors, the ED is responsible for the artistic, financial, and administrative operations of ABFS. The ED ensures that the core mission and mandate of the society are honoured and expressed in all of its operations.

The Board of Directors is seeking a highly organized and motivated person to lead the organization. The ED is the sole full-time permanent employee of the society. Staffing is supplemented with a seasonal production team of four, plus part-time contractors as needed to deliver the Fall festival.
Position responsibilities:

  • The ED supports the Board of Directors towards achieving ABFS’s mission and strategic goals, and reports to the Board at ten meetings per calendar year.
  • The ED envisions and executes an annual artistic plan and audience development strategies for the festival and explores auxiliary event opportunities.
  • The ED establishes and maintains relationships with Canadian publishers to gauge opportunity and interest in authors touring to Edmonton, and also monitors the current nonfiction landscape with respect to potential programming.
  • Working with approval from the Board of Directors, the ED determines and monitors the annual budget and spending.
  • The ED manages the day-to-day administration of all areas of finance for the society, including bookkeeping, annual audit, fiscal reporting to Revenue Canada, and maintaining current database records in CADAC (Canadian Arts Data/Données sur les arts au Canada).
  • The ED oversees and reports to AGLC on spending of gaming revenues on an annual basis.
  • The ED identifies opportunities to secure public/private/corporate/foundation funding to ensure the ongoing financial sustainability of the organization, and is responsible for liaising and reporting for all partners and sponsors engaged with the society. This work also entails regular updates and delivery of partner benefits set by the society’s Sponsorship Program, and providing support to the Development Committee.
  • The ED is responsible for maintaining all grant application and reporting cycles, as well as seeking new funding opportunities. This work involves grant-writing and timely reporting. LitFest currently receives annual funding from the Edmonton Arts Council, Alberta Foundation for the Arts, Canadian Heritage, and Canada Council for the Arts.
  • The ED engages in outreach with the local business and nonprofit sector to identify collaborative opportunities for purposes of cross-promotion, audience development, and/or co-produced programming.
  • The ED develops the annual communications and marketing plan encompassing promotional strategy and materials, advertising, press liaising, and coordinates content and delivery of festival-related e-newsletters, social media postings, and website maintenance.
  • The ED oversees all Festival production logistics, including venue and vendor bookings, technical/staging requirements, box office and ticket sales administration, and organizing travel and accommodation arrangements for presenting writers.
  • The ED recruits, trains, and manages all staff and production contractors. Seasonal staff are engaged to recruit and supervise volunteers involved with the festival.
  • The ED represents LitFest in the community and maintains relationships with publishers, authors, funders, sponsors, media, and other stakeholders. The Board of Directors supports this role with advocacy.
  • The ED is committed to presenting programming that is diverse and representative of the entire community, is sensitive to accessibility for all audiences, and is respectful of the time and engagement extended to the Festival by its presenters. Festival events must include safe spaces for all participants, including volunteers, staff, presenters, and audience members.

The ideal candidate has a minimum of five years managing a nonprofit organization, arts management, and/or event-planning experience. We seek a passionate and energetic arts leader with demonstrated skills in strategic planning, budgeting, fundraising, marketing, event coordination, resourcefulness, and community awareness. Knowledge of nonfiction authors and the Canadian publishing industry are assets.

The candidate can readily respond to opportunities and challenges as they arise, and is eager to engage with Edmonton’s creative and business ecologies. An inclusive leadership style is desired with a demonstrated commitment to equity and diversity. A plurality of lived experiences and perspectives is vital to positions in the culture sector, and the Society particularly encourages candidates from IBPoC, LGBTQ2S+, and underrepresented communities to submit an application.
We thank all interested candidates for their applications, but only those selected for interviews will be contacted by the Search Committee.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
For the health and safety of our community and staff, LitFest will be following City of Edmonton bylaws and Government of Alberta COVID-19 requirements for all in-person events.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • management: 5 years (preferred)

title: Pay Per Click Manager / PPC / SEM / Google Ads
description:
Dear problem-solvers, out-of-the-box thinkers, and straight-A students who skipped class: We want you.

ENVIRONMENT

Nice to meet you! We’re Webrunner, and we help contractors across North America generate exclusive leads through data-driven paid advertising campaigns.

Our HQ is based just outside of Montreal, QC, and our crew is made up of a diverse group of folk who believe that impactful work is the best kind of work. Our people are driving the digital transformation of the home improvement industry.

We value hard work, humble leadership, and spirited community. Teamwork is our driving force, and no human gets left behind!

If you want to wear a suit & tie to work every day, be chained to your desk from 9-5 Monday to Friday, with absolutely no benefits whatsoever and zero option for career advancement, this is NOT the place for you.

Any of this hit home for you? Tell us why you would make an excellent addition to our team!

NOTE: We will not read resumes without a cover letter

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Google Ads Manager, your time will be focused on generating leads through major search engine platforms like Google, Bing, and Yahoo for contractors in the improvement industry across Canada & the US.

You should already have a working knowledge of the Google Ads platform and understand paid advertising fundamentals.

We are looking for someone who eats analytics for breakfast and is eager to create innovative campaigns while honoring the clients’ goals.

Your performance will be measured by your ability to successfully invest the client's advertising dollars with the objective of generating leads consistently and profitably.

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for someone who...

  • Has an insatiable desire to learn and hone their digital marketing chops
  • Is a team player. Teamwork makes the dream work, right?
  • Eats marketing blogs and podcasts for breakfast
  • Is disciplined, strategic, acts with high integrity, and is hungry to make a difference
  • Has exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Is analytical but doesn’t shy away from their creative side
  • Has completed some level of college education
  • Has 2-3 years of professional work experience (marketing-related is a plus!)

PS: Cover Letters > Resumes

WHAT YOU’LL GET: LET’S TALK PERKS!
Respect & Recognition

  • We believe the best type of people are those who are self-motivators. Say goodbye to micro-managing! As long as productivity stays up and we are getting results, we let you spread your wings and fly on your own. After all, entrepreneurship is sexy.

Culture & Community

  • Our entire team is made up of the best kind of people you can find. We host frequent team-building activities and outings and believe that connection and community is #1. We value diversity and inclusivity and believe that corporate hierarchy is so 2008.

Health & Wellness

  • Rest easy with our extended health care plans, dental care, life insurance, and wellness program. Everyone needs a break, which is why we take paid time off seriously. We take care of you so that you can take care of you.

Flexible Work-Life Balance

  • You have a life; we get it! This is why we offer flexible hours for our crew. You’ll never be locked into a 9-5, so you can work from home in your PJ’s or join us at Webrunner HQ (did we mention we have a Nespresso machine?).

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Tell us why you would like to work at Webrunner!

title: Talent Acquisition and Employer Brand, Marketing Manager (Re...
description:
Join us in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC advances a culture that helps everyone to thrive. It's one of the reasons we're recognized as a "Top Company" to work for in Canada. As you ignite a meaningful career and build a network that’ll last for life, you'll work with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to help solve important problems, empowered by technology to turn today's ideas into tomorrow's solutions. We cultivate an environment in which our differences are embraced and our people feel comfortable bringing their whole selves to work. An empowering and diverse environment starts with you. Are you ready to get started?

A career in Sales and Marketing, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on positioning a distinctive PwC brand in the marketplace and drive long term revenue growth for the Firm. You’ll focus on designing, developing, and implementing communication programmes and media events to promote and sell the PwC’s brand and services as well as contribute to and evaluating our pricing strategies in the marketplace.

Our Brand Management team leads external brand strategy development and implementation across multiple business units, media, social and digital channels. As part of the team, you’ll be involved with driving marketing programmes, branding events, corporate leadership seminars, public relations and business marketing forums.

The Employer Brand team is a key driver of this mission. As a member of the Brand Experience team, the Marketing Manager, Talent Acquisition, will be responsible for ideating, designing, and running campaigns across multiple digital platforms to optimize and inform our employer branding efforts. The Manager will bring a deep knowledge of digital marketing platforms to develop, execute, analyze, and optimize campaigns to build highly-focused talent pools and convert them into direct experienced and campus hires .

Important point to consider

  • Please note this is a 15 month contract

  • COVID-19 Vaccination Policy

    : Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future :
    The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details .

What you'll create and do

As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

  • Responsible for leading and developing omnichannel marketing and communications strategies that will attract top talent and position PwC as an employer of choice

  • Work cross-functionally with internal partners to implement go-to-market strategies, driving conversion with key recruitment segments

  • Understands and makes the connection between marketing efforts (advertising, events, sponsorship, digital/content etc.) and the tracking of ROI across media

  • Plan content strategy and develop editorial calendar that supports our employee value proposition

  • Writes and reviews content for a variety of external communications: email, blogs, website and digital advertising

  • Manages marketing budgets and makes educated decisions on reasonable spends and expectations with vendors and stakeholders

  • Act as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders and proactively make recommendations to support firm objectives

What you’ll bring to this role

  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work

  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard

  • Experience designing, executing and measuring marketing campaigns

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to tell authentic stories

  • Ability to present with impact and influence effectively

  • Leadership skills

  • Highly creative with the ability to “think out of the box.”

  • Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking

  • Solid understanding of managing a budget in support of marketing plans

  • Proven ability to manage multiple priorities to deadline

  • Self-starter who is detail-oriented and can work well within a local and national team

  • Demonstrated ability to excel in a fast-paced, corporate environment

Why you’ll love working for PwC

At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

See how you can create your future at PwC

www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/create-your-future.html

Get to know us

Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html

Applying at PwC

At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here: https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc

We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers:

https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html

PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

Every day we see how people make businesses great. But it's not only about skills. If your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying. We recognize that experience comes in many forms, and passionate teams reimagine the possible. Create your future at PwC.

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
Dear Future Teammate,

Thank you for considering joining our team.

Our company is unique in Edmonton: we compete in a large North American market against some of the world’s smartest tacticians. Our scope goes well beyond the borders of our city, our province, and even our country. Because of this, we have built a local eCommerce powerhouse, with a culture and depth of knowledge not available anywhere else in Edmonton.

We believe that working with high-performers is the best office perk; that practicing radical honesty within our team makes us exponentially better; that paying great salaries with excellent benefits means we attract the best and the brightest; that giving freedom and responsibility brings out the best in people; and that being relentlessly customer-centric will drive phenomenal growth.

If you are an expert at your craft, have strong, fact-based opinions, and welcome the challenge of your life, then I personally invite you to join us.

– Sam Prochazka, CEO of GoodMorning.com

About the Digital Content Specialist

You’re a passionate storyteller who knows how to write copy that sells. You are a curious and creative problem solver who stays current with emerging trends in advertising, social media, digital marketing, and branding. You can take a concept from the brainstorming stage to publication, with the ability to fine-tune and refine your creative vision as you go. You can adapt your voice to write for any audience, and you understand how to use data to improve the efficacy of your work. Most importantly, you are a great listener and collaborator who thrives in a fast-paced environment while juggling multiple projects at once.

Responsibilities

  • Create compelling, action-oriented copy for websites, email, video scripts, social media, and more
  • Assist in the creative development and execution of photography and video assets
  • Work alongside various internal stakeholders to develop and implement content strategies
  • Locate, curate, and organize digital content and files
  • Manage external contractors and oversee project quality
  • Ongoing development of efficiencies to maximize creative output and improve campaign success
  • Stay up-to-date with industry developments and tools

Requirements

  • Expert written and verbal communication skills with professional experience in digital content creation, copyediting, email marketing, social media networking and management, and communications strategy development
  • Proficiency with Adobe CS, G-Suite, and other creative tools.
  • Proven aptitude to function within deadlines, while working both independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to guide various stakeholder groups with content strategy and development
  • Experience with asset planning and/or creative direction for photo and video shoots is considered an asset
  • Professional and positive attitude
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Portfolio or other examples of published work for review
  • Degree or other post-secondary education in a related field is a bonus.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Commuter benefits
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB T5K 2L9: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Content Marketing Occupations: 2 years (preferred)

title: Marketing and Sales Coordinator
description:
Sonic Incytes believes in creating accessible and affordable healthtech solutions – with health insights you can count on – to improve patient care.

Recognizing the rise of chronic liver disease, Sonic Incytes is on a mission to make liver health a new vital sign. Its novel, point of care ultrasound solution, Velacur™, is redefining the standard of care in quantifying liver tissue stiffness and attenuation to aid in the clinical management of patients with chronic liver disease.

Job Description

Sonic Incytes is seeking a full-time Marketing and Sales Coordinator, who will support and work collaboratively with the Director of Sales and the Director of Corporate Development. We are searching for a highly motivated individual to contribute to existing and new marketing and sales initiatives aligned with the company goals and to generate quality sales leads.

The ideal candidate will have prior experience with a range of marketing functions, including communications, event management, advertising, branding, digital marketing and social media. The candidate will have strong attention to detail, excellent communication skills and experience directly supporting Sales in an operational capacity. The coordinator must be an organized multitasker able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines.

Key Responsibilities

Marketing

  • Support and work closely with the Director of Corporate Development in completing all initiatives and programs related to marketing and communications.
  • Assist with the development, execution and monitoring of Sonic Incytes’ digital channels including email, website and social media.
  • Plan and manage meetings, events, conferences, and trade shows by identifying, assembling, and coordinating requirements, establishing contacts, developing schedules and assignments, and coordinating mailing lists.
  • Keep a pulse on market trends, customer behavior and the competitive landscape, reporting on competitor marketing campaigns, communications, and positioning.
  • Support the execution of the marketing and communications plan.
  • Monitor, evaluate, and report on the success of marketing campaigns and implement recommendations for improvement.
  • Assist in the creation of value-add content for digital and print channels to build awareness, drive interest and generate leads, including social media, email, video, webinars, brochures, collateral, advertisements, and tradeshows.
  • Maintain a directory and inventory of sales support materials, ensuring all resources are current and accurate, and coordinate the creation of new materials as needed.
  • Ensure all marketing and communications adhere to the overall corporate brand.
  • Manage print contractor and other marketing vendors effectively.
  • Stay up to date on current market trends, technology and make recommendations to drive efficiencies, improvement, and innovation.

Sales

  • Coordinate the Director of Sales and the sales team by managing schedules, tasks, tracking output and communicating relevant information.
  • Ensuring all quotes, contracts and other related sales documentation are completed correctly and filed in a central location.
  • Monitor and report on the sales team’s progress, identify shortcomings, and propose improvements.
  • Assist in the preparation and organization of promotional materials or events.
  • Enter lead and customer information into the company’s Customer Relationship Management software (HubSpot) and ensure that all information is correct and up to date.
  • Coordinate with staff members from other departments including marketing, research and development and finance to ensure sales optimization.
  • Analyze prospect data to identify potential quality leads.

Qualifications and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, advertising, communications, public relations or equivalent.
  • 3 + years of experience in marketing, communications, content management or public relations.
  • Exceptionally organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Excellent written, oral and presentation communications skills.
  • Digital marketing experience, with knowledge in managing social media channels, web, email. Knowledge of SEO, SEM and digital advertising is an asset.
  • Experience using marketing platforms including CRM (i.e. HubSpot) and analytics (i.e. Tableau) to track lead generation and monitor marketing and sales performance.
  • Events management experience, including planning company attendance at industry and investor events from start to finish.
  • Experience with Microsoft Office, Dropbox and Google Suite.
  • Graphic Design knowledge is an asset but is not required.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, presentation, and relationship building abilities.
  • A track record of delivering high levels of performance, quality, and customer experience
  • Strategic thinker that can also operate at the tactical level very efficiently.
  • Decisive and focused: understands what needs to be done and moves quickly to that end; a hands-on executor who can multi-task and prioritize to achieve timelines and outcomes.
  • Confident, transparent, and comfortable sharing perspectives and guidance.
  • Innovative, creative, and resourceful, with a tireless drive to understand the customer and the competition.

Are you wanting to have a positive impact and up for a new challenge? If yes, we want to hear from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $55,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Stock options
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Common surfaces are sanitized regularly. Any employee with COVID-19 symptoms must get tested and work from home.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC V6J1P2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • Marketing: 3 years (required)

Application deadline: 2022-04-29

title: Communications Contractor (part-time) - Work-Integrated Lear...
description:
The Opportunity: The Rural Development Network is seeking a Communications Contractor to work alongside our Work-Integrated Learning team and Communication teams, to create a social media strategy for the project, support RDNs website revamp, and create program resources and presentations.

RDN, in partnership with the Business + Higher Education Roundtable, is raising awareness about work -integrated learning. This partnership connects employers & post-secondary students to experiential learning placements, facilitates knowledge exchange between employers and participants, and fosters relationships between post-secondary institutions and employers in rural and remote communities.

Location: We will consider applicants located anywhere in Canada who are willing and able to work remotely. RDN’s office is located in Edmonton, Alberta for candidates who prefer to work in person. Please indicate in your cover letter where you are located.

Salary Range: $20 per hour.

Additional Benefits:

  • RDN has a 35 hour work week. Staff have the option of working compressed work weeks, taking every second Friday off rather than working shorter days.
  • Flexible hours (daily start/end times), within RDN’s core hours.
  • Opportunity to work from home part time, or full time depending on location.

Anticipated Start Date: May 9 through August 31, 2022, with a strong possibility of extension. 15-20 hours a week.

Responsibilities:

  • Creating a work-integrated learning social media strategy, including content and paid advertising for the Work-Integrated Learning team.
  • Create social media and resource graphics.
  • Scheduling social media posts, and organizing paid advertising.
  • Supporting the communications team with website revamp.
  • Creating resources for the Work-Integrated Learning team.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Graphic design experience
  • Knowledge of Adobe InDesign, Adobe Illustrator, or Canva
  • Experience with digital storytelling and narrative.
  • Previous experience with buying paid advertisement and google analytics
  • Demonstrated organizational and time management skills
  • Highly detail-oriented
  • Ability to work in a team and independently
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written) skills
  • Ability to take initiative
  • Highly proficient with computers and Microsoft Office programs, especially Word and Excel
  • Experience working or living in a rural community would be an asset.

Education:

  • Diploma or Degree in Marketing & Communications or Public Relations is preferred.

COVID-19 & Vaccinations:

RDN is committed to the safety and health of our team and people we work with. Accordingly, it is our responsibility to promote the health and safety of all employees, contractors, clients, and communities we serve by reducing the risks of COVID-19 through vaccination as per AHS guidance. All RDN employees and interns are strongly encouraged to receive the COVID-19 vaccination, if they are able to.

How to Apply:

Please send a cover letter and resume. We recommend applying as soon as possible. Applications will still be accepted and reviewed until a suitable candidate is found.

About the Rural Development Network:

RDN is a non-profit organization that supports the sustainability of rural communities. We collaborate to identify and bring focus to rural issues, build local capacity, and find innovative, rural-based solutions to unique issues. Some of the key things RDN does are: managing and delivering projects and initiatives, helping to identify and access funding to support projects, performing services on a cost-recovery basis, identifying, creating, and sharing tools, information and expertise, and partnering with other organizations on projects to compliment their skills & expertise, and boost their capacity.

RDN is a very entrepreneurial organization with a diverse team of over 35 staff, and a unique work environment. We have a team-oriented and inclusive culture, we strive to help our staff grow, and encourage team members to explore their interests and develop new opportunities. This position can offer the right candidate an excellent opportunity to take initiative and create something unique, enhance their profile, meet many amazing people and apply their skills to positive social change throughout Canada.

RDN is committed to and embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. RDN is committed to ensuring an equitable workplace that welcomes and respects diversity amongst our staff, board members and volunteers. RDN works to ensure and promote inclusivity, recognizing and actively supporting the different needs of our diverse staff, clients, and stakeholders. RDN recognizes that diversity is and will always be a key component of rural Canada’s future success, and we strive to ensure that our staff is diverse. We are committed to removing barriers to employment that are faced by equity-seeking groups and encourage (but do not require) members of these groups to self-identify as such in their cover​​ letters.

To learn more about RDN, visit www.ruraldevelopment.ca.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 15 per week

Salary: $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • Do you have Graphic design experience ?
  • Do you have knowledge of Adobe InDesign, Adobe Illustrator, or Canva?
  • Do you have experience with digital storytelling and narrative?
  • Do you have experience with buying paid advertisement and google analytics?
  • Are you willing and able to work remotely?
  • Are you legally able to work in Canada?

title: Programmatic Lead, Advertising Sales
description:
• Sales
  • Ad Sales
Sell what you love. For us and millions of users across the globe, that’s Spotify. Join the Sales team and you’ll build the relationships that help grow our business in existing markets and beyond. We don’t just sell creative solutions to our clients and partners, we help to shape them; using our expert knowledge of ad products, sales channels and the industry to impact the way the world experiences music and podcasts.

Location

Toronto

Job type

Permanent
At Spotify, we’re focused on providing the right music for every moment. We’ve connected millions of people to their favorite songs and created a service that people use to discover and share music they love.

We are looking for an outstanding Programmatic Sales Lead to join our team. We’re looking for someone with a proven record of revenue generation in the programmatic advertising field, with deep relationships across agencies, agency trading desks and DSPs. You will have a passion for online media, data and ad tech. We want someone who loves our product and understands the programmatic ecosystem.

What You'll Do

  • You will be the programmatic expert and evangelist in the sales organization, applying our diverse programmatic and data offering to drive revenue via Programmatic Guaranteed and PMP.
  • You will support and up level the wider sales team via internal education, co-selling in market, being the go to person for planning and execution
  • Meet and exceed quarterly revenue goals
  • You will work with collaboratively with our sales leadership team on strategic programmatic selling in market, pitching to agency and brand leaders
  • You will sell programmatic across audio, video and display, with a knowledge of mobile app based programmatic sales
  • You will grow programmatic advertising revenues by creating, maintaining, and sustaining relationships with dsps, agencies, trading desks and appropriate demand partnerships
  • You will be tasked with evangelizing streaming audio and inspiring our clients to use Spotify to meet their business objectives
  • Represent Spotify at events and serve as a brand ambassador
  • Manage activity using salesforce.com, provide accurate and timely forecasting, and report on meeting activity
  • Work on a home/office mix with some travel required
  • Understand the nuances of programmatic ad operations, from PG and PMP campaigns set up in GAM & Magnite to troubleshooting with clients.

Who You Are

  • You have a Bachelor’s degree
  • You have 5+ years experience in a programmatic and/or digital media sales role
  • You strategically use data and insights to inform client investment strategy
  • You have a deep understanding of the digital ecosystem and trends around programmatic technology, best practices, opportunities, and challenges.
  • You have strong negotiation skills and the ability to present effectively and close the deal
  • You have the ability to build a pipeline and proven track record of exceeding goals
  • You have dexterity in creating reports and presentations using Excel, PowerPoint, Keynote, etc.
  • You are a great teammate, smart, adapt well with change and have a positive attitude
  • You are able to work in a fast-paced, exciting environment and across external and internal teams to deliver creative, fresh campaigns

Where You'll Be

  • This position will be based in Toronto

Our global benefits

Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.

Learn about life at Spotify

Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure
Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

title: Facebook Ads Manager
description:
Dear problem-solvers, out-of-the-box thinkers, and straight-A students who skipped class: We want you.

ENVIRONMENT

Nice to meet you! We’re Webrunner, and we help contractors across North America generate exclusive leads through data-driven paid advertising campaigns.

Our HQ is based just outside of Montreal, QC, and our crew is made up of a diverse group of folk who believe that impactful work is the best kind of work. Our people are driving the digital transformation of the home improvement industry.

We value hard work, humble leadership, and spirited community. Teamwork is our driving force, and no human gets left behind!

If you want to wear a suit & tie to work every day, be chained to your desk from 9-5 Monday to Friday, with absolutely no benefits whatsoever and zero option for career advancement, this is NOT the place for you.

Any of this hit home for you? Tell us why you would make an excellent addition to our team!

NOTE: We will not read resumes without a cover letter

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Facebook Ads Manager, your time will be focused on generating leads through social advertising networks like Facebook, Instagram, and Linkedin for clients in the home improvement industry across Canada & the US.

You should already have a working knowledge of the Facebook Ads platform and understand the fundamentals of paid advertising.

Your performance will be measured by your ability to successfully invest the client's advertising dollars with the objective of generating leads consistently and profitably.

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for someone who...

  • Has an insatiable desire to learn and hone their digital marketing chops
  • Is a team player. Teamwork makes the dream work, right?
  • Eats marketing blogs and podcasts for breakfast
  • Is disciplined, strategic, acts with high integrity, and is hungry to make a difference
  • Has exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Is analytical but doesn’t shy away from their creative side
  • Has completed some level of college education
  • Has 2-3 years of professional work experience (marketing-related is a plus!)

PS: Cover letters > resumes

WHAT YOU’LL GET: LET’S TALK PERKS!
Respect & Recognition

  • We believe the best type of people are those who are self-motivators. Say goodbye to micro-managing! As long as productivity stays up and we are getting results, we let you spread your wings and fly on your own. After all, entrepreneurship is sexy.

Culture & Community

  • Our entire team is made up of the best kind of people you can find. We host frequent team-building activities and outings and believe that connection and community are #1. We value diversity and inclusivity and believe that corporate hierarchy is so 2008.

Health & Wellness

  • Rest easy with our extended health care plans, dental care, life insurance, and wellness program. Everyone needs a break, which is why we take paid time off seriously. We take care of you so that you can take care of you.

Flexible Work-Life Balance

  • You have a life; we get it! This is why we offer flexible hours for our crew. You’ll never be locked into a 9-5, so you can work from home in your PJ’s or join us at Webrunner HQ (did we mention we have a Nespresso machine?).

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • How many years of Facebook ad management experience do you have?
  • Tell us why you would like to work at Webrunner!

title: newEditor
description:
OUR COMPANY

Periphery Digital Inc. is a fast-paced, bilingual digital marketing and advertising agency founded and based in Vancouver, Canada. Specializing in both English and Chinese digital strategy and execution, our services include developing paid media strategies to drive leads & conversions along with using bilingual content and digital assets to optimize reach and growth. As one of the fastest growing agencies in Western Canada, we doubled the size of our team and revenue twice in two years through the COVID-19 pandemic — while keeping our whole team on board! We can’t wait to welcome a new part-time Editor to our team as a contractor.

ABOUT US

Our mission is to bridge the gap between Western businesses and Chinese consumers while developing a meaningful work environment that motivates our team to discover and achieve their personal and professional goals. We live by our values of Connectivity, Curiosity, Sincerity, Tenacity, & Gratitude, and strive to find team members who will elevate our culture through them. We truly care about our people — we believe that when we take good care of our team, the team takes care of us.

JOB OVERVIEW

The Editor is responsible for using their writing skills and keen eye for detail to create and edit engaging content for our website. You have a knack for the English language and tone and are able to adapt your communication style to different audiences. You understand the elements of storytelling and can explain technical topics in an easy to understand way. Reporting directly to our Marketing & Social Media lead, the successful candidate has demonstrative ability to produce quality writing pieces.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

  • Ideate and write creative blog posts for our target audience
  • Proofread and copy edit blogs and content for accuracy, tone, and clarity
  • Provide ideas for value-add blog images and/or create charts and graphs based on the material
  • Research and ensure all facts and statistics are accurate
  • Suggest blog post ideas to attract different audiences

OUR WISH LIST

Qualifications

  • Minimum two years of copywriting and editing experience
  • Excellent storytelling skills
  • Superior written communication and proofreading abilities
  • Strong research skills
  • Strong critical thinking abilities
  • Strong attention-to-detail
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Intermediate knowledge of the digital marketing and media landscape

Bonus Points:

  • Real-estate knowledge
  • Data analytics & visualization skills

Even if you don’t hit every single one of these qualifications, we’d strongly encourage you to apply anyway! We’re committed to a fair and transparent hiring process which is just as much for you as it is for us.

We thrive in an environment that celebrates all backgrounds, experiences, ages, beliefs, abilities, identities, races, and statuses. Our differences are what makes us competitive and adaptable to our ever-changing world. We strive to create an inclusive space where our team are empowered to bring their authentic selves to work each day and support each other even when we’re below the line. We’re building something great here — come be a part of it.

WHAT YOU NEED TO APPLY

A resume and either a writing portfolio or a couple of your best writing samples.

COVID-19 considerations:

Periphery Digital is fully remote at this time with optional (safely) hosted in-person events in or just outside our Yaletown Office.

DISCLAIMERS

Must be legally entitled to work according to the relevant provincial/territorial legislation and regulations. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. We thank all those who apply and look forward to welcoming a new member to the Periphery team.

Job Type: Freelance

Salary: $22.00-$25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Junior Regional Director
description:
COGIR Real Estate has nearly 4,800 employees passionate about real estate who work day after day to offer the best service and a better quality of life to our customers. Our team manages more than 250 properties located in Ontario, Quebec and the United States.

We are currently looking for a career driven, goal oriented individual with a desire to succeed in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). Our Junior Regional Directors are great mentors who teach by example and who understand the importance of team success. If you are passionate about supervising, inspecting, training, budgets and the willingness to learn, then you’re our person!

At Cogir Real Estate, people are at the heart of our philosophy, both for our team and for our customers. Our success is based on our teamwork: it is with people like you that we achieve our purpose.

You want to join a team passionate about real estate and people. Stop looking!

Main Responsibilities:

· Participate in the preparation of the annual Budget for the properties he/she is responsible for;

· Review the financial performance of the properties he/she is responsible for;

· Authorize all expenditures for properties he/she is responsible for in accordance with company guidelines;

· Collect and supervise the collection of rents from the properties and will liaise with the credit manager and legal department to deal with cases of arrears in accordance with company procedures;

· Arrange for and authorize marketing and advertising as required and in accordance with budget;

· Supervise, evaluate, train, hire and fire, as required, site staff;

· Inspect, authorize repairs, and coordinate with site staff, all turnover work in units;

· Conduct Market surveys, recommend rental rates and incentives if required for the buildings under his supervision;

· Enforce all policies and procedures concerning Human Resources, including overtime, commissions, attendance sheets and codes of conduct;

· Meet with residents and address their concerns and questions as required, with or without, the assistance of site staff;

· Ensure that all reports and returns required from his properties are received at the head office in accordance with the timings and frequency detailed in the procedures manual;

· Ensure that all policies concerning preferred contractors are carried out, and will bring forward any concerns he has regarding contractors, and recommend contractors who may meet the criteria required to become part of the preferred contractors list;

· Carry out other work, as required, in support of his/her buildings as detailed in procedures, directives and legislative regulations.

Key Competencies:

· Focused on customer satisfaction

· Leadership and a strong sense of personal accountability

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills

· Works well under pressure

· Capable of setting and managing priorities

· Strong ability to analyze, solve problems and take decisions

· Highly adaptable and tolerates stress

Requirements:

· University degree in administration or any related work experience

· Experience in multi-residential or other relevant environment

· Minimum 5 years of experience in a management role

· Demonstrated experience in combine conceptual thinking skills with a results orientation

· Access to a vehicle with a valid driver's license

Why you should join us!

· Salary to be discussed according to the experience

· Annual bonus program based on performance

· Expense account

· Package of vacations, sick and special leaves

· Cellphone, laptop and others materials you may need

· Health insurance plan

· Challenges to match your ambitions!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Social Media Coordinator
description:
Dear problem-solvers, out-of-the-box thinkers, and straight-A students who skipped class: * We want you.*

ENVIRONMENT

Nice to meet you! We’re Webrunner, and we help contractors across North America generate exclusive contractor leads through data-driven paid advertising campaigns.

Our HQ is based just outside of Montreal, QC, and our crew is made up of a diverse group of folk who believe that impactful work is the best kind of work. Our people are driving the digital transformation of the home improvement industry.

We value hard work, humble leadership, and spirited community. Teamwork is our driving force, and no human gets left behind!
If you want to wear a suit & tie to work every day, be chained to your desk from 9-5 Monday to Friday, with absolutely no benefits whatsoever and zero option for career advancement, this is NOT the place for you.

Any of this hit home for you? Tell us why you would make an excellent addition to our team!

NOTE: We will not read resumes without a cover letter.

RESPONSIBILITIES

As Social Media Manager, your time will be focused on overseeing the Webrunner brands’ online presence through various social media channels. Duties include creating engaging content, cultivating our online community, and developing social media strategies for target audiences.

Communicating our brand voice and humanizing our brand will be paramount.

Essentially, we’re looking for someone with the same creative eye for viral content as the Duolingo owl (if you're curious, take a look at Duolingo on TikTok!).

You should already have a working knowledge of social media best practices, understand the fundamentals of social media marketing, and be comfortable managing cross-platform campaigns.

Your performance will be measured by your ability to uncover new opportunities to grow Webrunner’s social media presence, engagement, and following.

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for someone who...

  • Has an insatiable desire to learn and hone their digital marketing chops
  • Is a team player. Teamwork makes the dream work, right?
  • Eats marketing blogs and podcasts for breakfast
  • Is disciplined, strategic, acts with high integrity, and is hungry to make a difference
  • Has exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Is analytical but doesn’t shy away from their creative side
  • Has completed some level of college education
  • Has 1-3 years of social media marketing experience

WHAT YOU’LL GET: LET’S TALK PERKS!
Respect & Recognition

  • We believe the best type of people are those who are self-motivators. Say goodbye to micro-managing! As long as productivity stays up and we are getting results, we let you spread your wings and fly on your own. After all, entrepreneurship is sexy.

Culture & Community

  • Our entire team is made up of the best kind of people you can find. We host frequent team-building activities and outings and believe that connection and community is #1. We value diversity and inclusivity and believe that corporate hierarchy is so 2008.

Health & Wellness

  • Rest easy with our extended health care plans, dental care, life insurance, and wellness program. Everyone needs a break, which is why we take paid time off seriously. We take care of you so that you can take care of you.

Flexible Work-Life Balance

  • You have a life; we get it! This is why we offer flexible hours for our crew. You’ll never be locked into a 9-5, so you can work from home in your PJ’s or join us at Webrunner HQ (did we mention we have a Nespresso machine?).

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $38,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • How many years of social media management experience do you have?
  • Tell us why you would like to work at Webrunner!

title: Marketing & Advertising Coordinator
description:
Marketing and Advertising Coordinator
Who we are

Media Message is an advertising, marketing, and public relations agency. We help small to medium businesses refine their message and find cost effective ways to deliver it to their stakeholders so they can grow their business. We become an extension of their marketing department. They rely on us to create a clear message and find cost effective ways to deliver it to their audience in print, broadcast, digital, and social media.

The Job

We are looking for a marketing and communications graduate to join our team as a full time employee. Media Message grew from a small freelance journalism business in 2005. We still rely on long-term freelance writers, graphic designer, photographers and videographers today. We are looking for someone who has a passion for marketing and communications and the ability to write or edit content, produce short videos, create e-Newsletters, navigate social media, and set up remarketing campaigns, among other things.

Most of our clients do business in the agriculture industry. It is therefore important that you have a sincere interest in agriculture and the agri-food industry because we spend most of our time working on Ag projects. You must be interested in agriculture and the equipment, inputs and technology that drives it.

We are very connected in the agriculture industry and will help you become fluent in the industry issues and jargon. Occasional travel within Canada may be required for conferences, tradeshows, and client events.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Execute marketing and advertising campaigns and assist with strategic communications research.
  • Manage social media campaigns that are specific to agriculture and connect with farmers on a daily basis.
  • Produce ads, e-newsletters, brochures, websites, videos, and other marketing tools and tactics with our team of contractors.
  • Research, create, edit, and distribute newsletters, press releases, brochures, blogs, tweets, videos, or other marketing materials.

Qualifications

  • Possess a Communications and/or Marketing degree or diploma, and some graphic design and email marketing experience.
  • Strong writing skills with solid understanding of grammar and great attention to detail.
  • A sincere interest in agriculture and farming is necessary. Knowledge of agricultural issues from an industry or farming perspective would be beneficial.
  • Team player who takes direction well and gets the job done on deadline with minimal supervision.
  • Functional knowledge of graphic design software, video creation tools and email marketing software.
  • Ability to work in both English and French would be an asset.
  • Willingness to relocate to central Alberta. Lacombe is a vibrant community of more than 13,000 people located 15 minutes north of Red Deer (population 100,000). Lacombe is approximately halfway between Calgary and Edmonton and is only a 2 hour drive to the mountains. We will consider experienced candidates who wish to work remotely from a home office although that is not our preference. Significant knowledge of agriculture is required for remote work to be considered.

This is an immediate full-time, permanent employment opportunity. Apply by April 20, 2022. Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for an interview. While we prefer that our new team member work in our office we will consider remote work for the right candidate. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. Include a cover letter that describes why you are interested in working in and learning about agriculture or explains your farm or agricultural experience/background.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $35,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $35,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
COVID-19 considerations:
We have work in a large office with few people with entrance into our building by appointment only. It is very easy for us to social distance. Everyone working in our building has been fully vaccinated.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Lacombe, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Language:

  • French (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-04-20

title: Graphic Designer (Contractor Position)
description:
Job description

Job Brief

A Graphic Designer is responsible for producing and overseeing digital and print creative solutions. A Graphic Designer must have extensive knowledge and experience in graphic design, visual branding, marketing collateral, website designs and other creative assets. In addition to working on design projects, a Graphic Designer must also have experience executing marketing projects from conception to production, including websites, brochures, product packaging and print management.

The Sproing Design team is responsible for creating and conceptualizing designs and collaborating with our team and our customers will be a large part of your position. This includes but is not limited to brand development, collateral development, logos, mood boards and brand boards, landing page designs, online and traditional marketing and preparing materials such as proofs, mocks, slugs, etc.

Job Duties/Tasks/Responsibilities

  • Oversee all design projects, from conception to delivery
  • Design original visual brands and supportive marketing collateral elements
  • Refine images, fonts and layouts using graphic design software
  • Apply typography techniques
  • Generate ideas to portray concepts and advertise products/services
  • Increase user-friendliness in digital products
  • Ensure deadlines are met
  • Stay up-to-date with industry developments and tools
  • Supporting the web development team with graphics and design for websites and landing pages
  • Design, create and coordinate the production of technical, corporate and promotional communications tools in English
  • Promote a corporate image including maintaining its identity, graphic standards and design of corporate brochures, handouts and internal documentation
  • Design and create modern graphics for new projects as well as concepts, design assets layouts for projects from print to web
  • Prepare and produce files based on supplied specifications for print, digital, social and event materials
  • Develop brand strategies, brand and company profiles, brand guidelines and standards
  • Meet and consult with clients to establish the overall look, graphic elements and content of communications materials and develop the graphic elements that meet the clients' objectives
  • Attention to detail is important along with the ability to review and proof projects for inconsistencies and typographical errors
  • Experience with the printing process - file preparation and print management

Qualifications

  • Must have 3+ years of graphic design experience
  • University Degree or Diploma in Communication Design or Graphic Design (or equivalent relevant experience)
  • Proven experience in marketing and advertising design
  • Proven ability to create original design concepts (no recycled ideas)
  • Strong understanding of graphic design principles and design fundamentals and apply them to all work (layouts, colours, typography, hierarchy, etc.)
  • Understanding of product life cycles, apparel development and brand development
  • You are fluent in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator),
  • You are fluent with MAC OS systems as well as G-Suite
  • You are familiar with various output file formats such as AI, PNG, PDF, EPS, JPEG/JPG and PNG

Job Types: Casual, Freelance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Graphic design: 3 years (preferred)

title: Digital Marketing Manager - Luxury Fashion
description:
About DOMREBEL:

DOMREBEL is an art and design studio based in Montréal, Canada, since 2003. The company is comprised of a number of multidisciplinary creative teams that express themselves through visual arts and fashion.

The company's mission is to encourage and promote creativity and self-expression. The name DOMREBEL is an acronym for the Latin words "Dominus Rebellis", which translate to "Master of Rebellion", and a spirit of anti-conformity lives within everything the brand aims to do and represent.

DOMREBEL collections are stocked at retailers in 35 countries, such as Harrods, Selfridges, Neiman Marcus, Saks 5th Avenue, Beymen, Tsum, Samaritaine, Lane Crawford, SKP, Harvey Nichols, The Collective, Rubaiyat and many more.

What You Will Deliver As E-Commerce Digital Marketing Manager:

- Responsible for overseeing, managing, and implementing all marketing strategies, activations, advertising and campaigns to reach new customers, increase brand awareness, establish brand position in marketplace and ultimately increase sales

- Responsible for hiring and managing all e-commerce and marketing employees and teams, as well as managing all suppliers and contractors

- Responsible to designing, implementing and managing the entire customer journey and customer experience

- Responsible for maintaining a clear brand identity across all communication touchpoints

- Responsible for P+L for the e-commerce department, including opex, forecasting, inventory management, margin maintenance

- Develop, implement and manage a strong LTV strategy, loyalty incentives and programs

- Establish new sales channels for the brand, such as affiliate marketing, platform partners and more

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $65,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Shopify: 2 years (preferred)
  • Facebook Advertising: 2 years (required)
  • Google Ads: 2 years (required)

title: Marketing Manager / Coordinator (Home Based)
description:
As a Marketing lead you will provide strategic and practical advice to boost our company’s marketing efforts.

You'll organize our activities and marketing strategy. The goal is to ensure that our marketing operations will engage our customers and outperform our competition. The main goal for this position is to increase our qualified lead volume and bring in new customers.

You are required to perform the following duties and undertake the following responsibilities in a professional manner:

  • Maintain, manage and execute our current content marketing marketing strategy on the following platforms; YouTube Videos, Instagram Marketing, Facebook Organic Posting & Outreach.
  • Lead the several marketing sub-departments (ie. YouTube channel team and email marketing team).
  • Study company profile and operations to understand its marketing needs, and adapt accordingly.
  • Develop and implement an outbound marketing strategy with the CEO. This includes prospect marketing on LinkedIn, Instagram as well as establishing a multi-touch social selling system.
  • Liaise with the marketing department and external vendors & contractors.
  • Prepare and update marketing reports to track KPIs and analyze results.

This is a remote position - so you will work from home

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $30,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Marketing: 2 years (required)
  • Marketing & Advertising Occupations: 2 years (required)

title: Content Marketing Manager - Remote (Canada / Europe)
description:
The Content Marketing Manager will be responsible for the execution of ChartMogul’s content and social media initiatives supporting the business strategy, marketing goals and organizational objectives. Through a detailed understanding of the core principles of marketing, corporate communications and social media, the Content Marketing Manager will coordinate highly successful communication campaigns and programs – through all phases of development, launch, and maintenance.


The role demands a broad scope of writing experience, so the ideal candidate will have the appropriate combination of solid copywriting ability, journalistic sensibility and editorial experience. You will develop content marketing assets to be used for website, lead generation campaigns, PR/corporate communications, social media and other channels. You’ll build communications that educate and engage prospects, customers, and partners and helps position the company as a thought leader within a highly competitive market.


Responsibilities:


  • Produce smart, engaging, industry-leading editorial content, to support marketing and other strategic initiatives. E.g. thought leadership content: develop thought leadership content (i.e., white papers, case studies, blogs, videos, social media posts) by collaborating with subject-matter experts
  • Manage the blog site and editorial calendar
  • Develop and deliver daily social media content to relevant communities that support business goals, while ensuring an effective and professional image
  • Regularly update web copy and digital content on the company’s website via content management system
  • Perform keyword research and link building in coordination with current business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities
  • Collaborate with internal teams through the content development cycle to ensure all projects are delivered on-time, on-strategy and support brand and business goals
  • Analyze the effectiveness of marketing communications and social media programs in real time by collecting data and producing reports. Ensure that insights are integrated into current and future strategies


What we're looking for


  • 3+ years of relevant experience in the B2B software industry
  • Native-level spoken and written English
  • Some technical foundation required — must be able to understand complex technical concepts and distill them in a clear and simple way for a wide audience
  • Exemplary writing and editing skills, in both short-form messaging and longer-form editorial work
  • Demonstrate brand management and content development experience in highly competitive, fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Strong track record of meeting business performance goals through the development and execution of innovative marketing communications programs
  • Strong working knowledge of, and experience, with established and emerging social media platforms (including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, Clubhouse, etc.)
  • Familiarity with SEO, search engine, social media and internet marketing industry trends, developments and best practices

Nice to have


  • Bachelor’s degree (B.A./B.S.) or equivalent in communications, marketing, journalism/English, advertising or related discipline
  • Experience using website content management systems preferred
  • Intermediate level of graphic design and HTML skills is a plus
  • Experience with Intercom, Autopilot or other marketing automation systems


What is it like to work at ChartMogul?
  • You’ll join the adventures of an early-stage company and experience what it means to have an incredibly impactful job
  • You’ll become part of a team of nice, awesome, and highly dedicated people who all have the same mission: Helping companies build better businesses
  • Flexible hours with healthy work-life balance
  • All employees, including contractors, receive sick days, paid holiday days, and paternity leave
  • You’ll receive a great salary pack (market or upmarket)!


Application Process

  • Review application
  • Initial call with Recruiter
  • Team interview with Marketing Director & PMM
  • Short take-home assessment
  • Assessment review call with PMM & Senior Analyst
  • Final call with CEO
  • Ref checks
  • Offer


This is a full-time remote position. Please note that we are only able to consider applicants who are eligible to work in Canada or Europe at this time.

title: Senior Manager Brand Marketing
description:
About Avaya

Businesses are built by the experiences they provide, and every day millions of those experiences are delivered by Avaya Holdings Corp. (NYSE: AVYA). Avaya is shaping what's next for the future of work, with innovation and partnerships that deliver game-changing business benefits. Our cloud communications solutions and multi-cloud application ecosystem power personalized, intelligent, and effortless customer and employee experiences to help achieve strategic ambitions and desired outcomes. Together, we are committed to help grow your business by delivering Experiences that Matter. Learn more at www.avaya.com.

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

This role is remote anywhere within the U.S. or Canada. Applicants must already be located within the U.S. or Canada and roles are not eligible for sponsorship. Are you passionate about branding? Do you excel at changing the perception of a company simply by creating its own best version of itself? Not everyone has the skills or the creative mindset. If you’re the right person, as the Senior Brand Marketing Manager for Avaya, you’ll have these opportunities to grow and amplify our $3B brand and more. And you’ll have a 100-year head start for building on our legacy in communications and making our brand even more relevant today.

What to know about Avaya:

  • We’re a global leader in cloud communications and collaboration, with customers in over 190 countries
  • We service 90% of the Fortune 100 companies in the U.S.
  • Our company has a rich history dating back to the origins of AT&T over 100 years ago
  • Today, we’re recognized for our innovation and leadership in contact center and communications
  • We have a workplace that is vibrant, diverse, high-performing, and inclusive

As a key member of the Brand and Editorial team, you’ll act as Avaya’s brand guardian, maintaining brand integrity and strengthening our identity. You’ll help support every aspect of our business, from strategy to execution, across all company marketing initiatives and communications, and our portfolio of solutions.

ABOUT THE RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead Avaya’s brand strategy, including the setting of style guides, brand guidelines, brand vision and value proposition.
  • Commission research, synthesize information, and analyze data to continually optimize positioning, inform briefs, and track brand perception and performance.
  • Work across the organization for brand alignment and set policies for adhering to brand guidelines with business leads, agency partners and media.
  • Monitor, evaluate, and understand innovative marketing activity within our industry and best in class everywhere.
  • Support planning and execution of brand marketing campaigns.
  • Manage corporate sponsorships and ensure the integrity and accurate representation of the Avaya brand.
  • Manage Avaya solution brands, including naming and nomenclature strategy and execution.
  • Review materials to ensure brand consistency and assist or advise as required.
  • Manage relationships with vendors who supply brand-related deliverables.
  • Manage our internal website as the source for distributing/supplying brand materials.
  • Mentor individuals and teams, worldwide, regarding best practices for brand consistency.
  • Collaborate with our global marketing teams regularly to help interpret the brand in international markets.
  • Own the brand marketing budget and translate brand objectives into detailed budget and resource plans.

#LI-LD1

#LI-Remote

ABOUT THE REQUIREMENTS

EXPERIENCE:

  • 10+ years experience in marketing B2B or B2C technology in client environments or marketing/advertising/branding agencies or consultancies
  • Experience in SaaS or technology marketing and promotion
  • Experience in brand development and compliance
  • Experience with global brands preferred

SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:

  • Strong background in strategic brand development and management
  • Ability to focus on both brand image and public perception
  • Ability to interpret brand strategy into tactical executions such as brand look, feel and messaging
  • Ability to evaluate creative materials and help teams align to brand
  • Ability to simplify and streamline internal processes ensuring brand compliance
  • Experience in developing and managing naming and nomenclature strategy across product lines
  • Strong cross-functional and project management skills to manage internal and external teams and projects
  • Effective in fast-paced, highly competitive category
  • Strong focus on results
  • Relationship and management skills; great communicator

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATION:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Marketing, Communications, Advertising, or related fields

COMPENSATION - SECTION PERTAINS TO COLORADO APPLICANTS ONLY

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary of $115,100.00 + bonus + benefits.
  • Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

Footer

Explore our current opportunities @ https://www.avaya.com/en/about-avaya/careers/welcome/

Follow #AVAYALIFE & visit our ‘Life Page’ on LinkedIn

Avaya is an Equal Opportunity employer and a U.S. Federal Contractor. Our commitment to equality is a core value of Avaya. All qualified applicants and employees receive equal treatment without consideration for race, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other protected characteristic. In general, positions at Avaya require the ability to communicate and use office technology effectively. Physical requirements may vary by assigned work location. This job brief/description is subject to change. Nothing in this job description restricts Avaya right to alter the duties and responsibilities of this position at any time for any reason. You may also review the Avaya Global Privacy Policy, accessible at https://www.avaya.com/en/privacy/policy/ and applicable Privacy Statement relevant to this job posting accessible at https://www.avaya.com/en/documents/info-applicants.pdf.
