title: Vice President, Area Marketing
description:
The Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (C&I) marketing team is responsible for driving marketplace demand for innovative products and services to address the evolving risk and cyber security needs of all of MasterCard’s various customer segments. The C&I team was established with the responsibility to safeguard all aspects of safety and security in payments and have made great strides with new products, services and standards, positively impacting all aspects of our current and future payment eco-system. One of the fastest growing areas in C&I is Identity Services.

Role:

The VP of Area Marketing is responsible for developing and maintaining marketing strategies to meet organizational and revenue objectives, increasing brand recognition, and building a unified marketing and messaging platform to establish Mastercard’s NuData solutions and a growing range of innovative identity services as an industry leader.

The VP Marketing is responsible multiple marketing disciplines and for developing, managing, and directing all aspects of Mastercard’s evolving Identity Services area, with continued focus on maintaining strong demand generation and thought leadership focus on NuData products. The VP will lead and maximize the efforts of the marketing, public relations, design, and analyst teams, to implement a broad range of marketing and supported sales programs taking existing marketing and sales efforts to an enterprise level.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Direct and oversee marketing campaigns including branding, public relations, advertising, content development, events, sales tools, analyst and market research, and online content either directly or on an outsourced basis.
  • Assume overall responsibility for developing annual marketing plan; ensuring alignment with organizational and revenue objectives, to guide quarterly and annual strategies and programs.
  • Drive integrated demand generation programs utilizing all available marketing channels and tactics, including: direct/outbound marketing, SEO/SEM, in-persona and virtual events, webinars, advertising, industry research downloads and content syndication, trade media sponsorships, channel marketing programs, and targeted media relations.
  • Lead a growing team of marketers to drive visibility of key business metrics including leads, MQLs, SQLs and Opportunities; monitor, evaluate and report on the effectiveness of the strategies and programs across the Cyber & Intelligence organization.
  • Increase thought leadership and brand recognition within our potential customer base, analyst community and relevant industries.
  • Develop positioning and messaging that differentiates Mastercard Identity Services and NuData solutions in the market and resonates with target markets, segments and personas.
  • Working closely with Mastercard communications team members, develop and execute awareness-building programs including advertising, public relations, analyst relations and social media.
  • Build strong cross-functional relationships with adjacent Mastercard teams, including the sales and product organization, to ensure marketing programs support identified priorities and revenue objectives.

Core Competencies and Skills:

  • Demonstrated experience in all required marketing skills commensurate with Vice President level in the Marketing & Communications discipline.
  • Previous experience in the security and identity domains preferred.
  • Proven demand generation and sales-funnel based skills, including marketing automation and the sales opportunity management lifecycle.
  • Strategic, analytical, and systematic thinker who consistently challenges the status quo and constructively challenges the team to drive change and continuous improvement.
  • Strategy and leadership mindset: driving and influencing team, coaching, mentoring, clearing obstacles necessary to achieve objectives/outcomes, and developing overall team culture.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communications skills in English.
  • Hands-on, resourceful and nimble, while also able to navigate a global matrix environment; consistently turns strategies into execution and measurable outcomes.
  • Cooperate with others to accomplish common goals, work with employees within and across the organization, treat others with dignity and respect while maintaining a positive attitude.

COVID-19 Considerations

We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. In many locations, which may change over time, we’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by video or phone. In addition, in some locations, only individuals who have been fully vaccinated will be permitted inside Mastercard offices until further notice.

In the US, Mastercard is a government contractor, which may legally require most Mastercard employees to be vaccinated unless a verified approved medical or religious exemption is granted. Further, we are currently making every effort towards having employees return to work in the office 2 days per week, if that makes sense for their team. Everyone must be vaccinated to enter Mastercard offices at this time. Therefore, we expect all candidates to be vaccinated or to be approved for a medical or religious accommodation prior to commencing work at Mastercard.

Corporate Security Responsibility
All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

  • Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
  • Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
  • Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
  • Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Sales Executive
description:
Position Name
Sales Executive

  • Functional Area*

Sales

Location
Toronto, Canada

  • Job Type*

Contractor

**
Summary
VDX.tv is a global advertising technology company that is transforming the way brands connect with relevant consumers through video. VDX.tv creates video-driven experiences that integrate a brand’s TV and digital messages and empower marketers to captivate viewers, compel action, and convert awareness into a response.

We are looking for a passionate, enthusiastic and driven Sales Executive for a temporary 14-16 month maternity leave contract. The Sales Executive is responsible for championing our VDX video solutions and driving revenue growth amongst an existing territory and new client base. As a Sales Executive you will be responsible for managing existing client relationships while prospecting and building new ones, developing strategic sales plans and presentations. You will achieve your revenue targets by selling digital advertising solutions across the VDX.tv platform to both client direct and agency partners.

Responsibilities

  • Maximize revenue growth within an established territory, while also growing your client base
  • Engage client decision makers at all levels, educating them on how

VDX.tv is uniquely positioned to meet their business objectives and add value to their marketing mix

  • Identify and evaluate new sales opportunities, championing

VDX.tv’s omni channel video solution

  • Plan, prepare and execute high impact meetings with prospects and clients
  • Identify and develop a strong understanding of client's core objectives and challenges and tailor presentations and proposals based on client’s needs
  • Utilize research in presentations and interactions with prospects and clients
  • Develop winning selling strategies and proposals and present to our advertising partners at the client and agency levels
  • Accurately forecast revenue growth and provide regular business updates and accurate CRM tracking
  • Collaborate with internal teams across the globe to service clients and ensure campaign success

Required Skills

  • Superior skills in all facets of the sales cycle including prospecting, negotiating, and the ability to sell based on value - not price
  • Proven communication, presentation and sales skills with a knack for consultative selling
  • Proven ability to strategically establish and manage client accounts that generate revenue and growth

Qualifications

  • 3+ years progressive experience in relevant client-direct and agency sales
  • Disciplined self-starter who can work autonomously as well as being an integral team member
  • Excellent understanding of video advertising, industry dynamics and campaign buying and planning
  • Strong knowledge of ad campaign metrics and analysis

Job Type: Contract

title: Marketing Manager
company: Museum of Contemporary Art Toronto Canada
description:
The Museum of Contemporary Art Toronto is at the heart of the art ecosystem. MOCA will be ambitiously inclusive, interdisciplinary, and internationally renowned through our work with artists and a place for everyone to explore, provoke ideas, and challenge the current cultural moment.

We intend to achieve this vision through our mission:

  • To present rotating exhibitions and programmes that prioritize twenty-first-century artistic production, primarily through the commissioning of new work
  • To foster active dialogue and participation, celebrate complexity, and serve as an inclusive cultural hub in a hyper-diverse city and world.

Our values guide our work:

  • Equitable, inclusive, and accessible
  • Artist-centred, interdisciplinary, and process-oriented
  • Critical and transformative
  • Reciprocal and relationship-based
  • Locally rooted and globally connected
  • Courageous and responsible

MOCA has been actively adapting to the evolving situation regarding COVID-19 and will continue to do so, ensuring staff and visitor safety and striving to maintain a supportive work environment.

Position Summary

Location: Toronto, Ontario
Employment Type: Full-Time
Reporting to: Executive Director, working in tandem with the Chief Curator
Other: Works closely with the contractors and Digital Project Manager
Salary: $65,000–$70,000
Position Closes: May 29, 2022

MOCA is looking for a Marketing Manager to take on the day-to-day and project management of marketing and communications activities for the museum. Reporting to the Executive Director, working closely with the Artistic Director, the Marketing Manager will be instrumental in communicating MOCA as the preeminent destination for contemporary art in Toronto and manage the delivery of campaigns that increase awareness of MOCA and its programmes to optimize growth in attendance and membership, strengthen community engagement and drive revenue.

Responsibilities

Audience Development

  • Coordinate with curators, programmers and marketing and PR consultants to develop audience targets and marketing strategies for individual exhibitions, events and programmes to increase new visitor numbers, attendance revenue and deepen engagement with existing audience segments through the lifecycle
  • Work collaboratively with the development/fundraising team to develop and execute marketing strategies for membership and events /donors and support other fundraising initiatives as needed
  • Create strategy to achieve and sustain growth targets for social platforms working closely with the Digital Project Manager
  • Manage activities that support brand awareness and audience development goals, ranging from exhibition listings to special promotions and activations around the city

Digital Marketing Management

In collaboration with the Digital Project Manager:

  • Manage daily hands-on social media planning, posting, boosting, sharing, and engagement for MOCA’s Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube accounts
  • Plan and prepare content, edit, and deploy email communication, including email newsletters, marketing emails, event invitations, etc.

Campaign & Project Management * Act as campaign/project manager, working collaboratively with internal team members as well as marketing and communication consultants and designers to coordinate streamlined and timely information sharing, resources and assets, edits, and approvals

  • Work closely with the development and programming teams to ensure contact lists are updated and segmented in increasingly sophisticated ways
  • Manage content creation (video, web, photography, graphic design) for MOCA’s marketing platforms
  • Manage our media relations strategies, working closely with outside agency as necessary, to promote MOCA’s exhibitions, programmes, events and key fundraising announcements

Data & Analytics Management * Support market research and visitor evaluation for each exhibition phase

  • Analyze visitor data to define key areas for growth

Marketing Administration Management * Create and manage content calendars

  • Manage marketing production calendars, assign and supervise work
  • Develop and maintain a marketing dashboard with key analytics/metrics
  • Assist with marketing budget planning and forecasting. Manage the marketing budget and allocate resources accordingly
  • Oversee asset/content file management and archive
  • Research and monitor museum marketing best practices
  • Support digital and communications initiatives of other departments as necessary
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications & Attributes

Experience and Skills

  • University degree in a related field
  • 3-5 years demonstrated brand management, campaign marketing and content development experience at a manager level, preferably in a not-for-profit cultural organization
  • Ability to translate and interpret complex concepts and information for various audiences in a way that is consistent with MOCA’s brand
  • Excellent writing skills, and an understanding of different writing and content lengths for different platforms
  • Strong visual literacy and ability to effectively direct content creators
  • Experience in advertising, tourism management, digital campaigns, audience development, and research
  • Proven experience in implementing SEO/SEM strategies
  • Ability to generate, analyze and interpret data using digital analytics tools (Google Analytics, Sprout Social, UTM codes, sales software)
  • Outstanding communication, writing, administrative and organizational skills
  • Remain focused in the face of pressure, delivers against timelines, not intimidated by tasks/time limitations
  • Interest in contemporary art, visual arts, and MOCA’s mission an asset

Note

  • Some evening/early-morning/weekend work may be required to attend to marketing and communications needs for MOCA’s events and programmes. MOCA’s offices are hybrid in-person at the museum in Toronto and from home.

Equity and Diversity

MOCA Toronto advocates equal opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment and is committed to diversity in the workplace.

MOCA Toronto is committed to ensuring that MOCA Toronto is an inclusive space where community members are treated with respect and dignity. MOCA Toronto encourages applications from everyone, including but not limited to women, indigenous peoples, visible minorities, people with disabilities and persons of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

How to Apply

Please apply using the application form. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $65,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Marketing and Business Development
description:
O’Botz is a multi-disciplinary robotics program with a specially designed curriculum to teach young children about robotics and coding. A very unique 7 level program with a take away kit at each level O’Botz induces love for physics, electronics machine designing and coding. With close to 30 locations across Ontario, Quebec and British Columbia O’Botz Robotics is all set to take its next leap in next few years.

Web page - https://obotz.ca/

Responsibilities: -

· Perform a competitive analysis to determine what marketing tactics are useful.

· Have good in-depth knowledge about current digital media and other marketing trends in education industry

· Analyze sales statistics and use them to report on the success of marketing campaigns and products

· Analyse the success of previous and current marketing campaigns, negotiating with social media influencers and other contractors, and coordinate their actions and marketing strategies with other departments.

· Oversee the company’s social media pages and Google reviews

· Work with other members of the marketing agency such as SEO Specialists, Website Analytics Specialists, Design Specialists, or others to help ensure successful marketing campaigns.

· Review posts, put together analytical reviews, and implement social media advertising

· Work to list the most effective medium/media to advertise for each product or service

· Manage lead generation and ensure that the leads are passed on to the right people and then get involved in the follow-ups and report the conversion statistics.

· Follow up with leads

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-op
Contract length: 6 months
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
All Standard COVID precautions are followed.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Business development: 1 year (required)

Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: Sales Account Executive
description:
Dear problem-solvers, relationship-builders, and straight-A students who skipped class: We want you.

ENVIRONMENT

Nice to meet you! We’re Webrunner, and we help contractors across North America generate exclusive leads through data-driven paid advertising campaigns.

Our HQ is based just outside of Montreal, QC, and our crew is made up of a diverse group of folk who believe that impactful work is the best kind of work. Our people are driving the digital transformation of the home improvement industry.

We value hard work, humble leadership, and spirited community. Teamwork is our driving force, and no human gets left behind!

If you want to wear a suit & tie to work every day, be chained to your desk from 9-5 Monday to Friday, with absolutely no benefits whatsoever and zero option for career advancement, this is definitely NOT the place for you.

Any of this hit home for you? Tell us why you would make an excellent addition to our team!

NOTE: We will not read resumes without a cover letter

RESPONSIBILITIES

As a sales account executive, your time will be focused on outbound prospecting activities to generate leads for our digital marketing service geared toward home improvement businesses across Canada & the US.

As the first point of contact clients will have with Webrunner, you should be an expert relationship builder.

You should already know customer relationship management software, prospecting tools and understand sales fundamentals.

Your performance will be measured by your ability to successfully generate new leads and business opportunities from home service companies looking to generate more qualified and exclusive leads for themselves.

QUALIFICATIONS

We are looking for someone who...

  • Can perform research to find prospects and key decision-makers
  • Has a knack for relationship building and conversation-starting
  • Is self-motivated, autonomous, and driven to succeed
  • Is disciplined, strategic, acts with high integrity, and is hungry to make a difference
  • Enjoys learning about how digital marketing can grow businesses
  • Has exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Is analytical but doesn’t shy away from their creative side
  • Has completed some level of college education
  • Has 2-3 years of professional sales experience (marketing-related is a plus!)
  • Can speak French (not necessary, but helpful)

P.S.Cover letters > CVs

WHAT YOU’LL GET: LET’S TALK PERKS!

Respect & Recognition

  • We believe the best type of people are those who are self-motivators. Say goodbye to micro-managing! As long as productivity stays up and we are getting results, we let you spread your wings and fly on your own. After all, entrepreneurship is sexy.

Culture & Community

  • Our entire team is made up of the best kind of people you can find. We host frequent team-building activities and outings and believe that connection and community is #1. We value diversity and inclusivity and believe that corporate hierarchy is so 2008.

Health & Wellness

  • Rest easy with our extended health care plans, dental care, life insurance, and wellness program. Everyone needs a break, which is why we take paid time off seriously. We take care of you so that you can take care of you.

Flexible Work-Life Balance

  • You have a life, we get it! This is why we offer flexible hours for our crew. You’ll never be locked into a 9-5 so you can work from home in your PJ’s or join us at Webrunner HQ (did we mention we have a Nespresso machine?).

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • How many years of sales experience do you have?
  • Tell us why you would like to work at Webrunner!

title: newExecutive Director
description:
The Club
The Club, located in Vancouver, operates food & beverage service several nights a week with various special events for members throughout the year on weekends and other evenings. It also includes kayak and SUP equipment rental for members, plus other marina services. The lounge space is available for rent for private events such as meetings, weddings, and celebrations.

The Role
Serve as the poised, professional, inviting first point of contact for the club, a driven self-starter who exudes service and hospitality and works well independently with minimal supervision and can take the initiative to improve all aspects of the Club including administration, marketing, basic bookkeeping, operations, and executive support to create a friendly, casual, yet first-class Member Experience.

Manage all aspects of the club including its staff, activities and the relationships between the Club and its Board of Directors, Committees, members, guests, employees, contractors, community, government, and industry. Maintain the electronic files, database, update the member portal/website weekly.

Develop and implement marketing and sales strategies coordinate with Membership Director on recruitment strategies towards attracting new members.

Continuously raise the bar for member satisfaction/engagement, employee service levels, and overall quality of dining and other experiences, including creating a pristine yet casual clubhouse, office, and boardroom that can be proudly shown to potential members or event planners at any time.

Coordinate and administer the club’s policies as defined by its Board of Directors and ensure that they support the organization’s values. Follow and document efficient and effective Standard Operating Procedures and manage the staff and the work of all department heads including accounting and food and beverage.

Implement and monitor the budget to ensure financial performance is met or exceeded, monitor the quality of the club’s products and services, and ensure optimal member and guest satisfaction.

Perform daily bookkeeping duties including billing and other basic transactions.

Secure and protect the club’s assets, including facilities and equipment.

Flexible hours to accommodate daytime deliveries and walk-ins while also being an occasional visible presence during member nights to pick up the pulse of the Club.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Office Administration:

  • Manage general office functions including responding to telephone and online inquiries on behalf of the Club and the distribution and control over security fobs, parking passes, keys, mail, supplies etc.
  • Maintain control over the Club administrative files and documents, both electronic and physical, including correspondence as required by the Board of Directors
  • Ensure content on the Club’s website and member portal is updated regularly and that an online newsletter is distributed weekly.
  • Maintain the integrity of the membership database
  • Oversee accounting functions including basic bookkeeping and financial management including budgets, financial reports, and KPIs relating to membership fees and other charges, wages and creditors, process daily transactions.

House Management:

  • Management of staff including accounting, administrative and food and beverage.
  • Promote, sell and manage all facility bookings including preparation of contracts, liaison with external event planners, catering contractor, and staff scheduling.
  • Liaise with Social Committee to create schedule of members’ social evenings beyond regular member nights, deemed “Social Events”, plus create a calendar of “Special Events” which will attract non-members to the club.
  • Manage house inventories (including beverages in conjunction with the Lounge Manager), Club apparel, etc.
  • Oversee efficient scheduling and management of Lounge Waitstaff with the Lounge Manager
  • Actively liaise with and manage the working relationship with the Club caterer

Member Liaison:

  • Manage recruitment, sales, and onboarding for new members
  • Manage and document member inquiries and complaints in a timely manner and report to the Board, on member issues, complaints and requests as required.
  • Demonstrate solid understanding of the Club Bylaws and Regulations when responding to members.

Promotion

  • Assist the club's Board of Directors in developing and executing promotional campaigns to enhance club image and grow membership
  • Assist the club's Board of Directors with annual advertising and promotion campaigns, to include related budget planning.
  • Provide support to the club's Boat Show coordinator, in accordance with the annually issued VIBS instructions, and
  • Act as point of contact with marketing and/or promotion vendors.

Facilities Management:

  • Manage repairs and scheduled maintenance, by arranging vendors, contractors, and staff for all aspects of the Club, including dock maintenance as identified by the Wharfinger and/or Rear Commodore House.

Board Relationship:

  • Liaise and assist the Board of Directors as required to streamline and simplify the execution of their duties
  • Prepare a monthly summary and/or electronic dashboard for the Board covering each area of operation
  • Coordinate Board meetings and distribution of minutes and related documents to members.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Post-Secondary Education in Business Administration and/or hospitality
  • A minimum five years' recent experience in a similar position
  • Experience in successfully arranging and creating, managing, coordinating events
  • Proven track record of securing new clients and increasing bookings and sales
  • Proven ability to work with financial reports. Bookkeeping certificate and equivalent experience an asset.
  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software and Google products such as Google Drive, Calendar and Gmail
  • Experience with Club Management systems is desirable.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Discretion and the ability to handle confidential documentation with a high level of professionalism
  • Proven ability to provide excellent customer service and create and maintain effective working relationships with members, clients, external stakeholders, and staff
  • Exceptional organization skills, accuracy, attention to detail, strong sense of good judgment, and high level of customer service
  • A tenacious problem solver with the ability to lead each staff member to highest standards of performance and job satisfaction for lounge operations and events
  • Ability to successfully handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines
  • Excellent written and verbal communications
  • Good negotiation skills
  • A good sense of humour desirable.

Compensation: base salary commensurate with experience plus performance-based bonus based on goals reached in areas of overall performance including membership growth, banquet sales, operations management, event management, member engagement, and overall leadership.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $75,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flextime
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Application question(s):

  • Can you reliably communicate to this jobs location?
  • Can you work overtime if necessary?
  • Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law and regulations?

Experience:

  • management: 1 year (required)

title: SEO Specialist
description:
I am a web & IT contractor/freelancer and am ready to begin expanding my business and delegating my workload. One of my roles is Search Engine Optimization - specifically on WordPress website.

I am looking for someone located in Oakville/Burlington who can take on an SEO specialist role. My services fall under the complete umbrella of digital marketing so this includes analytics/reporting, webmaster tools (such as Google My Business), as well as ad management (Google Ads). I will also get you setup on SEMrush eventually.

As I don't have a physical location you will work from home. You'll need your own computer, with a high-speed internet connection, as well as a mic when needed for meetings.

In terms of hours, they will be small initially, but gradually expanding into a full-time or part-time role depending on your availability.

To apply, send me a resume with previous experience as well as your availability and location. If accepted, I'll reach out to you for an online interview and go from there.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Review and monitor analytics to provide recommendations and reporting
  • Optimizing copy and landing pages for search engine optimization
  • Performing ongoing keyword research including discovery and expansion of keyword opportunities
  • Researching and implementing content recommendations for organic SEO
  • Manage, Review, and Optimize Google Ads
  • Manage Webmaster tools such as Google My Business
  • Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to achieve maximum ROI in paid search campaigns
  • Track, report, and analyze website analytics and PPC initiatives and campaigns
  • Manage campaign expenses, staying on budget, estimating monthly costs and reconciling discrepancies.
  • Optimize copy and landing pages for search engine marketing
  • Perform ongoing keyword discovery, expansion and optimization
  • Research and implement search engine optimization recommendations
  • Research and analyze competitor advertising links
  • Develop and implement link building strategy
  • Work with the development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code
  • Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content programming
  • Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords.

Requirements & Qualifications
*

  • Proven SEO experience
  • Proven SEM experience managing PPC campaigns across Google, Yahoo and Bing.
  • Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition
  • In-depth experience with website analytics tools (e.g, Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends)
  • Certifications are preferred, but not required
  • Must be able to juggle multiple projects at the same time

Job Types: Casual, Freelance, Internship / Co-op

Salary: $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
remote position

Experience:

  • Digital Marketing Occupations: 1 year (preferred)

title: newOperations Manager
description:
Dr. Marcia Hartt Medical Aesthetics, a thriving medical aesthetic practice in Southwest Edmonton, is seeking an energetic, team-oriented individual for the role of Operations Manager.

The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in executing all aspects of the attached job description which provides the detailed responsibilities for the role.

The intention of this role is to own the day-to-day operational responsibilities. This role will work very closely with Dr. Hartt and will develop well-balanced communication practices to keep Dr. Hartt connected to the important aspects of the clinic.

The ideal candidate will have a degree in business and will have at least 5 years experience in a similar managerial position with overall responsibility for the operations of a business.

You will also bring to the company:

  • An expertise and drive towards operational and financial excellence
  • The ability to develop and oversee protocols, procedures, and processes to ensure smooth continuity within and between systems and processes
  • The ability to develop a foundation for scale and growth of the business

If you are interested in being part of a dedicated team that provides outstanding service complemented by an unparalleled level of professionalism, then this opening is for you!

Please note that upon applying you will be asked to complete a questionnaire and quiz. This process may take up to 30 minutes to complete.


OPERATIONS MANAGER JOB DESCRIPTION:

Overview

The Operations Manager will enable the client-facing members of the team to focus on providing their amazing client experience by ensuring the day-to-day operations run smoothly. The Operations Manager will also track and monitor all the financial and operational key performance indicators to ensure the business meets its objectives and standards of operation.

The Operations Manager will also support and help to execute strategic initiatives determined by the owner of the Clinic Dr. Marcia Hartt. This will likely include supporting the growth and scale-up of the existing operations beyond its current capacity.

Areas of Oversight and Responsibility

All of the areas of oversight are underpinned with a view towards scalability, operational excellence and an awesome place to be a team member and a client.

Team Engagement:

  • Demonstrate and encourage the Clinic’s Core Values
  • Support an environment of open communication and positive morale
  • Encourage the strengths of the team and provide leadership and coaching
  • Lead recruiting activities
  • Lead off-boarding activities
  • Ensure training activities are well defined and effective
  • Ensure operational protocols and processes are well designed and are being adhered to by all staff
  • Ensure that Team Leads are effectively managing their staff’s schedules, including reviewing, approving and tracking time off requests
  • Hold regular (monthly at a minimum) meetings with staff and provide an open platform for communication
  • Educate staff on how to promote spa services and products
  • Ensure staff aware of promotions, how to market via phone/in person etc.
  • Ensure that the Clinic is adhering to Alberta Employment Standards

Client Engagement:

  • Ensure clients greeted courteously and in same manner by all employees. Ensure employees following scripts, shaking hands, offering tea etc.
  • Cater to clients special requests, needs & ensure expectations met
  • Ensure client complaints are follow-up within 24 hours and are documented and filed
  • Work with staff to resolve complaints, including re-training if necessary
  • Ensure our client’s spa experience with us is memorable
  • Monitor social media reviews and follow-up with any negative reviews
  • Develop and carry out metrics to measure client satisfaction (e.g. through online reviews)
  • Develop a deep understanding of the Clinic's client management and point of sale system (Insight)
  • Attract new clients and retain existing clients by identifying current and future needs through client rapport and conversation with staff
  • Ensure client charts and consent forms are completed and well organized

Marketing:

  • Develop & implement marketing strategies and campaigns
  • Assist with strategies to sell almost expired or discontinued products
  • Create monthly specials and showcase in spa
  • Assist in creating membership incentives and sales promotions leading to a larger client base
  • Assist with the creation of marketing material including newsletters, posters, social media posts and digital billboard ideas
  • Carry out all marketing, promotional and advertising campaigns, as directed

Financial:

  • Participate in setting financial goals and track progress against those goals
  • Communicate payroll information (including commissions) to bookkeeper for payroll processing
  • Provide bookkeeper with information on a monthly basis to prepare financial statements
  • Work with owner and accountant to establish budgets and adjust operations as required to meet targets and budgets
  • Ensure vendor invoices and packing slips are provided to Dr. Hartt for payment
  • Ensure that the daily close out data/receipts are balanced

Inventory Management:

  • Organize routine counts of retail and backbar/testers, including “expiration date” counts
  • Ensure physical controls over inventory
  • Place orders for retail products, service supplies and equipment
  • Assist with negotiation of prices, contracts with vendors

Facilities Management:

  • Ensure spa is stocked with toiletries, office supplies etc.
  • Ensure compliance with health and safety codes
  • Manage Spa cleanliness
  • Manage Office and General Equipment
  • Maintain IT equipment and support contractors
  • Maintain laundry equipment, call in support as required
  • Contact owner or Property Management company if problems with heat, AC, leaks etc.

Ideal Skills and Traits

  • Proficient with social media
  • Professional
  • Problem solving ability
  • Independent and resourceful
  • Attention to detail
  • Organized
  • Accountable
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Knows when to ask for help
  • Attitude of lifelong learning

title: Sales and Marketing Executive
description:
Company Information:

We are a fintech company that specialized in building and marketing direct to consumer services within the Credit, Identity Protection and financial management verticals. We build, own and operate not only our own products but also develop many of our own marketing channels.

Take this opportunity to work at a fast growing company in an industry that is thriving even during these tough times. A great chance to re-establish yourself in a stable industry that is always hiring.

All of our positions are work from home so you not only get the benefit of working in a great business sector but also in the comfort of your own home.

Job Description:

This position is responsible for prospecting and closing new partnership opportunities. The individual will be responsible for prospecting and closing new partners as well as maintaining those relationships on a day-to-day basis. The ideal person will be very confident and able to negotiate on his or her terms.

Use your exceptional skills in sales, relationship-building and analytics to manage, grow and monitor partners in order to increase revenue opportunities while contributing to the overall company goals and objectives.

Responsibilities:

Research, identify and source business relationships with publishers, relevant financial websites, affiliate networks, emailers, sms, social, search and even incent marketing companies that will help further the company’s strategic roadmap.

Prospect and schedule phone/video calls, in person meetings at tradeshows (eventually).

Structure, negotiate and close deals with partners, actively nurturing a robust deal pipeline

Partner with internal Marketing Services team on items requiring cross-department collaboration

Coordinate deal implementation between external partners and internal departments

Qualifications:

2+ years of sales/marketing experience; online sales a plus!

Strong telephone/chat/written skills.

Strong negotiation and deal making skills.

Exceptional oral and written communicator across all levels of the company.

A consultative, educational sales approach balanced with assumptive transactional style.

Must be responsive, resourceful, professional, proactive and an independent problem solver.

Affinity with various computer programs and ability to pick up new systems quickly.

Understanding of online advertising measurements including but not limited to EPC, CR%, CPC, CPM, CPA, and CPI.

Experience with Microsoft suite of products; particularly Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

Willingness to learn and apply yourself towards achieving the company’s goals.

Preference for someone based in Canada

Initially this will be setup as a contractor position (30+ hours a week) with the eventual opportunity to move into full time employee status.

Benefits:

  • Flexible working hours
  • Work from home opportunities

Work Remotely

  • Yes

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $28,224.00-$83,548.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • online marketing: 1 year (preferred)

title: Creative Director, Design
description:
Over 100,000 businesses and millions of people use 1Password to protect their most important information, and we believe those people – and the companies they work for – shouldn’t have to choose between security and productivity. We see security as a human challenge, rather than a technological one. It’s hard work, but our mission has always been to ease the tension between security and convenience and help people navigate the digital world without fear or friction. Human-centric security is part of our DNA, but human-centricity is also the backbone of our culture. We encourage big ideas and new ways of working that help us to make the online world a safer place for everyone.

The 1Password marketing team is committed to helping consumers and businesses everywhere keep their most sensitive data, trade secrets and important information that needs the ultimate protection.

We live that mission by providing the most rewarding and useful digital experiences without compromising our users' privacy. This may sound like a challenge to modern digital marketers, but we know this is the future, and our team is leading the charge. If you’re passionate about trust, privacy, and inventing the future of ethical marketing, Why not come work with us?

We're looking for a strategic and collaborative Creative Director with a strong storytelling background to guide and bring to life 1Password’s brand across a variety of audiences, channels and markets. You'll play an important leadership role directing a talented team of designers, illustrators and creative types, and work cross-functionally with business partners across the company. You will collaborate with leaders in Design, Product, Marketing and People teams to drive the creation of strategic, compelling, design solutions across an expanding range of projects from visual, video to motion graphics. You'll also manage creative talent in the team with a focus on inspiring teams to want to do their best work, continue developing new skills and thrive in a collaborative, busy environment.

What we're looking for:

  • A portfolio of work that demonstrates your deep understanding of design knowledge, conceptual thinking, experimentation, and brand work
  • 10+ years of experience working in an advertising, design, or journalism environment
  • Preferred experience of managing and leading designers and creatives across a variety of disciplines: Design, Copy, UX, Illustration, and Motion
  • A passion for design, emotive storytelling and the creative process
  • Deep understanding and experience in establishing, marketing, growing, and evolving brands, from startups and nonprofits to large-scale global organizations
  • Experience with rebrands, brand extensions, visual guidelines and design systems Proven track record in developing, mentoring, and supporting designers building a highly engaged and empowered team
  • Ability to coordinate, direct, and provide creative direction to contractors, agencies, and in-house multi-disciplinary creatives
  • Excellent presentation, interpersonal, and communication skills, with the ability to communicate complex, sometimes abstract, concepts clearly and persuasively at the VP and C-Suite level
  • A highly collaborative, organized, and resourceful approach with cross-functional partners
  • A self-starter who proactively sets benchmarks, builds trust, and aligns expectations
  • Strong knowledge of video and design principles and best practices and a keen eye for typography and technical craft
  • An empathetic storyteller with exceptional creative writing skills

What you can expect:

  • Drive 1Password’s creative vision, style and expression and infuse this into strategy and agency proposal briefs in collaboration with brand, social, and content marketing teams
  • Design and package strategic and creative direction into compelling stories that are both clear and actionable and support business outcomes
  • Build relationships with leaders and business partners across the company, effectively influence decision making and prioritization, and be an advocate of our culture and values
  • Build consensus wherever possible among all areas of the company; leverage your ability to function as a bridge across disciplines, such as Design, Product, Engineering, and Marketing
  • Develop a team culture where curious, creative types can grow, feel empowered to own their career and do great work
  • Drive the creative development process as a key player in distilling out the ‘big idea; participate, lead and assist in leading internal creative brainstorms
  • Aid in determining creative direction on projects by fueling the creative process with insightful tactical guidance
  • Attend internal briefings and discovery sessions on new projects when requested
  • Stay current on marketing media and content trends (social, experiential, digital, design etc)
  • Lead an internal creative agency of writers, producers, philosophers, and thinkers
What we offer:

We believe in working hard, and resting hard. We’re always looking for new ways to support our team members, but here’s a glance at what we currently offer:

Health and wellbeing
> Maternity and parental leave top up programs
> Wellness spending account
> Generous PTO policy
> Company-wide wellness days off scheduled throughout the year
> Complimentary Headspace membership
> Comprehensive health coverage

Growth and future
> Employee stock option program for all full time employees
> Retirement matching program
> Training budget, 1Password University access, and learning sessions
> Free 1Password account (and friends and family discount!)
> A You Need A Budget membership

Flexibility and community
> Paid volunteer days
> Employee-led DEI&B programs and ERGs
> Fully remote environment
> Peer-to-peer recognition through Bonusly

You belong here.

1Password is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that is built on trust, support and respect. We welcome all individuals and do not discriminate on the the basis of gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, colour, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, sex, citizenship, education, languages spoken or veteran status. Be yourself, find your people and share the things you love.

Accommodation is available upon request at any point during our recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please speak to your talent acquisition partner or email us at nextbit@agilebits.com and we’ll work to meet your needs.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are being considered for a role at AgileBits, Inc. (dba 1Password, 1Password, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Lever, in accordance with Lever's Service Privacy Notice.

When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how we use or process your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact our privacy team at [dpo@1password.com] or through 1Password Support.

title: Officer, Services and Standards
description:
Reporting to the Manager, Terminal Services and Standards, this position is responsible maintaining strong relationships with Service Providers and Partners across Toronto Pearson. Officer will be the day of liaison and single point of contact between GTAA and our service providers. Responsible to monitor performance and ensure effectiveness of current and new piloted programs through installation and implementation.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Develops and maintains strong working relationships with Contracted Service Providers and Partners possessing a solid understanding of the provisions and requirements of all applicable contracts
  • Will serve as the day of liaison, integrator, and single point of contact between the GTAA and the service provider for the prioritization and execution of work during regular and irregular operations
  • Responsible for collection and dissemination of information such as flight schedules, construction activity, weather and other pertinent information that could impact or reprioritize the day-of delivery of contracted services
  • Engage and maintain relationships with key stakeholders (Airlines, CBP, CBSA, CATSA, tenants, retail, food and beverage providers etc) to validate the provision of services and implement corrective action as applicable
  • Conducts meetings with shift supervisors, assistant managers, and front-line staff to resolve day-of complaints related to the provision of services
  • Work closely with Airport Development Technical Services’ Response Managers to identify, report, and resolve building deficiencies impacting operations, and the passenger experience (washroom fixtures, lighting, millwork, paint, flooring etc.)
  • Identify and facilitate resolution of customer or tenant issues that are roadblocks to customer satisfaction. Responsible for researching escalated service issues to ensure all appropriate actions by other parties are being taken to resolve issue and ensure follow through until closure and/or complete customer satisfaction
  • Monitors and ensures service providers inclusive of (facility cleaning, baggage cart, waste disposal, pest control) are operating safely and within compliance of the terms and conditions of the contract
  • Report and initiate corrective actions as appropriate
  • Validates and ensures required resourcing is in place to meet operational demands
  • Measure and report against agreed to key performance indicators, service level standards and procedural / SOP compliance (both qualitative and quantitative) with the objective of consistently delivery best in class service delivery
  • Monitors and evaluates the effectiveness of current, new or piloted programs through installation and implementation, identifies opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Perform regular or ad hoc inspections of all facilities or assigned work areas to ensure space is meeting our expected customer service level requirements and/or agreed upon Service Level Agreements e.g problems with moving devices, overall cleanliness of the Terminals and curbs, equipment/systems problems
  • Meet daily with contractors to identify day of operational goals, abnormalities, peak periods and outstanding issues from previous shift
  • Engage contractor to discuss and execute against ASQ business plans
  • Perform terminal inspections, identify, initiate, and track work orders to address any building deficiencies.
  • Maintain electronic reports to avoid duplication, drive efficiency and ensure work completion in coordination with ADTS
  • Monitor public tenant spaces, terminal activations, advertising and promotional spaces to ensure compliance with lease agreements (cleanliness, seating condition, lighting, and general condition of installation) and report on and escalate as warranted
  • Report emergency repairs, and vandalism to the Airport Operation Control Centre for appropriate escalation and dispatch
  • Attend regularly scheduled or ad-hoc meetings with airport tenants including Airlines and Government Agency partners to ensure non-operational / back office spaces are being cleaned as per service standards. Correct any deficiencies as observed and escalate repairs as warranted
  • In coordination with contracted service providers, develop, implement, and communicate irregular operations plans to Airport Operation MOs and other GTAA departments
  • Support T1 and T3 Operations Managers in providing day-of oversight and ensuring compliance with approved Terminal Activity and Terminal Work Permits
  • Proactively identifies and addresses safety issues with Officer Public Safety Management Systems
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Fully vaccinated against COVID-19 with all required doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada. The GTAA will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability, or any other ground protected by the Canadian Human Rights Act.
  • Post-secondary diploma and/or degree; with a focus on Aviation; Business Management; Facilities; or Contract Management preferred
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in airport operations or similar experience in scale and complexity
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in a customer service or relationship management role
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in service delivery
  • Experience dealing with numerous stakeholders and government agencies
  • Must have a valid Ontario G Driver's License
  • The successful incumbent must be able to obtain and maintain a D/A class AVOP permit within thirty (30) days of appointment to the position
  • Must be able to obtain and retain Transportation Security Clearance

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • In depth knowledge of airport/airline/agency operations, layout and services in order to be flexible and able to rapidly respond to different conditions or arears
  • Fast, efficient and effective problem solving & decision making to eliminate delays in addressing problems and efficiencies
  • Strong decision-making skills and ability to think critically to deliver operational excellence
  • Ability to identify problems, gaps, trends, and bottle necks
  • In depth understanding of airport and airline operations
  • Knowledge of passenger flow processes at Toronto Pearson
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team to develop effective working relationships
  • Strong organizational skills, self-motivated and results driven
  • Intermediate proficiency with MS Office 2010 suite (Word, Excel and Outlook)
  • Strong listening skills when interacting with the team, internal and external stakeholders to correctly interpret and respond to questions and concerns
  • Strong customer focus and customer service skills
  • Ability to acquire knowledge of, and then skillfully use specific databases and software pertinent to required functions
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and able to communicate with focus and conviction
  • Ability to produce well written and sufficient reports
  • Knowledge of contract practices and procedures
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and coordinate many simultaneous tasks
  • Demonstrated leadership skills through collaboration across multiple functional groups, at various levels
  • Ability to deal with irate customers, using tact and professionalism to resolve issues/problems
  • Ability to solicit cooperation and agreement with others who may have conflicting priorities
  • Demonstrated analytical skills, including the ability to analyze operational and
  • contractual information while considering the legal, business and monetary implications
  • Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and ability to prioritize work

title: Associate Creative Director
description:
As the Associate Creative Director (ACD) you will lead a diverse interdisciplinary group of creatives in the making of our bread and butter content across all channels of delivery; paid advertising, ecommerce, experiences + retail, and wholesale.

Meet Your Future Team:

You work as part of the Brand Marketing Creative team; hands on and iterative, we build our creative with the same passion embodied in our product. Art Directors, Designers, Photographers, Stylists, Architects, and Craftspeople create a wide spectrum of skills to be deployed. We are comfortable behind the pen, on an exposed ridgeline, and in any global city.

If you were the ACD now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:

  • Partnering with Creative Director to build global seasonal art direction, project concepts and brand level storytelling
  • Leading a team of Art Directors in managing day to day creative development of the studio and ensure creative is on brief and aligned to vision
  • Facilitating the creative brainstorming process and based on briefs create presentations to stakeholders which visualize how consumer concepts could play out across multiple channels
  • Providing approval for a variety of creative campaigns and initiatives
  • Researching and exploring best in class design solutions and relevant cultural touchpoints
  • Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in multiple projects and balance multiple time sensitive deadlines with various stakeholders
  • Creative resource assignments and project/workflow progress with the Brand Operations team
  • Evolving and iterating brand guidelines ensuring they are current, on-brand, on-trend and tone appropriate
  • Coaching, leading and managing the career, workload and professional development of your team and contractors, as well as building pipeline for all creative roles

Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:

  • Maturing overall workflow and creative process, standards, and templates
  • Growing hands on practice and prototyping as process
  • Blowing the lid off of best-in-class consumer experiences physically and digitally

Are you our next Associate Creative Director?

  • You have 7-10 years experience in a creative leadership role at a DTC brand and related post-secondary education
  • You have extensive knowledge of Adobe creative suite and associated design tools
  • You have a strong depth of experience in art direction, photography, film, graphic design, architecture, and digital UX
  • You have an absurdly awesome taste level and knowledge of culture
  • You set a clear vision, align your team around common objectives, and foster commitment to deliver
  • You have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work with all levels of stakeholders
  • You have excellent organization and prioritization skills with the ability to manage multiple, competing priorities
  • You are an inspiring leader, and know how to keep your team focused and stoked, while supporting with eliminating barriers and seeking clarity
  • You have strong facilitation, diplomacy, and leadership skills
  • You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
  • You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
  • You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
  • You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
  • You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment
  • Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it

Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance.

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Design your Purpose. Live our Values.
DISRUPTIVE EVOLUTION. Design your future through challenge, experimentation, and inspiration.
COMMIT. Set and deliver on bold objectives as we collectively raise the bar.
LIVE IT. Deepen your connection to nature and live your most purposeful life.
LEAVE IT BETTER. Create a better world, together.

title: Marketing Operations Manager
description:
The Challenge:

We are looking for an experienced marketing operations manager to join our rock-star marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for enabling the Marketing team's vision by creating a foundation of strategy, structure, and process that empowers us to achieve high-level growth and performance goals.

Owning our marketing tech, data, and analytics stack and their integration within our complete revenue operations infrastructure, you'll help optimize our programs for efficiency and consistency throughout the prospect and customer journey. The ideal candidate will be familiar with marketing automation and technology and understand foundational marketing concepts, including ABM and multi-channel campaign strategies, the marketing and sales funnel, attribution, and the knowledge of how to tell a strategic story with data.

We are committed to finding the right person and giving them the support and space to make magic happen.

This role reports to the Director of Demand & Growth.

What You’ll Do:

  • Manage the marketing automation platform, set up and sync to CRM, and the day-to-day operational programs and integrations, including monitoring and updating lead score programs, activity alerts, program workflows, and webhooks.

  • Oversee the marketing database and segmentation strategy and implement/maintain processes to ensure quality data.

  • Own and collaborate with the Salesforce administrator on the data architecture and data synchronization between Marketo and Salesforce to ensure accurate and up-to-date data.

  • Work with our marketing and sales teams to become an expert on the company's lead funnel and demand waterfall — from web visitor to customer and everything in between.

  • Manage the strategy and day-to-day optimization and updates of the corporate website, collaborating with Content Marketing and Product Marketing for relevant messaging to focus on conversions.

  • Utilize web analytics tools to optimize website traffic and conversions.

  • Analyze and facilitate marketing program reporting and retrospectives across web traffic, marketing funnel, advertising, email, webinar, and campaign performance with an eye towards continuous improvement and sharing insights across the team.

  • Maintain existing marketing technology and integrate new tools and processes to drive optimization and automation.

  • Act as a thought partner in developing engagement strategies and technology investments.

  • Collaborate with web-dev and other contractors.

Who You Are:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in B2B marketing(marketing operations, analytics, and/or automation is preferred).

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or comparable education/experience.

  • Recent experience with marketing automation, website management, and reporting software.

  • Robust reporting and data analysis skills.

  • Understanding of analytics tools, funnel tracking, and performance metrics.

  • Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment.

  • Technical capabilities and a desire to improve processes.

  • Ability to problem solve/troubleshoot operational issues.

  • Excellent communicator and creative thinker, with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions.

  • Exceptional attention to detail and ability to work autonomously.

  • Ability and willingness to learn new processes, technologies, and tactics in a fast-paced environment.

  • Preferred experience with Marketing Automation (Marketo certification is a plus), Salesforce, WordPress, and Google products (Analytics, Ads, Tag Manager, Data Studio).

title: newOn-Air Coordinator, Bell Media, Freelance
description:
Req Id: 371256


At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.


If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.


The Bell Media team creates and delivers the best Canadian and international content across our digital media, television, radio, and out-of-home advertising platforms. We’re looking for innovative team players ready to take some of the most well-known entertainment brands in the country to the next level.


Job Title: On-Air Coordinator, Bell Media, Freelance

Location: Montréal, QC

Job Status: Contractor - Freelance


Purpose

The On-Air Coordinator is responsible for the integration of live production of shows and events and the resulting programming adjustments taking into account the sector's objectives, the mission and the values of the Bell Media (Réseau des sports).


This person must work according to the standards recognized and established at Bell Media (RDS), the objectives of the sector, the mission and the values of Bell Media (RDS).


Nature and extent

The On-Air Coordinator leads the integration of programming elements when presenting live events, advising production teams of on-air requirements. This person will coordinate the airing of live shows, events, commercials and “news” segments as well as the re-broadcasting of the shows.


They work closely with the Senior Head of Programming to develop an on-air schedule for live events as well as schedule changes and are responsible for the inventory of "filler" shows and ensures their production. They must, therefore: plan the use of on-air equipment and research visual elements for the production of such programs, and plan the production of "fillers".


Main accountabilities

  • Check the presentation log: adherence to and verification of permitted commercial content (signage, conflicts, etc.)
  • Ensure the technical quality of the transmission signal from the event site
  • Prepare the broadcast schedule for news segments and oversee integration during live event presentations
  • Communicate with the production teams in order to advise producers of programming adjustments, and to direct them regarding show completion times and commercial break structure
  • Coordinate live event sequencing
  • Inform viewers of last-minute schedule changes and technical difficulties
  • Produce a cue sheet for each live event and for repeat programming
  • Adjust the show schedule as required: use filler shows, plan alternative programming, modify the presentation log
  • Adjust the repeated programming cue sheet by modifying the commercial break structure or by removing part of the show


Knowledge, skills, and qualifications

  • Working knowledge of television production
  • Good knowledge of sports
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Strong communication and timing skills
  • Ability to maintain healthy collaborative ties between the various stakeholders


Bilingualism is required (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.


Additional Information:

Position Type: Contractor
Job Status: Contractor
Job Location: Canada : Quebec : Montreal
Flexible work profile: Full-time in office (meaning that you will be required to perform your work on-site)
Application Deadline: 05/16/2022


Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.


At Bell, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.


Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email your recruiter directly or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions regarding accessible employment at Bell please email our Diversity & Inclusion Team at inclusion@bell.ca.


Created: Canada, QC, Montreal


Bell, one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
Job Summary:

We are looking for a Regional Sales Manager (RSM) to oversee the sales strategy, operations, and execution within a defined territory in the United States. You will oversee manufacturer representatives within your territory as well as direct management of national & regional channel partners and strategic accounts.


The RSM will be responsible for:


  • Travel throughout an assigned territory to train and guide manufacturer representatives, channel partners, and large end-customers on HAVEN solutions
  • Assist the sales leader with projected sales & budget allocation for future quarters and years for the assigned territory
  • Work cross-departmentally to set promotional discount rates for special seasonal sales or new customers and plan advertising services for the territory in order to entice both new and repeat customers
  • Attend trade associate meetings as a representative of the company in order to promote products and increase sales numbers for the territory
  • Develop innovative sales strategies to increase sales within an assigned territory
  • Full-sales cycle responsibility for existing and new high-value end-customers on HAVEN solutions to meet and exceed your territory quotas.

Who are We?

HAVEN is an emerging Vancouver-based startup, helping people take control of the air quality in their homes with our innovative IoT air quality solutions. With the current pandemic and increased forest fire situations globally, this has raised the awareness of the importance of the quality of the air we breathe!

Our products not only detect air quality problems, but also help solve these problems by connecting to our customers HVAC systems to clean the air better and more efficiently. HAVEN has received invention awards from Popular Science and Time Magazine, and has multiple patents for environmental, air quality and optical particle counting technologies.

At HAVEN we believe that our people are the heart of our company. Their diverse backgrounds both personally and professionally are what drive their passion to contribute and help make a difference. Our culture encourages inclusive involvement and conversations to help foster new and different ideas. We are a small but growing team that values ambition, attention to detail, and personal development. Breathe Better.

Our Mission:

HAVEN's mission is to build innovative IAQ products; reimagining how HVAC products can be used to better solve IAQ problems by fusing IoT sensors and big data with automation. We are lowering the cost of world class sensors and partnering with massive HVAC distributors and contractors in order to have an incredible impact.

Our Vision

HAVEN's vision is to improve the health of millions of people by increasing the efficacy and accessibility of world class indoor air quality solutions.

What would make you a strong fit:


  • You are inspiring, creative, flexible and can identify and focus on what’s-important-now
  • You value collaboration, transparency and have a get-stuff-done mindset. As an individual contributor, you understand the aspects of success in your position, take initiative and lead by example
  • You work well with others, take pride in a job well done, and understand that in our company we are all accountable to each other
  • You want to push the envelope, overcoming big challenges in order to create something truly unique
  • You are a self starter and manage your time effectively
  • Previous start-up work experience, able to take on major responsibilities with minimal supervision
  • Able to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies

Key Responsibilities:

  • Direct the territory sales reps, channel partners, and larger end customers, teaching them important elements of the company products and services in order to give them the tools needed to be successful
  • Continually meeting or exceeding sales targets by persuading customers within an assigned territory to purchase HAVEN products and services
  • Project potential sales for future quarters in your territory
  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships
  • Understand the goals & objectives of new customers and translate those needs appropriately through the implementation and onboarding process
  • Track metrics including average customer unit sales, NPS, LTV, and churn rate

Qualifications and Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, business management, marketing, or related field is preferred.
  • 5+ years experience working as a territory sales manager.
  • Previous experience in outside sales, inside sales, and people management is preferred
  • Medium/Large enterprise B2B sales experience, SaaS experience
  • Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level
  • Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilities
  • Critical thinker with strong problem-solving and research proficiencies
  • Preference will be given to candidates with product knowledge and industry experience


The Fun Stuff:

  • Competitive total compensation package including health benefits, mental health, counselling, and therapy sessions
  • Professional training and personal development sponsorship
  • 3 weeks annual vacation plus a few bonus days over the year end holidays
  • During COVID we are promoting to working from home full time based on the requirements of the position, with lots of Google Meet video calls and occasional in-person meetings. During non-pandemic times we generally work hybrid schedules.
  • Full kitchen stocked with snacks & basic supplies
  • Pet friendly office
  • Exciting startup energy

title: Paid Search Specialist (Google Ads)
description:
Savvy Search Marketing Ltd (Savvy) is looking for highly motivated and Experienced Paid Search Specialists (Google Ads and/or Facebook Ads). This is your opportunity to join a Google Partner that is one of the fastest-growing and most respected digital marketing agencies in North America. Savvy is also a Microsoft Advertising Partner and Facebook Partner.

We will consider both full-time employee and part-time freelance contractor applications. These positions are entirely remote.

Although preference will be given to applicants from the Greater Vancouver, BC area, consideration will be given to applicants elsewhere in Canada, as well as other countries.

Please email the following in pdf format to hiring@savvyk.com:

  • Cover Letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate
  • Resume
  • Portfolio of your work

Responsibilities

  • Develop, implement, launch and monitor Google Ads and/or Facebook Ads PPC campaigns
  • Identify and develop new campaign strategies and communicate these ideas to clients
  • Optimization of PPC campaigns at all levels
  • Be able to hold client calls independently and effectively communicate strategic ideas and client performance
  • Tracking and analyzing conversion rates and performance, resulting in campaign improvement recommendations and implementation
  • Communicating with team members who may work on specific parts of the PPC campaigns, and related work such as creatives and landing pages
  • Maintain an up-to-date task list independently with limited manager oversight

What we are looking for

  • 5+ years minimum digital marketing experience
  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher (preferred)
  • Google Ads Certified and/or Facebook Ads Certified
  • Experience with all aspects of Google Ads including Search, Display, Remarketing and Shopping campaigns
  • Experience with other PPC platforms a plus, ideally Microsoft Ads and Facebook Ads
  • Experience with Google Analytics and Conversion Tracking
  • Proficient in Google Apps (Google Docs and Sheets) a plus
  • Strong communication skills (written, verbal and online)
  • Experience in various cloud services
  • Be able to work remotely, while communicating online with a global team
  • Above all, you should be passionate and knowledgeable about digital marketing/ PPC and the positive impact it has on businesses

OUR IDEAL DIGITAL MARKETING PROFESSIONAL

Digital Marketing can be a tremendously challenging and rewarding profession. It’s a field that is constantly evolving, therefore, it’s the ideal environment for creative individuals who are passionate about lifelong learning and have a knack for problem-solving. As an organization, we believe that if you want to be successful, you need to make sure that you are always one step ahead of the pack. That is why we are always looking for individuals who are: passionate; highly disciplined; experienced; pay attention to detail and are able to contribute to their team while working remotely.
