title: Airport Planner
description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

We are actively seeking candidates to join our growing Airport team in an airport and heliport planning capacity. We can offer individuals exciting opportunities to lead and support on a wide range of Canadian airport and heliport projects. We are well established at major airports, including Vancouver and Kelowna and are pursuing international airport projects.

As part of SNC-Lavalin’s Engineering Services group, the Airports team specializes in providing a full range of planning and engineering services for airport and heliport infrastructure projects to local, national and international clients. Projects range from small assignments, such as runway extension studies and apron expansions, to airport master plans and taxiway and runway infrastructure rehabilitation projects.

The Airport team is looking for a Senior Airport Planner to join our growing team. This position reports to the Airports Director. As a Senior Airport Planner, your primary role will be to manage and deliver airport planning assignments. This role can be based in either Vancouver, Calgary or Toronto. The Airport team currently operates a hybrid working model with our teams splitting their working week between working from home and in the office. Vancouver is currently the home office for a large section of the Airports team.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Development of airport master plans.
  • Scoping and undertaking studies on airfield layout, apron configuration and passenger. terminal planning, groundside access planning and land use plans.
  • Data analysis, demand and capacity assessment and interpretation thereof.
  • Taking responsibility for the delivery of technical reports and presentations.
  • Leadership of design meetings, site meetings and all other project related meetings.
  • Providing support to the market team in business development activities including leading and contributing to tender submissions.
  • Actively engaging with Atkins / SNCL’s global network of aviation and infrastructure planning professionals.
  • Providing guidance and leadership to more junior members of the team.
  • Liaising with clients on existing projects and pursuing new project opportunities.
  • Working collaboratively to assist other project team members, and to incorporate input from other parts of the business on multi-disciplinary projects.
  • Reviewing project documentation to check clarity, accuracy, consistency in presentation, and compliance with project specifications and applicable standards.
  • Managing project scope, schedule and finances.
  • Maintaining good working relationships with internal project support groups.

What will you contribute?

  • Hands on experience in airport planning, with understanding of airfield planning, terminal planning, surface access planning, facilities planning and Transport Canada, ICAO, FAA, EASA airport and heliport design standards.
  • A relevant first degree or equivalent qualification with preference for an air transport related post graduate qualification.
  • Understanding of the market economics and key drivers of Airport Planning and Development, including the interactions between aviation and airport operations, people and baggage movement, development, design concept, retail, advertising, and surface access.
  • Understanding and experience of recognised software used in airport master planning.
  • Skills in AutoCAD or MicroStation and familiarity with AviPLAN Airside Pro.
  • A high sense of accountability with an ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with a drive to deliver high quality work.
  • Proven track record in coordinating and delivering technically excellent studies and projects on time and to budget.
  • The ability to work with a range of project stakeholders, contractors and clients.
  • Understanding of project contractual and commercial requirements.
  • Ability to lead on business development activities and able to demonstrate successful role in bids/tenders.
  • A willingness to travel to undertake short-term assignments overseas.
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and oral communication; fluency in French desirable.

For this position, there is flexibility for work locations. You will have options to work in our offices in BC, Albert, or Ontario.

We offer an opportunity to work on varied and interesting projects in Canada and around the world. Salary will be commensurate with your experience.

SNC Lavalin recognises that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements.

While we sincerely thank all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available at snclavalin.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Business Development-Rural Development & Land Conservation
description:
Organization: Western Sky Land Trust
Employment Type: Employee, Full-Time
Location: Calgary

About Western Sky Land Trust
Western Sky Land Trust (“Western Sky”) is a not-for-profit organization focused on land conservation in the southern region of Alberta. Western Sky works with private landowners, conservation organizations, government, and community partners to protect natural and cultural heritage and to champion the conservation of environmentally and agriculturally significant lands that support the health of southern
Alberta’s landscapes. To learn more about who we are and what we do, visit our website at www.westernskylandtrust.ca.

Western Sky is looking for a like-minded, motivated and skilled Director - Rural Development and Conservation to help fulfill this important mandate through effective execution of duties in accordance with the direction set by the organization.

Position Profile
The applicant must have a demonstrated ability to take initiative and a deep appreciation for southern Alberta landscapes, agriculture and the people of rural communities in which we serve. Reporting to the Executive Director, the Director - Rural Development and Conservation is responsible for actively engaging with landowners and coordinating all activities that are related to increasing brand awareness, developing new relationships, conservation efforts, as well as working with existing landowners and industry. Being a self-starter is key for successful development of new initiatives and pursuit of resources that advance Western Sky. This position requires frequent interaction with the Executive Director and effective liaison with the controller on project management and other related reporting requirements.

Responsibilities
The Director-Rural Development & Conservation general areas of responsibility include but are not limited to:

Landowner Relations

  • Annual development of the outreach plan, including target setting
  • Revise/refresh existing communication plan and market outreach materials to support landowner awareness building including advertising in regional media and other social media platforms
  • General maintenance and content development of website that supports conservation awareness
  • From May – October annually, an estimated 80% of the work week is assigned to building trust and rapport with landowners through engagement meetings and field work
  • Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of a suite of conservation options including fee simple ownership, conservation easements, transfer development credits, wetland conservation efforts, life estates, etc.
  • Data management as required to support grant reporting requirements and general reporting to the organization
  • Build case for supports to external partners that enable resources for outreach activities and watershed awareness building in rural communities

New Project Development

  • Research and create business case for supports that align with organizational values for emerging land conservation easements
  • Transition new conservation easement opportunities with landowners from concept to actualization via annual grant preparation, budgeting and submission utilizing the case for support
  • Identify, prepare appropriate information, and source partnerships for conservation projects and related operational resource requirements
  • Provide good communication and regular updates to landowners with respect to pending projects

Project Management

  • Coordinate and manage various contractors and consultants including lawyers, appraisers and environmental consultants to ensure timely execution of conservation agreements
  • Provide good communication and regular updates to landowners
  • Adhere to best practice and industry standards, continually demonstrating improvement, effectiveness and efficiency in delivery of services to landowners

Stewardship

  • Annual development of stewardship plans for existing conservation easements in partnership with landowners, build external partnerships that can have common objectives and align resources for the overall betterment of stewardship activities
  • Coordinate and participate in annual monitoring activities ensuring strong information sharing with landowners and compliance with organizational and industry standards and best practices
  • Continually pursue new initiatives that have a strong focus on science-based reporting and utilization of new technology

Industry Relations

  • Build strong and trusted working relationships with external conservation organizations and other industry stakeholders through in person meeting, webinars, forums and other opportunities
  • Provide organizational expertise and perspectives to key industry stakeholders that assist in forming better practices/processes for the betterment of the collective land trust community in Alberta

General Reporting

  • Developing and monitor budgets, provide forecasts as required
  • Prepare applications and deliverable metrics reporting as required
  • Proficient with Office 365, Salesforce, GIS Mapping and other conservation resource tools at the provincial and national level
  • Prepare reports and presentations that showcases progress and advancement on key initiatives
  • Liaise effectively with the controller on all related revenues and expenses

Qualifications

  • Related undergraduate degree (eg wildlife/environmental management, ecology, biology, agriculture, planning). Relevant experience in non-profit environment is an important asset.
  • Self-directed and action-oriented with a mission-driven, positive attitude
  • Thrives in a culture of working with people and developing new relationships
  • Strong knowledge of southern Alberta geography, agriculture, heritage and culture
  • Must have a valid driver’s license, able to travel with own vehicle and comfortable working in isolation in a rural setting
  • Demonstrated ability to build lasting relationships and work effectively across varying stakeholders including rural and urban landowners, special interest groups, government and the corporate community
  • Strong knowledge of land conservation and sustainable land use practices related to agriculture, natural resources and watershed management
  • Must have the ability to influence diverse groups including contractors and suppliers- demonstrating effectiveness in negotiations, presentations, and verbal/written communication skills
  • Excellent business acumen related to communication, writing, budget management, analysis, decision-making and preparing presentations
  • Strong organization and project management skills combined with the ability to provide oversight to contractors

How to Apply
Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada. This position will require background screening. Compensation package includes salary, benefits and RRSP contributions.

We appreciate the interest expressed by all applicants, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted, please no follow up correspondence.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Safety of our employees and our stakeholders is of the utmost importance. Protocols will be reviewed with the successful candidate.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Calgary, AB T2E 2N1: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • management: 7 years (preferred)

title: newSenior Representative - Outside Sales
description:
We are seeking a Senior Outside Sales Representative. In this role, you will be responsible for developing new prospects and interacting with assigned customers to increase sales and margin of the company's products and/or services. You will participate in customer business planning to understand customer needs. Your primary focus is on face-to-face selling and account management activities to meet sales revenue goals by assessing customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and/or solutions and ensure a smooth sales process. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is required. You will engage with all levels of the customer’s organization including technical, operations, supply chain and executive management. You may develop and deliver sales bids, presentations, proposals and/or product demonstrations.

Responsibilities:

  • Qualifies accounts by determining market potential and provides periodic territory sales forecasts.
  • Executes and expands assigned customer account plan(s) which is developed in conjunction with management.
  • Executes on billing margin initiatives through value added services, marketing programs, and supplier engagement.
  • Prospects potential customers, including cold calling and developing leads through referral channels.
  • Communicates with customers and leads to identify and understand their product or service needs; identifies and suggests products and services to meet those needs.
  • Demonstrates the functions and utility of products or services to customers based on their needs.
  • Ensures customer satisfaction through ongoing communication and relationship management; resolves any issues that may arise post-sale.
  • Maintains communication with existing and previous customers, alerting them of new products, services, and enhancements that may be of interest.
  • Develops sales/supplier plans to drive account growth and retention while utilizing sales management tools to track and measure progress.
  • Develops and grows product knowledge through WESCO and supplier training.
  • Develops strong relationships with suppliers, including performing regular joint sales calls.
  • Provides quotations directly or in conjunction with sales support team.
  • Mentors sales team and communicates relevant information and expectations for optimum customer service.

Qualifications :

  • High School Degree or Equivalent required.
  • Bachelor’s Degree - Marketing, Sales, Business, Engineering or related field preferred.
  • 2 years required, 4 years preferred of outside sales experience.
  • 4 years preferred of industry experience.
  • Ability to travel to current and potential clients and suppliers.
  • Ability to work flexible schedule and occasional overnight travel.
  • Excellent sales and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to develop and deliver presentations.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Effective communicator both written and verbally.
  • Ability to work in team environment.
  • Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills.
  • Knowledge of advertising and sales promotion techniques preferred.
  • Travel requirements: 50% - 75%

WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.


WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE: WCC), a publicly traded FORTUNE 250 company, is a leading provider of business-to-business distribution, logistics services and supply chain management solutions. Pro forma 2019 annual sales were over $17 billion, including Anixter International which it acquired in June 2020.

WESCO offers a best-in-class product and services portfolio of Electrical and Electronic Solutions, Communications and Security Solutions, and Utility and Broadband Solutions. The company employs over 18,000 people, maintains relationships with over 30,000 suppliers, and serves more than 150,000 customers worldwide. With nearly 1.5 million products, end-to-end supply chain services, and leading digital capabilities, WESCO provides innovative solutions to meet customer needs across commercial and industrial businesses, contractors, government agencies, institutions, telecommunications providers, and utilities.

WESCO operates nearly 800 branch and warehouse locations in over 50 countries, providing a local presence for customers and a global network to serve multi-location businesses and multi-national corporations.

At WESCO, we build, connect, power, and protect the world. We have the capabilities and expertise to deliver the latest technologies, including: Industrial networking, Intelligent buildings, Cloud computing, Alternative energy, Broadband communications, Critical infrastructure protection, LED lighting retrofits, and Physical security.

title: CRM Operations Specialist, Senior Associate (Remote)
description:
Join us in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC advances a culture that helps everyone to thrive. It's one of the reasons we're recognized as a "Top Company" to work for in Canada. As you ignite a meaningful career and build a network that’ll last for life, you'll work with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to help solve important problems, empowered by technology to turn today's ideas into tomorrow's solutions. We cultivate an environment in which our differences are embraced and our people feel comfortable bringing their whole selves to work. An empowering and diverse environment starts with you. Are you ready to get started?

A career in Sales and Marketing, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on positioning a distinctive PwC brand in the marketplace and drive long term revenue growth for the Firm. You’ll focus on designing, developing, and implementing communication programmes and media events to promote and sell the PwC’s brand and services as well as contribute to and evaluating our pricing strategies in the marketplace.

Our Digital and Web Marketing team helps create engaging and interactive marketing materials in the digital and web space. As part of the team, you’ll help us with digital marketing campaigns, google analytics, social advertising, graphic design or a variety of other digital marketing tasks.

You will collaborate with teams across the organization to deliver the technology to take PwC Canada’s marketing and sales to the next level. As part of our Marketing, Communications & Sales (MC&S) team, the CRM Operations Specialist is responsible for the administration, testing, and training of sales technology platforms. This is currently a virtual role based in Toronto.

Important point(s) to consider

(Example)

  • COVID-19 Vaccination Policy

    : Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.

What you'll create and do

As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

Day to Day Operations (30%)

  • Administer and maintain Salesforce Sales Cloud, our CRM platform

  • Provide support to users via Salesforce Service Cloud

  • Support periodic data quality and user activation activities

Training and Adoption (30%)

  • Lead and facilitate training sessions on best practices and new functionality

  • Develop and maintain training resource materials

  • Provide on-going recommendations and support to increase platform adoption though training initiatives

Release Testing (20%)

  • Troubleshoot technical issues and work with IT teams to test and implement solutions

  • Understand and communicate user impact of enhancements to stakeholders

Other Projects (20%)

  • Contribute to MC&S projects and Solutions team strategy and roadmap

What you’ll bring to this role

  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work

  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives

  • Comfort and experience with a wide variety of marketing, sales or communications technology

  • Previous experience working with client relationship management tools, such as Salesforce CRM

  • Experience and comfort with tools such as Excel, Alteryx, Power BI are preferable

  • Salesforce Administrator certification is an asset

  • Technology savvy with a marketing, sales and communications mindset

  • Client service oriented, with strong stakeholder management experience and the ability to understand client needs

  • Excellent communication (oral, written, and presentation) and negotiation skills, with the ability to distil complex technological concepts and articulate clear communication to various stakeholders across the organization

  • Self-motivated, with the ability to work autonomously or to influence and collaborate with other teams and individuals

  • Strong project management skills, excellent organizational skills, high level of attention to detail,

  • Ability to multitask, manage competing priorities and conflicting agendas

  • Exceptional organization and prioritization, including balancing both project and operational activities

  • Excellent judgment, analysis and problem solving skills, with a proactive approach to problem-solving

  • Adaptable and able to work within tight deadlines, showing flexibility

  • Professionalism and integrity

  • Previous experience in marketing, sales or communications is highly desirable

Why you’ll love working for PwC

At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

See how you can create your future at PwC

www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/create-your-future.html

Get to know us

Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html

Applying at PwC

At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here: https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc

We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers: https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html


PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

Every day we see how people make businesses great. But it's not only about skills. If your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying. We recognize that experience comes in many forms, and passionate teams reimagine the possible. Create your future at PwC.

title: newJunior Marketing Program Manager
description:
Who We Are: At Carrier Enterprise Canada we’re passionate about people……our team members, our customers, and our partners. Combining teamwork and collaboration with our industry leading Carrier, Bryant, and Payne brands we deliver the best HVAC/R service, customer experience and solutions to homes and businesses across Canada where we live, work and play. CEC is a division of Watsco – North America’s largest distributor of air conditioning, heating and refrigeration equipment and related parts and supplies in the HVAC/R industry.

The Opportunity

The Marketing Program Manager will report directly to the Marketing Manager. He / She will manage multiple ongoing & event-specific marketing programs that drive increased residential dealer network loyalty & growth KPIs. The candidate will also support Commercial Marketing Events as needed. Below are some of the tasks the Marketing Program Manager will actively participate in:

  • Develop and refresh seasonal and annual dealer programs, campaigns and promotions; report on progress
  • Coordinate in person and virtual customer events, training sessions, meetings and tradeshows for residential dealers & commercial contractors and engineers
  • Develop e-communications for program launches, promotions and events to external customers and internal sales and management stakeholders
  • Work regularly with third party advertising, trade marketing agencies to execute outbound dealer programs, promotions and advertising campaign needs
  • Act as first point of contact for dealer marketing program & campaign inquiries.
  • Liaison with manufacturing partner on traditional factory-led channel marketing programs. Work with Marketing Manager to revise as needed for Canadian market requirements and launch.
  • Manage Dealer Business Development Fund (Co-Op) Program & provide guidance to regional claim processing administrators
  • Manage Residential National Lead Management Program, Develop & track key KPIs & ROI metrics. Work with internal field team to ensure efficient use of program by customer base
  • Establish him/herself as promotional material resident expert; manage promotional SWAG inventory and distribute to customers as needed
  • Provide support to maintain customer databases, literature fulfilment website and dealer resource portals
  • Coordinate program execution requirements with regional GMs and Account Managers
  • Create new / update existing digital dealer promotional tools
  • Assist with additional marketing duties as required

Skills and Behaviours

  • University degree in marketing, business or related discipline is required
  • 2-5 years of progressive marketing experience.
  • Trade marketing experience with hardline/durable products and brands is an asset
  • Customer service focused, analytical, with positive attitude and strong communication skills
  • Self-driven, highly motivated and responsive team player in a dynamic, exciting environment!
  • Works well under pressure and managing multiple deliverables and timelines
  • Excellent presentation skills and high proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint.
  • Any Adobe Suite experience is an asset (especially but not limited to Photoshop, InDesign or Illustrator

Why work for CE Canada?

· Our culture and mindset are focused on leading sustainable, ambitious, strategic growth through engagement, empowerment and accountability!

· We are a team built on trust and integrity

· We believe our people are what delivers a high level of customer experience

· We offer competitive salary, incentive and benefits

· We invest a lot in valuable training, best-in-class tools, and a successful value add and sales methodology

· We win and celebrate together

What’s in it for you?

  • When you join Carrier Enterprise Canada, you will be part of a dynamic work environment that delivers first-class service to provide comfort to every home & business through our top of the line HVAC/R products
  • You’ll join a team built on trust and integrity – where we succeed and celebrate together.
  • We value engagement, empowerment and accountability and our team members flourish because of it.
  • We care about your future with us. We encourage and provide opportunities for learning and development by using the best-in-class tools for training.
  • Every team member makes an impact in our business. We believe our team members are our greatest asset’s.
  • We offer competitive salary, incentive, and benefits such as:
  • Health, Dental & Vison Care
  • Life & Disability Insurance
  • Travel Assistance Coverage
  • Company Pension Plan with a company contribution
  • Optional RRSP and TFSA Retirement savings programs
  • Employee Assistance Program

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Marketing: 2 years (required)

title: Brand Manager / Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Description:

Reporting to the VP Sales & Marketing, CT Bakery, a world-class manufacturer & distributor of branded & private label artisanal donuts, is looking for an experienced, best-in-class brand manager to develop and implement marketing activities that increase brand value, awareness and market share. You will work closely with sales and operations to create and execute marketing initiatives that resonate with both retailers and consumers leading to increased, profitable sales. You will be tasked with developing budgets and assessing KPI’s.

Success means having a good understanding of consumer behavior, market trends and competitive activity. You will also be responsible for conducting appropriate research, analyzing data and drawing actionable conclusions/insights for the production and product development teams. Graphic design abilities as well as a strong background in social media development are crucial for this role.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Developing new products, line extensions that leverage changing market conditions
  • Liaising with sales and customers to ensure all marketing related activities are executed in a timely, professional manner.
  • Working with cross functional teams to set timelines for the development of new products/initiatives.
  • Conducting pre and post launch market research to help define the features of new products and evaluate the performance of said products.
  • Researching and discovering ways to rejuvenate mature products and therefore extend the life cycle of core items.
  • Creating messaging to remind customers that our products/initiatives are best in class, communicating a value-added proposition that differentiates us from the competition
  • Continuously researching competitive offerings
  • Identification of developing trends and defining high growth opportunities that leverage existing manufacturing capabilities,
  • Conducting and participating in sales and marketing presentations
  • Strong, developed, creative computer design capabilities (Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, CorelDraw, etc) for the creation of all sales materials, presentations required to present our products to accounts/brokers – this is a MUST
  • In house design of branded product labels and boxes that meet specs and inspire consumers

· Running weekly project status updates meetings to ensure projects are progressing well and remain on time / on budget.

DIGITAL MARKETING

  • Working with PR companies to create appropriate messaging for new and existing products.
  • Identification of appropriate trade shows for CT Bakery participation – development of booth/collateral materials to position company as best in class
  • Managing the creation of content such as videos, website copy, blog posts, newsletters and various promotional materials as well as the contractors/employees required to complete these tasks.
  • Build and maintain the company’s social media presence on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Tik Tok, and other social media platforms
  • Planning, executing and managing all web, SEO, SEM, database marketing, email marketing, social media, display advertising and retargeting campaigns as well as the contractors/employees required to complete these tasks.
  • Implementing KPIs and tracking software to analyze and measure conversions as well as the success of all strategies against the defined goals. Adjusting campaigns accordingly.
  • Managing website maintenance and ongoing developments, this includes an online ordering system, online payment portal, sustainability initiative, additional landing pages, internal employee portal etc.

REQUIRED SKILL SET

· Degree in business, marketing, or a related field

· Previous experience in building brand and marketing strategies, food background preferred

· Advanced communications skills, both verbal and written.

· Advanced computer graphic design skills

· Highly organized and perform well under pressure.

· Collegial and team player

· Budget management skills

· Strong research and analytical skills

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $65,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: home renovator
description:
Specific Skills

  • Work with customers, architects and engineers regarding plans and specifications
  • Select and employ trade subcontractors and co-ordinate their activities
  • Prepare estimates and bids for home construction, renovation and restoration projects
  • Prepare and maintain directory of supplies and trade contractors
  • Plan and manage budgets
  • Plan and prepare work schedules
  • Perform trade work during home construction, renovation or restoration
  • Inspect subcontractors work to ensure quality and conformity with plans and specifications
  • Ensure that construction permits are obtained
  • Develop and implement business plans
  • Develop and implement financial and operating plans
  • Develop and implement health and safety plans
  • Develop and implement marketing and advertising and sales strategies
  • Human resource planning and development
  • Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate daily operations

Personal Suitability

  • Effective interpersonal skills
  • Flexibility
  • Client focus
  • Organized

title: Account Manager
description:
The Account Manager is in charge of managing all aspects of a client’s social media, marketing, and public relations initiatives. This includes strategy, execution, and client relations. In addition, they are managing a team to ensure all deadlines, KPIs, and expectations are met. This is a hybrid position that requires both remote and in-office weekly attendance at our Vancouver location.

Responsibilities:

  • Overseeing and developing social media, public relations, and marketing campaigns
  • Conducting research and competitive analysis to identify and define audiences
  • Writing and proofreading creative copy and all content materials
  • Brainstorm and develop ideas for creative assets and marketing campaigns
  • Manage and execute advertising campaigns for clients, reporting on data once complete
  • Write blog posts and thought leadership articles
  • Track and deliver monthly statistics to measure growth
  • Meet with clients in a professional and punctual manner
  • Proactively stay up-to-date on the latest trends and technology in all aspects of your responsibilities
  • Present ideas to clients, attend client meetings as needed and assigned

Social Media Marketing

  • Manage all social media initiatives on Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, and other relevant platforms
  • Provide editorial calendars for each client
  • Amend and edit any content requests from the Client or Vive management
  • Write blog posts and thought leadership articles
  • Management and strategy of social media ads (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc)

Public Relations

  • Write press releases, create media lists, and comfortably pitch to media
  • Coordinate influencer partnerships, both paid and organic
  • Create a full marketing & PR strategy, including out-of-the-box ideas to hone engagement and brand awareness
  • Organizing and managing events

Expectations:

  • Collaborate with colleagues and other professionals to coordinate brand awareness and marketing efforts
  • Respond to client inquiries in a professional, timely manner
  • Support team projects and colleagues if and when needed
  • Undertake tasks as assigned
  • Work evenings and weekends, as needed and assigned
  • Take initiative independently
  • Treat colleagues, clients, contractors and Vive affiliates in a professional, respectful manner

If this role is of interest, please send your resume, cover letter and/or portfolio to info [at] vivesocialpr [dot] com.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

title: Content Strategist
description:
As a Content Strategist (digital, social, content strategy) at H+K, you will be tasked to deliver best-in-class content strategies and publishing programs for new and existing clients. You will have a foundation of understanding in strategy, analytics and the skills to manage multiple campaigns across platforms. You will have the ability to deliver content strategies for clients based on your knowledge of digital platforms and how they work.

You will support planning the ideation, aggregation and delivery of content to discover and grow sustainable audiences. You must be able to explain technical issues and platform nuances with clarity to your peers and managers, and support client leads with putting together content strategies to best support client needs.

Overall: we want you to be curious about pushing boundaries of what traditional PR is and how we deliver. We want you to champion innovation, curiosity and creative. We want you to be a partner as we innovate the future of PR.

Here’s what you would be doing;

  • Manage day-to-day of digital and social content strategy and delivery.
  • Support in developing content strategy processes, approaches and best practices
  • Provide counsel to account lead and clients and support on insight-driven content strategies for current and new clients, championing creative work that will work across all channels and best practices in content strategy, (video, social, website), community management, social engagement and SEO
  • Demonstrate a solid understanding of paid media, in the context of social, search and native. Work directly with our paid media team. Familiarity with the latest developments in formats and products to make relevant recommendations to clients. Support the client team by proactively flagging new and emerging technologies
  • Collaborate and consult closely with creative studio on content production, ensuring timelines are being followed and the approval and feedback process for clients run smoothly
  • Proactively and reactively develop creative direction for clients in partnership with our creative studio and third parties
  • Be a confident team player with the ability to quickly build strong inter-team relationships
  • Support in identifying new business opportunities for existing clients and have an appetite to get involved in growing the portfolio

Here’s what you’ll need to get here:

  • 5-7 years’ experience in content strategy, creation, advertising, or planning across earned, owned, paid and shared spaces; experience within a digital or social agency strongly preferred
  • Strong sector expertise a bonus – we work in a sector model, so deep understanding and passion for sectors a bonus.
  • Deep knowledge and professional proficiency across all major social media platforms with a knowledge and passion for following trends and emerging platforms
  • Superb writing and editing skills; highly detail oriented
  • Proven ability to successfully manage projects and client deliverables
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-pace, deadline-oriented environment
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task across a diverse base of clients and projects
  • Collaborative mindset with the ability to work well in a team environment
  • Entrepreneurial, business-minded outlook with a positive, can-do attitude
  • Passion, integrity and enthusiasm for the H+K brand


What else is in it for you?

  • Full health benefits package—including healthy paid time off, fitness + wellness reimbursement, and more
  • A career working with and influencing bold, creative teams and client accounts
  • A passionate, smart, fun, and creative office culture
  • Strong leadership with a focus on entrepreneurial thinking, training and mentoring to help you grow, expand your skills and become your professional best

How to apply
Unless otherwise stated, at this time applications are only being accepted from candidates who have eligibility to work in Canada, without sponsorship, now or at anytime in the future.

If you are interested in this position and can clearly demonstrate that you meet the requirements defined in the job description, complete our online application form, we are waiting to hear from you.

Accommodation Statement:

H+K Strategies welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, as such reasonable accommodations are available upon request from a candidate with a disability, thus ensuring you can take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If as a qualified job applicant, you request an accommodation, we will consult with you and provide reasonable accommodations according to your accessibility needs. If you wish to make a request, please provide a cover letter, when applying to this position.


The successful candidate to this role may be asked to complete a background screen, which may include criminal, credit, employment, educational checks and/or COVID 19 vaccination checks. All offers of employment are conditional on the receipt of satisfactory results of any applicable check. In our continued commitment to prioritize colleague health, comply with customer/business partner requirements, and help preserve our business continuity.

H+K Strategies requires employees, contractors, and business partners to be fully vaccinated with relevant dose(s) of a Health Canada approved vaccine for all new hires by their start date in order to attend the office or meet with employees or clients. “Fully vaccinated” means it has been 14 days after receiving the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (i.e. two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series), and which may include, at the Company’s discretion, any further doses in accordance with Health Canada guidelines.

Exemptions will only be granted for medical reasons or on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.


Statement on Diversity & Inclusivity:

H+K Strategies Canada provides services in one of the most diverse countries in the world. The diversity of our communities takes many forms. It includes differences related, amongst others to race, ethnicity, national origin, gender identity, gender expression and presentation, sexual orientation, religion, age, ability, and socioeconomic status. We see diversity as an asset to our organization and communities and strive to be reflective of the communities that we serve. We commit ourselves to promoting better understanding and appreciation of our human diversity; a commitment which is best realized through our individual and collective effort.

We are professionally and personally committed to celebrating the rich diversity, equity and inclusion of people who work in our company, to those who live in our communities, and to those who access our services and resources. We believe that it is critical that our services empower freedom of thought and opinion in an environment of mutual respect. All our activities and interactions are enriched by accepting each other as we are and by celebrating our uniqueness as well as our commonality. We are guided by the principle that celebrating diversity, equity and inclusion enriches and empowers the lives of all people.

Message to Agencies
H+K Strategies Canada does not accept unsolicited telephone calls, referrals or resumes from any source other than directly from candidates. H+K Strategies Canada will not consider unsolicited telephone calls, referrals and/or resumes from vendors including and without limitation, search firms, staffing agencies, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies. The submission of referrals or resumes by anyone other than a candidate directly to H+K Strategies Canada is not welcome. Unsolicited referrals and resumes sent to H+K Strategies Canada will be deemed gratuitous, and H+K Strategies Canada will not be obligated or bound in any way to pay a referral or any other fee if a person referred to us from a source other than a direct candidate is subsequently hired.

title: newGraduate Communications Coordinator
description:
Graduate Communications Coordinator

Tracking Code: req132

Faculty/Department: School of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies

Number of Positions: 1

Appointment Type: Full-Time Continuing

Hours of Work: 35 hours per week

Salary Range: Level 7 - Starting Salary, Step 1 $54,305

Posting Date: May 4, 2022

Closing Date: May 17, 2022


Job Summary:

The Graduate Communications Coordinator will be responsible for assisting to plan, coordinate and develop a wide-range of communications related to graduate programs and services. Using various communication channels (print, web, digital, social media etc.) this role will assist in fulfilling strategic and targeted communications across a number of functional areas, such as: recruitment, admissions and registration; scholarships and awards; postdoctoral fellows; thesis and program completion requirements; as well as graduate student engagement.

Nature of work:

As an integral member of the School of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies (SGPS), reporting to the Manager, the Graduate Communications oordinator will coordinate and operationalize all aspects of the unit’s communication to prospective and current students, faculty members and staff. The communications coordinator will be a key player in ensuring communications are comprehensive, consistent and reflective of university key branding and marketing. Providing editorial services to SGPS, as well as assistance to various departments throughout the university. This position will also assist with the planning, execution and communication related to SGPS projects and events.

Responsibilities/accountabilities:

  • Informed by guiding principles and strategic context, the incumbent provides input into, and ensures delivery of, the SGPS recruitment and communications plans.
  • Creates, edits, and delivers communications for SGPS. This includes writing and editing of promotional and informational material (e.g. emails, viewbooks, letters, newsletters, brochures, fact sheets, targeted mail, forms and publications) in various formats (print, digital, MyCampus, CMS, and social media).
  • Provides timely communications support and guidance for a range of areas, to ensure consistency, branding and accessibility (AODA).
  • Responsible for the SGPS website, including content, organization and messaging. This position will also provide support to other CMS contributors within SGPS.
  • Provides content and support for projects, event programs etc., and coordinates messaging for print and social media.
  • Utilizes online tools (HubSpot, Hootsuite, etc.) to deliver dynamic communications to recruit both domestic and international graduate students.
  • Develops and maintains a targeted content marketing strategy that is an integral part of the recruitment plan by anchoring the online presence for the prospective student base. This includes, but is not limited to, maintaining lists of prospective students and applicants, creating landing pages, managing event registration forms, integration of CRM on relevant webpages and datamining online analytics.
  • Assists with tracking and archiving all communications, researching trends and using data to support future communication initiatives.
  • Provide communication and logistical support for events in collaboration with other members of the team.
  • Represent SGPS in-person at university events, including but not limited to: Open House(s), Ontario Universities Fairs, Graduate Reception and others as required.
  • Monitor communications-related expenses for the unit.
  • Other related duties as determined by the SGPS manager.


Required Skills:

  • Exceptional writing ability, including the ability to be creative and write in a variety of styles (e.g. straight news, promotional, advertising, human interest, etc.) on tight deadlines
  • Superior organizational/multi-tasking and problem-solving skills
  • Strong research, interviewing, fact-checking and proofreading skills
  • Solid grasp of CP style
  • Excellent understanding of media relations practices
  • Demonstrated oral and written communication skills with an emphasis on presentation to various stakeholders
  • Ability to develop and execute projects, including the ability to adapt to changing priorities
  • Client-centric and thorough understanding of target audience expectations
  • Ability to work effectively and professionally with people at all levels both inside and outside of the university
  • Exceptional initiative and ability to work independently with minimal direction but also participate in a collaborative team environment
  • Proficiency in using advanced features associated with the current versions of all Microsoft Office programs is required
  • Flexibility to work irregular hours and/or days as required to meet objectives and/or attend events
  • Strong technical and multimedia skills


Required Education:


  • Completion of a formal post-secondary College or University program of 3 academic years or equivalent
  • An undergraduate degree in Communications, Journalism, Public Relations, English or related field preferred

  • Verification of Academic credentials may be required

Required Experience:

  • Over 3 years and including 5 years
  • Experience with client relationship management programs and branded social media in multiple platforms.
  • Experience with content management systems.
  • Knowledge of the graduate post-secondary education system preferred.


How to Apply:

Interested candidates should submit in electronic format a covering letter and their resume. Applications will be accepted until May 17, 2022 or until a suitable candidate is found. We appreciate all applications received; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

This position falls within the bargaining unit represented by the Ontario Public Service Employees Union (OPSEU) and will be subject to the terms and conditions of the collective agreement between the university and the OPSEU. To the extent that policies are not included in the collective agreement, employment will also be governed by the university’s policies which may also be found on our website https://ontariotechu.ca and which may be amended from time-to-time.

Ontario Tech University is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, while especially encouraging applications from women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation, gender identity, and gender expression. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadian citizens, permanent residents and Indigenous Peoples in Canada will be given priority.


Ontario Tech University respects people's different needs and therefore will take all reasonable steps to ensure accommodation for applicants where appropriate. The University is also committed to ensuring that confidentiality is maintained throughout all aspects of the recruitment cycle.

Prior to May 1, 2022, the university required all students, faculty, staff and visitors (including contractors) to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as defined by our mandatory vaccine directive. This directive was paused, effective May 1, 2022, but may be reinstated at any point in the future depending on public health guidelines and the recommendations of experts. All employees of the university will be expected to comply with the requirements of this directive.

The university recognizes faculty and staff may require accommodations. We are committed to an accommodation process in which individualized needs (e.g. for medical and religious/creed grounds) are appropriately addressed under the Ontario Human Rights Code. A COVID-19 Vaccination Accommodation Application Form is available.

The university acknowledges the lands and people of the Mississaugas of Scugog Island First Nation which is covered under the Williams Treaties. We are situated on the Traditional Territory of the Mississaugas, a branch of the greater Anishinaabeg Nation which includes Algonquin, Ojibway, Odawa and Pottawatomi.

Job Location: Oshawa, Ontario, Canada

Expected Start Date: 5/30/2022

Expected End Date:

title: Handraiser/ Social Media CSR – St. Catharine's, ON
description:
As a social media expert, you will help support and expand our large social media self-serve advertising customer base. As part of the team, you will an advisor to existing clientele demonstrating the value of our social media products to their ad campaigns. You will provide product and basic tool support to improve their experience and drive higher spend. The ideal candidate will have previous Social Media Experience (Customer Service Call Center/Sales experience preferred). Training will be provided


Duties will include:

  • Consulting with clients to understand their business goals and optimizing or editing their current social media campaigns accordingly.
  • Supporting clients by guiding the creation of launching successful social media marketing campaigns.
  • Demonstrate the value of advertising solutions and provide pre and post-sales support for all self-service products.
  • Provide demonstrations of the product & tools to educate clients and improve their experience.
  • Responsible for increasing client’s Return-On-Investment (ROI) on their social marketing campaigns.
  • Provide product and basic tool support to improve their experience and drive higher spend.
  • Develop and maintain knowledge of customer and customer-specific business environment
  • Analyze previous Ad data and insights to tailor unique promotional strategies for every client also recommending best practices of social media advertising.
  • Responsible for providing innovative ideas to clients to develop suitable adverts to attract their target audiences.
  • Accountable for targets and drive higher advertising spend for small and medium businesses.
  • This role is expected to meet or exceed monthly sales targets and drive higher advertising spend for small and medium size businesses.

Basic Qualifications

  • HS Diploma or GED Min 1-yr customer service
  • Prefer experience working in a sales environment with sales targets or quotas.
  • Familiarity with online advertising products
  • Superior written and communication skills
  • Ability to work all shifts as required (including holidays)
  • PC skills and keyboarding skills
  • Self-driven with attention to detail and follow through strong analytical and decision making skills that demonstrate good judgment
  • Uses knowledge base and a sensible business approach to confidently make decisions
  • Superior communication skills verbal, written, and listening skills
  • This role is expected to meet or exceed monthly sales targets and drive higher advertising spend for small and medium size businesses.

What can you expect?

  • Free onsite parking
  • Spacious work stations with updated technology platforms and equipment
  • Supportive environment to assist with individual success
  • Complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate bar
  • A sense of community! We pride ourselves on our inclusive, open, and engaging work environment
  • Employees are eligible for a bonus after completion of 6 weeks

Schedule:

The hours of operation for the center is 24 hours a day 7 days a week so contractors must be available to be scheduled at anytime during this period. Candidates required to work on CDN/US Holidays.


Duration: 12 months contract with possibility of extension.


Hourly Pay Rate: $17.00 per hour + BONUS


Location: St.Catharines, Ontario


How to Apply

Salvatore Massignan

Topnotch Employment Services Inc.

2365 Finch Ave West Suite 207, Toronto, ON M9M 2W8

T: 416-741-0066 F: 416-741-0069

Email Resume: Salvatore@topnotchemployment.com

title: newMarketing Specialist
description:
Company Name: Verus Software Inc. dba Logo.com

Business Address: 422 Richards St., Third Floor - Vancouver, BC V6B 2Z4

Job Title: Marketing Specialist, NOC 1123

Vacancy: 1

Terms of Employment: Full time, permanent position (30 to 40 hours per week)

Wage: CAD$ 27.88 per hour

Benefits: 10-day vacation per year

Company Description:

We're more than just a logo creator. Our mission is to deliver professional logo design software that sets your business up with everything you need, from social media to print so that you can focus on delivering a great experience for your customers. We're constantly fine-tuning our logo algorithm for unique, high-quality, logo design and adding new elements and file types to the social media and brand image file kits.

Job Description:

We are looking for a Marketing Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will help define the goals, core strategies, and most effective and cost-efficient tactics to drive customer acquisition and retention while leveraging your experience to help grow engagement and the value of product offers to our users.

  • Evaluate our portfolio of services and provide advice on advertisement strategies and sales promotions.
  • Create targeted marketing plans with specific objectives across different channels and segments.
  • Plan, design and execute all digital marketing, including SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, and social media.
  • Research and prepare communications materials for different audiences.
  • Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals.
  • Craft compelling brand positioning and messaging.
  • Develop ways to increase brand awareness (mainly in the Indian and US market) and drive thought leadership.
  • Increase lead acquisition through web, email, social, and blog.
  • Manage and expand existing partner relationships as well as seeking out and developing new ones.
  • Manage customer service (includes all incoming customer queries) through Intercom.
  • Optimize web pages, search engine marketing, PPC campaigns.
  • Conduct public surveys to identify interests and concerns of key groups.
  • Analyze customer insights, consumer trends, marketing analysis, and industry best practices to build successful strategies.
  • Prepare reports, briefs, presentations, website content and press releases.
  • Report on marketing performance and use key insights to inform future campaigns and strategy.
  • Organize workshops, meetings, interviews, and other events for publicity and information purposes.
  • Create learning/online course content to increase our online and digital footprint.

Necessary Skills/Qualifications:

  • University Degree or College Diploma in Marketing, Advertising or any related field is required
  • At least 3-5 years of experience
  • Experience in organic marketing channels such as PR, community building, social media, and, SEO.
  • Prior experience in working with a tech/domain industry and digital marketing agency preferred.
  • Solid knowledge of our current Marketing stack (Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Webflow, Mailerlite, Buffer, Canva, and Intercom).
  • Strong track record of improving a blog’s performance with respect to rankings and organic traffic.
  • Proven record of building strong partnerships with other publications in the domain name space such as registrars and registries.
  • Work closely with partners to deliver global client campaigns.
  • Experience across a variety of marketing channels - brand marketing, product marketing, digital marketing, content marketing, event marketing, and course creation.
  • Experience working with or managing external agencies or contractors.
  • Experienced Copywriter.
  • Knowledge of Podcasts: planning, booking new podcasts, content creation and production.
  • Experience in having guest post publishing on our own website.
  • Should draw quality metrics and guidelines for accepting guest posts for LOGO.com’s publication.
  • Experience in getting high-quality backlinks from high DR websites.
  • Proven experience in managing other writers.

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Fast-paced environment

title: Marketing Coordinator - Part Time
description:
Marketing Coordinator Job Description

We are looking to hire a marketing coordinator with outstanding organizational and research skills. Marketing coordinators are expected to be creative individuals with fantastic communication skills and excellent time management.

To ensure success, marketing coordinators should be detail-oriented and have a solid understanding of marketing techniques with a keen interest in providing a consistent brand voice across all marketing activities to specific audiences. Top candidates will exhibit critical thinking skills, strong problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Marketing Coordinator Responsibilities:

  • Develop strategic marketing initiatives and activities.
  • Implement marketing plans that include print, broadcast and online content.
  • Create branded advertising campaigns, and support the marketing and design teams by coordinating and collating content.
  • Setup tracking systems for marketing campaigns and online activities.
  • Conduct market research to identify marketing opportunities and negotiate media coverage.
  • Traffic all advertising efforts to appropriate channels.
  • Develop and manage all internal communication systems.
  • Create, maintain and strengthen the organization’s overall brand through all media avenues.
  • Organize and streamline service offerings into user-friendly concepts.
  • Manage print contractors and other promotional vendors.
  • Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive information.
  • Simplify complex data into a user-friendly format such as graphs, charts and other visual aids for clients and management.

Marketing Coordinator Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree in marketing/communications or related (essential).
  • Two years of experience in content management, creative writing, advertising concepts and media negotiations.
  • Critical thinker with strong problem-solving and research proficiencies.
  • Ability to comprehend and interpret competitor strategies and consumer behavior.
  • Expert knowledge of Content Management Systems (CMS).
  • Ability to gather large amounts of data and convert it into meaningful analysis.
  • Solid organizational skills and detail oriented.
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines.
  • Creative mind with superb written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to simplify complex information into a user-friendly format.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Photoshop and web editing packages.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 20 per week

Salary: From $22.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Waterloo, ON N2V1Y8: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Expected start date: 2022-04-13

title: Bilingual Project Manager
description:
ABOUT US:

Periphery Digital Inc. is a fast-paced, bilingual digital marketing and advertising agency founded and based in Vancouver, Canada. Specializing in both English and Chinese digital strategy and execution, some of our services include developing paid media strategies to drive leads and conversions, and using bilingual content and digital assets to optimize reach and growth. We believe that when we take good care of our team, the team takes care of us. As one of the fastest growing agencies in Western Canada, we doubled the size of our team and revenue twice in two years through the COVID-19 pandemic — while keeping our whole team on board!

We are a team of innovative and hardworking individuals who value the growth of our team members. Being a part of Periphery also means you will receive:

  • a competitive salary
  • great benefits, including wellness credits
  • career development opportunities
  • the perk of working in an inclusive and fun, award-winning team!

YOUR ROLE:

A client-facing role, the Bilingual Project Manager is the lifeline for the success of our clients' marketing campaigns. You visualize our projects in roadmaps, foreseeing roadblocks and planning the best course of actions to mitigate risks. With your coordination, the right resources and teams are always allocated to manage key deliverables. Reporting directly to the Account Director and working alongside our Account Services Team, you are also responsible for creating project processes, mapping out workback schedules, and ensuring the smooth implementation and delivery of campaigns.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Campaign Execution

  • Work closely with the Account Manager to ensure alignment on client goals and defined project scope, as well as successful implementation of campaign strategy
  • Collaborate with internal production teams, client teams, outside contractors and third party stakeholders to execute campaign deliverables in a timely and effective manner
  • Create and implement SOWs, workback schedules, timelines, and campaign progress reports
  • Ensure deadlines are met by estimating and planning overall workloads; planning, assigning and communicating tasks
  • Analyze risks and proactively take action to mitigate issues and adjust campaign timelines as necessary
  • Ensure that the project meets the quality standards expected by the client and Periphery and provide QA for all deliverables
  • Coordinate the successful submission of campaign deliverables with media vendors and third party agencies
  • Track project budget and identify opportunities to maximize profits

Client Engagement

  • Ensure clients are informed, updated, and on track with the workback schedule and campaign timeline
  • Collaborate with clients on the ideation, creation, feedback, and approvals of deliverables
  • Ensure timely communication and successful delivery of campaign objectives, goals, and KPIs
  • Resolve client roadblocks and complaints to ensure customer satisfaction
  • Participate in client meetings and presentations

Team Management

  • Act as the bridge between the client and the internal production team
  • Lead internal project kickoff meetings and regular project meetings to keep the production team up to date and organized
  • Ensure that the production team has the tools and assets necessary to produce deliverables (instructions, assets, design specs, brand guidelines etc.)
  • Create tasks and provide direction for media, content, and design to ensure the timely and successful completion of campaign deliverables
  • Manage the overall workload, production pipeline and timeline for the internal production team
  • Understand the strengths and weaknesses of each team member and be able to tailor your communication style accordingly
  • Motivate the team through great days and rough days

Process and Admin

  • Use tools to monitor working hours, plans and expenditures
  • Make recommendations for improvement (in project management methods, project profitability) by assessing work methods, processes, and documents

Industry Knowledge

  • Develop a firm understanding of the client's industry, brand, marketing strategy, and challenges
  • Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of Periphery's services and processes
  • Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies within the Chinese market, as well as digital and traditional paid media opportunities in North America
  • Maintain a high level of understanding in digital marketing platforms such as Google Display Network, Facebook, Instagram, Programmatic, WeChat etc.
  • Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; and participating in professional organizations

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience working in the project management field
  • Experience working with and running bilingual digital marketing and media campaigns
  • Exceptional interpersonal, verbal and writing skills, fluency in English and professional working proficiency in Mandarin is required
  • Intermediate knowledge of WeChat advertising and Ethnic marketing platforms
  • Intermediate understanding of SEM, Display, and Paid Social Advertising
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build a positive, respectful, and motivating team environment
  • Flourishes in a team environment with the ability to collaborate and delegate efficiently and effectively with multiple internal departments
  • Superior time management skills — the right person needs to be able to multitask and juggle competing demands from clients and the internal team
  • Ability to think critically, navigate stressful situations optimistically/positively, problem solve under pressure, make sound and timely decisions, and meet hard deadlines
  • Ability to work without supervision and manage your own schedule as well as the schedule of the production team
  • Highly organized and extremely detail-oriented
  • Excellent email and phone etiquette
  • Understands and resonates with small business culture

Bonus Points:

  • Previous agency experience
  • Knowledge of the local real estate market
  • Ability to speak and read Cantonese or Korean

Be a part of our team and enjoy:

  • Great health benefits — which includes dental care, extended health care, vision care, and wellness credits
  • Paid time off — work-life balance is important to us! Work hard and take the time to recharge and relax
  • Casual work environment — we dress casual, collaborate a lot, and share a love for furry friends
  • Career development opportunities — we push each other to be better and grow together, whether it's enrolling you in professional development courses or attending a webinar together!
  • Work-from-home benefits — we want you to transition to work from home as seamlessly as possible, so we got your remote work office expenses covered. Uber rides and Uber Eats credits? That's on us too

DISCLAIMERS

Must be legally entitled to work according to the relevant provincial/territorial legislation and regulations. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. We thank all those who apply and look forward to welcoming a new member of the Periphery team.

COVID-19 considerations:

Periphery Digital is fully remote at this time with optional (safely) hosted in-person events in or just outside our Yaletown Office.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
