title: Operations Assistant
description:
PATTISON Outdoor Advertising is Canada’s leading Out-of-Home (OOH), Transit and Digital display advertising company. With the widest variety of products, our advertisers benefit from unparalleled advertising opportunities. Our sales professionals and support associates across the country, provide clients with unmatched service, insights and campaign innovation.

As leaders in the Canadian advertising industry, PATTISON Outdoor Advertising is determined to initiate change starting from within, lead by example and reflect the diversity of the communities within which we work and live, coast-to-coast. By supporting internal and external efforts of inclusion and diversity we aim to better ourselves and the world around us. We are PATTISON Outdoor Advertising and here everyone belongs.

Job Information:

Use your highly-developed organizational skills, your project leadership experience, and your results-driven approach to manage construction and maintenance projects relating to our broad range of Out-of-Home media inventory, including but not limited to billboards, street level displays, and transit shelters.

Note:

It is a condition of employment that new employees provide proof that they are vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to the start date of employment. This means that all new employees must have received two (2) doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada prior to their start date. In addition, it is a condition of ongoing employment that all new hires obtain and submit proof of all required doses of the vaccine and maintain all booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada going forward. Applicants who have appropriate written proof of a medical exemption, or a reason pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may provide such documentation to the Human Resources department. Such situations will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee, manage, and coordinate all construction and maintenance activities, including new installations, takedowns, general site maintenance, and the changing of advertising copy.
  • Responsible for prioritizing and completing projects on-time and on-budget.
  • Coordinate, schedule, and direct all construction and maintenance contractors.
  • Monitor field work to ensure compliance with internal (company) and external (industry and regulatory) processes, policies, procedures, and regulations.
  • Secure and complete all required approvals, permits, permissions, and supporting documentation before maintenance and construction work begins.
  • Ensure that all projects are properly identified, documented, and tracked through our internal processes, systems, and software.

Required Skills, Training and Experiences:

  • 2+ years of experience in an operations role within the outdoor advertising industry or a relevant and related business/industry.
  • A high-school diploma and relevant technical training will be considered an asset.
  • Experience managing and overseeing construction contractors will be considered an asset.
  • A self-directed worker with a proven track record of delivering results and successfully managing projects through to completion.
  • A strong work ethic and ability to complete multiple tasks under time sensitive deadlines.
  • A proficiency in Excel would be an asset
  • Ability and willingness to become proficient with internal processes, systems, and software.

If you are positive, professional, and looking for a career, this is your opportunity to become part of Canada’s industry leader in outdoor advertising.

Pattison Outdoor Advertising is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise our Human Resources department.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
Social Media Marketing Manager


Come work with us! You’ll love it.


Purpose

Reporting to the Marketing Director, the Social Media Marketing Manager is responsible for supporting the holistic marketing strategy with a strategic, audience-focused, sales-aligned, data-driven, and long-term digital strategy. The Social Media Marketing Manager is essential in driving a full-funnel brand to demand strategy in alignment with marketing and sales objectives by planning, creating, executing, and optimizing our paid media (including SEM and Paid Social).


Reports to: Marketing Director
Location: Remote
Role type: FT Employee
Hours: Full-time, 35 hours per week (schedule to be agreed upon with the team lead)

Compensation: $70-100k CAD/year, Unlimited Vacation, Extended Health & Dental, Education Allowance, Annual Cost-of-living Increases


You are:

  • Flexible and adaptable to rapidly changing business conditions and priorities.
  • Able to articulate your digital vision to inspire others - clients, Stocksy members and colleagues.
  • Growth oriented – one that is open to new perspectives, ideas, divergent perspectives and experiences.
  • Analytical with experience working towards set KPIs and providing recommendations to Marketing leadership based on quantitative information.

You have:

  • 6+ years of progressive digital strategy management and experience running results-driven lead generation campaigns.
  • Experience developing, implementing, executing, and assessing strategic digital plans that align with and support other organizational strategies and priorities.
  • Experience developing SEO/SEM strategies for other B2B or B2C corporations.
  • Experience with social media and paid advertising campaign management including Implementing Paid Digital Advertising Strategy (Google Ads, Twitter Ads, FB/IG Ads, LinkedIn Ads, TIkTok Ads).
  • Experience with Google Analytics and social media management - Hootsuite or something similar.
  • Experience in optimizing campaigns end-to-end (including audience segments, budgets, creative, content, channels, tactics, etc.) on an ongoing basis in real-time.
  • Proven track record of driving results for B2C or B2B organizations.
  • Demonstrated ability to experiment and A/B test and learn new ideas and initiatives.
  • Strong understanding of the stock media industry, competitive landscape and visual trends.
  • Foundational understanding of the culture of the creative class and our enterprise clients.

Responsibilities:

  • Drive online traffic to our website using SEO/SEM, paid advertising, and content syndication.
  • Drive decisions based on quantitative and qualitative research, analysis, and stakeholder input.
  • Leverage extensive social media expertise and current best practices to lead the planning and execution of paid social media strategies in tandem with our organic Social Media Coordinator.
  • Deliver detailed and actionable insights and strategic recommendations, provide interpretation, guidance and recommendations to drive business performance forward.
  • Under the guidance of the Marketing Director – Partner with Brand Manager, Organic Social Coordinator and Sr. Content Specialist to create holistic brand to demand campaigns deliver on brand and lead generation KPIs.
  • Work with reps from each social media platform to understand best practices, new products and new beta opportunities - bringing these back to Stocksy for consideration.
  • Own the Digital section of Monthly Marketing Report which provides a data-driven lens into the results from each marketing channel with a section on key recommendations that can be used to enhance the marketing strategy as well as Sales, Product, AR, and Tech strategies.

Stocksy supports a global membership of employees, contractors, clients, and contributors from all walks of life. We find strength in what makes us different. We are committed to building a diverse workforce and cultivating an inclusive environment where every one of our team members can thrive.


We are actively seeking any individual who may have taken a road less traveled to get to where they are now. Experience and education comes in many forms; so long as you are excited about this posting and convinced you could be your best self at Stocksy, then we want to hear all about you!

title: Senior Representative - Outside Sales
description:
As a Senior Representative - Outside Sales you will be responsible for developing new prospects and interacting with assigned customers to increase sales and margin of the company's products and/or services. You will participate in customer business planning to understand customer needs. Your primary focus is on face-to-face selling and account management activities to meet sales revenue goals by assessing customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and/or solutions and ensure a smooth sales process. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is required. You will engage with all levels of the customer’s organization including technical, operations, supply chain and executive management. You may develop and deliver sales bids, presentations, proposals and/or product demonstrations.
Responsibilities

  • Qualifies accounts by determining market potential and provides periodic territory sales forecasts.
  • Executes and expands assigned customer account plan(s) which is developed in conjunction with management.
  • Executes on billing margin initiatives through value added services, marketing programs, and supplier engagement.
  • Prospects potential customers, including cold calling and developing leads through referral channels.
  • Communicates with customers and leads to identify and understand their product or service needs; identifies and suggests products and services to meet those needs.
  • Demonstrates the functions and utility of products or services to customers based on their needs.
  • Ensures customer satisfaction through ongoing communication and relationship management; resolves any issues that may arise post-sale.
  • Maintains communication with existing and previous customers, alerting them of new products, services, and enhancements that may be of interest.
  • Develops sales/supplier plans to drive account growth and retention while utilizing sales management tools to track and measure progress.
  • Develops and grows product knowledge through WESCO and supplier training.
  • Develops strong relationships with suppliers, including performing regular joint sales calls.
  • Provides quotations directly or in conjunction with sales support team.
  • Mentors sales team and communicates relevant information and expectations for optimum customer service.

Qualifications

  • High School Degree or Equivalent required., Bachelor’s Degree - Marketing, Sales, Business, Engineering or related field preferred.
  • 2 years required, 4 years preferred of outside sales experience.
  • 4 years preferred of industry experience.
  • Ability to travel to current and potential clients and suppliers.
  • Ability to work flexible schedule and occasional overnight travel.
  • Excellent sales and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to develop and deliver presentations.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Effective communicator both written and verbally.
  • Ability to work in team environment.
  • Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills.
  • Knowledge of advertising and sales promotion techniques preferred.

Travel requirements : 50% - 75%
WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.
#LI-DB1
WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE: WCC), a publicly traded FORTUNE 250 company, is a leading provider of business-to-business distribution, logistics services and supply chain management solutions. Pro forma 2019 annual sales were over $17 billion, including Anixter International which it acquired in June 2020.
WESCO offers a best-in-class product and services portfolio of Electrical and Electronic Solutions, Communications and Security Solutions, and Utility and Broadband Solutions. The company employs over 18,000 people, maintains relationships with over 30,000 suppliers, and serves more than 150,000 customers worldwide. With nearly 1.5 million products, end-to-end supply chain services, and leading digital capabilities, WESCO provides innovative solutions to meet customer needs across commercial and industrial businesses, contractors, government agencies, institutions, telecommunications providers, and utilities.
WESCO operates nearly 800 branch and warehouse locations in over 50 countries, providing a local presence for customers and a global network to serve multi-location businesses and multi-national corporations.
At WESCO, we build, connect, power, and protect the world. We have the capabilities and expertise to deliver the latest technologies, including: Industrial networking, Intelligent buildings, Cloud computing, Alternative energy, Broadband communications, Critical infrastructure protection, LED lighting retrofits, and Physical security.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Sales Associate / Paint Expert
description:
You are an energetic, passionate, creative, colour savvy Sales Associate / Paint Expert who is inspired to serve customers. You are respectful and friendly towards others and you thrive working in a group.

Who you are…

  • You are passionate about every shade and tone of colour.
  • You don’t mind getting your hands dirty.
  • You are excited to learn about new and different products (e.g. industrial products such as epoxies) and you constantly look to hone your existing skills (e.g. colour matching) and develop new skills (e.g. stain matching). You believe that expanding your knowledge on products is the best way to keep growing and learning.
  • You thrive working in a fast paced environment that sometimes requires shifting from task to task (e.g. multitasking between helping a customer at the counter, checking an order to ensure that it’s right before it goes out and tinting a sample for a customer) and you barely break a sweat.
  • You look at quiet moments as an opportunity to organize retail space, remerchandise items on the floor or put product away because you believe that it’s the little things that help provide the best all around customer service.
  • You take pride in your work and you have a keen eye for detail (for example, noticing that the colour match you are working on is a shade lighter than what the customer wants – so you continue to adjust it until the customer is satisfied).
  • You collaborate well with others and always welcome feedback from your colleagues. You see this as an opportunity to get better.
  • You are also comfortable providing suggestions that may help improve existing systems. You think outside of the box when it comes to improving or enhancing the customer service experience.
  • You are committed to following existing systems and procedures that help ensure the accuracy of each order that goes out.
  • You get excited to help educate customers on the best products they need for their job. You look at every customer and customer service experience as an opportunity to teach, grow and learn.
  • No matter what time your shift starts you always show up early and you look forward to sticking around a bit extra if a teammate needs a helping hand.
  • You enjoy working in groups on various projects that help enhance the overall customer service experience. This might include working together with a team to put together an online and in-store ad for an upcoming promo, or working with the advertising team to create our next radio commercial.
  • You understand the importance of being in communication with your team and with clients. On a busy day you make sure to let customers know that it might take a bit longer to complete their order. You also check in with your fellow colleagues to see if everyone is doing okay.
  • You know how and when to ask for help from your team.
  • You see the value in cultural development and are always open to change.
  • You are infinitely friendly and respectful towards all customers and coworkers. You provide all customers with a warm greeting and make them feel welcome and at home.

As a Sales Associate / Paint Expert you will…

  • Assist and educate customers recommending products that best suit their needs
  • Tint, mix, and colour match paint, stains and architectural coatings
  • Check all orders for quality assurance
  • Manage incoming orders by phone, email and in person
  • Assist with receiving product and stocking shelves when necessary
  • Develop customer relations with our retail and contractor base
  • Maintain displays, product literature and décor samples
  • Maintain sales areas and tint areas in a neat and organized manner
  • Monitor stock levels, merchandise shelves and order from suppliers when necessary
  • Assist at point of sale to complete orders

A few general technical requirements for all candidates…

  • 1-3 years experience with a customer service focus in a sales driven environment
  • Post Secondary Degree or College Diploma is preferred
  • Able to work in a collaborative work environment
  • Able to lift up to 50 pounds comfortably
  • Have an aptitude for colour and colour properties
  • Great intercommunication skills (telephone, face to face)
  • Friendly, respectful, energetic and punctual
  • Comfortable working independently as well as in a team setting
  • Comfortable multitasking and working in a fast paced environment
  • Comfortable working at any of our retail locations
  • Comfortable working with various computer programs such as word and excel, and open to learning about new point of sale programs
  • Comfortable working with numbers and measurements, especially for custom formulas

At ColourX we have a diverse workforce with equal opportunities for all employees. We provide each employee with full product and customer service skills training as well as cultural development. If you are interested in this position, send your resume to info@colourx.ca!

title: Sales Development Manager- 12 month contract
description:
Facility Location- Coquitlam

Work Location - [[CUST_primaryWorkLocation]]

Posting Locations - Coquitlam

Department - Lower Mainland Large Store Team 2

Job Function - Sales and Marketing

Employee Type - Contractor Salaried

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!


Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.


We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.


Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

The Sales Development Manager, Large Store a.k.a. Field Sales Rep. supports the Coca-Cola contact between the large store managers or store owners and is responsible for the customer relationships along with increasing business by selling and ordering products within his or her sales territory existing customer base. Please note this is a 12 month contract position with opportunities for full time, permanent in the future.

Responsibilities

  • Execute and close all sales calls
  • Sell in incremental displays and equipment placements; sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance
  • In connection with a sales call, maintain appropriate inventory levels, maintain company assets and point of sale, ensure account meets Company merchandising standards, determine stores' product needs, place and transmit appropriate order in conjunction with existing geographic sales routes
  • Communicate account activities to appropriate parties
  • Transport, replace and maintain Point of Sale advertising as appropriate for account
  • Buillds, changes and removes product displays and cleans product space.
  • Periodic lifting of 50+ pounds, bending, reaching, kneeling and light merchandising.

Qualifications

  • High School or GED (General Education Diploma) required
  • Bachelor Degree/3-4 Yr College - Univ. Degree preferred
  • 1+ years of general work experience
  • 1+ years previous sales experience preferred
  • Food/beverage industry experience a plus
  • Ability to handle multiple customer accounts
  • Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills
  • Excellent planning and organization skills
  • Proficient computer application skills
  • Ability to create and conduct sales presentations preferred
  • Valid driver's license and driving record within MVR policy guidelines, with access to reliable transportation

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Architectural Sales & Business Development Manager
description:
Who We Are


Trusscore is a material science company focused on developing sustainable building materials.


We're starting a journey to change the way people build buildings and the environmental footprint left behind when they do. Already an established innovative building materials manufacturing company, Trusscore is now preparing to take things to the next level by focusing on R&D and bringing innovative material science to our formulations—making our products functional and beautiful.


As one of the leading polymer panel manufacturers in North America, we are dedicated to environmental sustainability and make it a focus of our manufacturing process. We succeed by manufacturing and delivering the best in high-value, zero-waste, quality products in an ever-evolving marketplace. By integrating innovative material science into products to meet new demands we will leave traditional alternatives behind.


Building on a winning track record of 300% revenue growth over the past 5 years, we need the right talent to take the next big steps.


Your Mission

As a manager and direct contributor, you will direct a team responsible for meeting or exceeding specifications and sales targets


Responsibilities

  • Proactively identify relevant projects and stakeholders using construction project databases to increase specifications of Trusscore products
  • Work closely with the support of Regional Account Managers to interact with owners, architects, contractors, and distributors to influence the specification and purchase of Trusscore products
  • Support architects and designers in writing specifications
  • Track Truscore projects within CRM to ensure specifications are secured and managed through all construction project stages
  • Work collaboratively with the Marketing team to identify sales enablement resources to enable the Architectural Business Development team to target, engage, and support specifiers effectively
  • Build brand awareness and create demand of Trusscore products by helping to develop and execute architectural marketing plans and campaigns, including tradeshow, advertising, and content marketing activities
  • Present Continuing Education Units to architects (virtually and some physically)
  • Support the optimization of architectural resources, including product sheets, specifications, technical and compliance documentation, and design assets (e.g. CAD/BIM)
  • On a daily basis, ensure you operate with the Trusscore Way in mind, and this is reflected in your communications with customers, partners and team members.
  • Be willing and able to travel as needed

Qualifications

  • Must have a proven track record of building product specification and architectural relationship management success
  • Superior communication, presentation, interpersonal, and relationship building skills
  • Ability to work in a culture of performance excellence to exceed goals
  • Strong influencing and negotiation skills
  • Demonstrated experience utilizing a CRM (ideally Salesforce) for managing project opportunities and relationships

Compensation

This is a career opportunity to join a fast-growing company that offers a competitive compensation package and benefits as well as plenty of room for career growth and leadership development.

title: newProduct Marketing Specialist
description:
LifeLabs is the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada, serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for over 50 years. Our team members are truly centred around our customers, and we know that behind every lab requisition, sample being tested, or investment in technology is an individual and their family counting on us.

Consistently named one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes, LifeLabs has also been recognized for having an award-winning Mental Health Program from Benefits Canada. The passion and commitment of over 6,000 diverse and innovative team members unites and motivates us to ensure our customers receive high quality tests and results that they can trust. Agile, customer-centred, caring and teamwork: we live these values every day in what we do to support our customers and healthcare providers, driving forward our vision of empowering a healthier you .
Make a difference – join the LifeLabs team today!

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE: The Product Marketing Specialist supports the development of content and marketing activities that attracts a target audience to enable the growth objectives of LifeLabs’ Consumer portfolio. The Product Marketing Specialist is knowledgeable on marketing processes and able to execute assigned projects at a high level. They are comfortable and confident in their ability to develop, write for and invest in the appropriate campaigns and channels to optimize marketing ROI. They have demonstrated experience in consumer healthcare marketing, including marketing digital healthcare services and platforms.

The Product Marketing Specialist is accountable to ensure key campaign milestones are met, written work is well reviewed and vetted for quality assurance, and advertising opportunities are captured and optimized. They report to the Senior Marketing Manager, and work closely with the product managers, digital marketing team, sales team, and business/customer intelligence group.

This is a 12months full time contract with a potential for extension. Health benefits are applicable.

Core Accountabilities: Develop product marketing strategies for all existing and new products within the category to consumers and healthcare professionals Develop and track a 12-month marketing activity calendar with KPIs Develop and/or review content for all marketing materials (i.e. brochures, digital assets, websites, copywriting, video, white paper, blogs, etc.) and obtain necessary approval from all related parties (i.e. Product Managers, MedSci, Legal, Regulatory, Communications) Working with Product Managers, develop content for print and online media Manage campaigns across multiple channels including print, patient service centers, social media, digital health platforms, virtual events, webinars, paid ads, TV, radio, etc. Track and report result of each campaign, making improvements as necessary Manage end-to-end campaigns for digital healthcare services, from creative development to execution and reporting Monitor and report new competitor offerings Work with product team on pre-launch activities and market research Develop and deliver internal presentations on all marketing-related activities for digital healthcare services, and other assigned product categories Complete advertising agreements and manage submissions and deadlines, including ad design, internal reviews and proofing Build a repository of ads for healthcare providers, patients and consumers, as well as generic corporate brand ads Keep track of all advertising activities (ad tracking) and report on ad performance Under the direction of the Product Managers and Senior Marketing Manager, develop positioning strategies for new services by understanding competitive market conditions Determine industry trends by working with the Customer Experience and Engagement teams Nurturing leads from various campaigns to qualify them based on interest / propensity to purchase and providing a robust content strategy to keep various segments engaged with our brand.

Minimum Qualifications and Skills: BA/ MA Degree in Marketing, Communications or related field Scientific or healthcare-related bachelor degree preferred MBA or Post-secondary education in business and/or a related field preferred Minimum 5 years in a Marketing role, including 2 – 3 years of consumer healthcare / platform marketing experience Open to travel in GTA if required
#LI LM1 #INDEED

At LifeLabs, we strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where our team members and the communities we serve feel accepted, valued, and respected.
In accordance with LifeLabs’ Accessibility Policy , the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. For a confidential inquiry or to request an accommodation, please contact your recruiter or email careers@lifelabs.com .

LifeLabs is committed to providing a safe environment for our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. We have been a leader throughout the COVID-19 pandemic regarding health and safety measures and have always put our employees and customers at the center of every decision that we make. As an organization in the health care sector, we believe the COVID vaccination adds a layer of protection that complements the extensive and necessary health and safety protocols that we have taken to date. With this in mind, we currently require all LifeLabs employees, contractors, students and volunteers to be fully vaccinated.
LifeLabs operates under a distributed workforce model, where employee flexibility is a key priority. Further information will be provided during the interview process on what this means for employees.

title: newService Supervisor
description:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Ultramar, Bluewave Energy, Pipeline, Chevron, Columbia Fuels, Island Petroleum, and Sparlings Propane.

We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.

Position Title: Service Supervisor

Team and Location: Ottawa, ON

Position Summary:

Manages all service functions within the branch by overseeing activities of service dispatchers and technicians in order to meet service needs and requests of Sparlings customers

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide daily direction di DISPATCHERS and TECHNICIANS through verbal and written communication in regards to all service-related areas to ensure smooth operation of the department.
  • Resolve complaints from customers, TECHNICIANS, and/or DISPATCHERS by asking the individual to explain the issue in detail, investigating the situation, interviewing all parties, determining an appropriate solution, confirming that the solution is satisfactory to all parties involved, and implementing the solution
  • Investigates incidents involving equipment failure by visiting sites, conducting interviews, and compiling evidence to determine the cause of the incident and possible preventative measures for the future

  • Provide technical support to legal representatives during lawsuits relating to particular service issues or equipment failures

  • Investigates service-related incidents and technical violations by re-examining the appropriate codes and regulations and conducting an investigation at the site; recruits the help of an experienced TECHNICIAN to provide a second opinion and historical background on the incident; coordinates the investigation with various parties (government officials, customers, & equipment manufacturers) to gain support and cooperation to complete the investigation and resolve any outstanding issues causes by the incident

  • Maintains equipment inventory by tracking equipment purchases and sales to ensure accurate month-end reporting
  • Process installation paperwork by approving initial sales agreements, overseeing equipment ordering and scheduling of installation, processing inventory, and completing customer billing
  • Runs and analyzes certain service reports from Infosys to examine and report on the current state of departmental costs and expenditures
  • Liaises with the technician’s union representatives to resolve union complaints and negotiate contracts
  • Maintains margins on equipment sales by monitoring vendor equipment pricing and setting BW equipment pricing
  • Liaises with vendors regarding equipment pricing, availability, and delivery to ensure proper supply or large equipment to contractors
  • Coordinates various technical training opportunities for TECHNICIANS and DISPATCHERS to familiarize them with new technology and improve their technical skills
  • Maintains an up-to-date database of technician’s certificates, licenses, and insurance policies to ensure the TECHNICIANS are properly licensed to perform their duties
  • Develops and improves service procedures by performing regular audits of service DISPTACHERS and TECHNICIANS to increase departmental productivity
  • Create new procedures to improve efficiency and productivity by evaluating current procedures to see if there is room for improvement; requests feedback from branch employees and introduces them to the ideas prior to implementation, ensuring open communication throughout the process; breaks the procedure down into separate steps and determines which steps could be improved or eliminated; conducts a training session and creates a checklist to assist staff in following the new procedure
  • Check the service aspect of new customer contracts and sets up the service screen in Infosys for all new customers in the Toronto branch
  • Develops and implements marketing initiatives through mailings and verbal advertising to promote equipment sales
  • Oversees warehouse safety and maintenance, including shipping and receiving, forklift maintenance, and warehouse cleanliness
  • Processes warranty returns and liaises with vendors regarding warranty equipment
  • Provides internal IT support for employees at the branch to resolve technical issues quickly and efficiently
  • Maintains an up-to-date understanding of B139 Installation Code for Oil Equipment, B149 Installation Code for Gas Equipment, JOHS regulations, Transportation of Dangerous Goods (TDG) regulations, ODP & refrigeration guidelines, and various manufacturer’s instructions and warranty information
  • Oversees projects by assessing the nature of the project, choosing appropriate team members, explaining the situation to the individuals in detail, and offering guidelines for completion, necessary tools, and support; establishes specific deadlines for completion and checks the progress of the project periodically
  • Liaises with various parties including the Technical Standards & Safety Authority, the Electrical Safety Authority, and insurance companies to discuss regulatory and inspection processes, Union Representative to discuss labour and contract negotiations, and vendors for equipment and service purchasing

Qualifications and Skills:

  • G2-LP Technician Certificate

We Offer:

  • Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
  • Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
  • A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
  • Flexible medical and dental packages, a Health Care Spending Account, along with a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
  • In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
  • An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
  • A focus on healthy living through wellness initiatives and an annual fitness reimbursement program.
  • Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
  • A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.

We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. Please note:

  • Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
  • Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
  • Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

We power a growing family of locally known brands including Ultramar, Bluewave Energy, Pipeline, Chevron, Columbia Fuels, Island Petroleum, and Sparlings Propane.', 'Check the service aspect of new customer contracts and sets up the service screen in Infosys for all new customers in the Toronto branch']

title: Director, Entertainment & Experiences
description:
Job Description


Reporting to the Senior Vice President, Revenue Management, the Director, Entertainment & Experiences position is responsible for the overall management and profitability of entertainment and experiential offerings at Exhibition (EXH) and Location Based Entertainment (LBE) locations. The role will oversee all regional and unit level programming activities as well as the audio/video programming content and live event space. The Director will lead budgeting, feasibility studies and development, pricing, documentation of best practices and SOPs, reporting and overall effective management of the entertainment category for new and existing locations. This position will work closely with Operations, Event Cinema, Marketing and Communications to maximize attendance, impact and profitability. This role will require approximately 20% travel to operating locations, as well as trade shows and competitor site visits. The ideal candidate must be highly collaborative, display exceptional communication, interpersonal and analytical skills. The position contributes to a safe and welcoming work environment for all team members, guests, and contractors. The candidate will create a working environment that fosters collaboration, respect, and trust.

  • Develop, direct, and implement the entertainment strategic plan
  • Develop and manage the entertainment department budget
  • Develop strategic partnerships with agencies, vendors and performers
  • Remain current with special events, music, entertainment and experiential industry developments
  • Promote EXH and LBE locations and entertainment offerings
  • Work collaboratively with the Revenue Management team to identify, create and implement strategies and initiatives to drive attendance, revenue and profitability
  • Provide capital investment recommendations based on entertainment and experiential offerings and a thorough understanding of throughput, revenue management, labour requirements, licensing and provincial regulations, profitability and overall ROI
  • Collaborate with related departments to develop, implement and maintain a comprehensive programming content plan for all locations
  • Oversee entertainment buying (direct/non-direct with agents) and contract negotiations
  • Review agreements and performance riders, negotiate and implement with the Legal department
  • Determine technical requirements of specials events, live entertainment and experiences
  • Oversee planning and production of special events, live entertainment and experiences
  • Coordinate with the Marketing department on advertising, event promotion and loyalty engagement
  • Coordinate with operations on scheduling, technical, staffing and hospitality requirements
  • Develop and maintain pre- and post-analysis and reporting
  • Analyze performances based on comparisons to pro forma established for each event and experience
  • Responsible for purchasing or renting production equipment as required
  • Monitor and control all associated costs
  • Respond to and resolve issues as escalated
  • Conduct efficient and productive location visits to audit entertainment and experience operations
  • Champion Cineplex values through recognition and motivational efforts
  • Recognize the importance of fostering a culture that drives employee engagement
  • Deliver memorable entertainment experiences to internal and external guests
  • Develop and cultivate strong working relationships with all stakeholders: guests, team members, vendors, and regulators
  • Ensure compliance with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Lead the hiring and ongoing performance management of entertainment team members
  • Performs other duties as assigned or directed

Qualifications
  • 5-10 years of experience in the entertainment industry with relevant programming and production knowledge
  • Post-Secondary education in entertainment production or suitable combination of education and experience required
  • Operational experience in both mid and large sized entertainment venues is a requirement
  • Experience in multi-venue and multi-purpose venues an asset
  • Consummate professional and expert communicator
  • Ability to exceed internal and external guests’ expectations through timely, effective, and service oriented communication
  • Box office/ticketing experience preferred
  • Event marketing experience an asset
  • Ability to think creatively and the willingness to deviate from industry norms to identify opportunities and advance the business preferred
  • Ability to work flexible shifts, including days, evenings, nights, weekends and holidays, as required
  • Flexibility to travel
  • Experience with creating budgets and managing a P&L
  • Experience with negotiating with suppliers and reviewing contracts
  • Experience training and creating training plans and documents
  • Experience creating standard operating procedures
  • Experience with providing recommendations and strategies from available data
  • Computer literacy in MS Office

Additional Information


Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable.

Accessibility

Cineplex is committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at jobs@cineplex.com.Interested applicants, please apply today.

While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Scene+ standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.

No Agency Calls Please

#CB

title: Optimization Specialist, Digital Marketing - Contract (Remot...
description:
Please apply on Isarta.com
https://isarta.com/jobs/?utm_source=IND&job=79133

AMA:

A DIGITAL house IS YOUR domain.

Posted: 2022-04-15

Closing: When Filled

Location: Remote

To you, research, testing and analysis of website traffic, consumer behavior, and general business metrics isn't work - it's what makes you tick! You're a research machine and you thrive on making meaningful recommendations to address relevant business challenges. You're game - there is no research project too big or small. At the Alberta Motor Association (AMA), we truly appreciate the value of our members, and we want their AMA digital experience to be purposeful and memorable. To better achieve this, we're looking for a Optimization Specialist to test, research and analyze . Does this sound like you?

**This role is a remote contract vendor role**

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • You love to share thoughts and ideas - after all, two heads are better than one.
  • You're creative and resourceful and enjoy working with data to measure and analyze online consumer behavior.
  • You 'get' what it means to be part of the team.
  • You manage your time as expertly as you manage your projects. Prioritizing, planning and organizing are part of your DNA.
  • You enjoy talking about marketing tactics, advertising and search engine optimization.
  • You're 'web-savvy' and current on Internet trends, tools and technologies.
  • You're a natural at finding business solutions through detailed research and analytics and presenting them to others.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • You will report to the Team Lead, Marketing Operations.
  • Interpret data from a variety of sources, conduct analysis and offer meaningful and relevant recommendations that address and respond to business needs and challenges.
  • Lead the design, implementation, and analysis of digital experiments
  • Develop personalization and site optimization strategies to drive conversion across all major lead/sales funnels
  • Perform detailed analysis and report results across programs, campaigns and segments and make actionable recommendations for improvement.
  • Continually test and optimize existing campaigns to identify areas of improvement
  • Ensure reliable digital measurement, analysis, and optimization information through the implementation of Google Analytics, Google AdWords, Optimizely and other digital marketing tools.
  • Develop in-depth reporting to provide meaningful visibility into AMA's business lines.
  • Use member data and behaviors to research and analyze business trends to identify new opportunities.
  • Perform multivariate or A/B tests to improve the member experience and optimize the performance of AMA's online properties.
  • Establish measures of success (KPIs) for monitoring and testing through sequential, A/B and multivariate testing.
  • Set up and and maintain Google Analytics and Tag Manager.
  • Utilize Google Analytics dashboard for site tracking and to perform regular maintenance.
  • Work closely with AMA business units to develop custom scheduled and ad hoc reports to meet their information requirements - after all, it's all about the end user experience!

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • You have a university degree or post-secondary diploma in a related field such as computer science or marketing. Have a degree in something else? Tell us about it and how you can use it in this role.
  • You have a minimum of 3 years' experience in delivering conversion testing and optimization.
  • You already have extensive experience working with shared web analytics tools such as Google Analytics,
  • You also really know your way around advanced web analytics/methodologies, such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys, and market research.

You're comfortable and willing to incorporate your own business, or already have.

AS A CONTRACTOR WE OFFER YOU:

  • Compensation for your performed services and your time.
  • Bonus pay incentive program.
  • Flexibility for your work/life balance and earning potential.
  • Excellent support from AMA with our brilliant and up to date industry knowledge.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Service Advisor
description:
Service Advisor - (2200007M)
Description
A growing global company. Endless career and development opportunities.
When you join Ritchie Bros., you’ll be part of a diverse, global team that’s focused on delivering great customer experiences. Our culture is centered around people and guided by our core values of Integrity, Unity and Vision. Learn more about our culture and commitment to diversity and inclusion at Candidate Portal.
If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are passionate about making a difference, we invite you to join our growing team. Whether you’re out in the field or back at your office, you’ll be helping us achieve our vision of becoming the trusted global marketplace for insights, services and transaction solutions for commercial assets.
We’re looking for a Refurbishing Coordinator in Bolton, Ontario.
The Opportunity:
The Refurbishing Coordinator reports directly to the Yard Manager while supporting the management and sales teams in preparation for sales. The Refurbishing Coordinator will also maintain the duties of administrating the yard. The Refurbishing Coordinator will have an office based in the yard office.
In this role you’ll:
  • Manage the maintenance of the facilities including the following:
    • Wash Bay(s)
    • Sandblast Bay(s)
    • Paint Booth(s)
    • Detail Bay(s)
    • Mechanic Bay(s)
    • RBA Shop
    • Virtual Theatre
    • Ramp
    • Main Front Office
    • All aspects relating to the auction building inside & outside
  • Manage all aspects of auction (inbound-outbound) refurbishing including the following:
    • Identification of auction items in need of refurbishment
    • Documentation of approval to proceed with prescribed refurbishing
    • Creation of purchase orders
    • Communication with refurbishing service providers
    • Ensure work authorized is performed to an acceptable standard in an acceptable time frame
    • Process invoices from refurbishing service providers
    • Ensure cost sheets are completed on time and accurately
    • Inclusion of refurbishing quotes on buyers invoices
    • Management of outbound billing and accounts receivable
  • Manage Intelex reporting related to refurbishing including the following:
    • Incidents (caused by refurbishing or resulting in repair or refurbishing)
    • Waste material tracking
    • Post auction and quarterly facility inspections
  • Manage all aspects of non-auction refurbishing including the following:
    • Solicitation of work/quotation process
    • Advertising initiatives
    • Management of non-auction billing and accounts receivable
  • Manage the auction site’s Safety Program.
    • Manage the auction site’s COR initiative.
    • Plan safety meetings along with the YM or AYM.
    • Coordinate all safety training for the yard staff.
    • Manage all hazard assessments and all other safety related duties.
    • Facilitate new employee orientations.
    • Intelex reporting.
  • Actively support the RB Unreserved Commitment to Safety: to send everyone home, every day, the way they came to work, by taking personal responsibility for your safety and safety of your team, co-workers and customers.
Here’s what you bring:
  • High school graduate or GED equivalent.
  • Strong time-management skills and able to proactively manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build strong relationships.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives without supervision.
  • Work well in a team environment.
This job will require you to:
  • Manage the maintenance of the auction yard including the fences, lights, and RBA owned equipment. Ensure the full time mechanic is aware of any problems.
  • Manage along with the full time mechanic the dismantle, loading, packaging and shipping any outbound container freight.
  • Manage the unloading and assembly of any inbound container based freight.
  • Develop strategies to increase the volume of refurbishing.
  • Manage customer concerns related to refurbishing.
  • Track refurbishing totals for reports.
  • Maintain a stock of necessary supplies for the yard staff and mechanics.
  • Manage the administration of the yard including the following:
    • Manage purchase orders for all yard expenses.
    • Coordinate with YM and CSM for completion of “Quarter-end” reporting.
    • Source providers.
  • Manage Before & After Photographs of machinery as it pertains to the refurb lots.
  • Manage along with the full time mechanic any construction, renovation or retrofit projects pertaining to the refurbishing facilities.
  • Manage and maintain the service provider agreements with all refurbishing & third party vendors including insurance and WCB renewals.
  • Manage the auction site’s relationship with the Paint Service Contractor.
  • Ensure that the Paint Service Contractor is in compliance with all of the conditions of the Annual Paint Services Agreement.
What We Offer:
Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how:
  • Base salary + paid overtime
  • Comprehensive medical and dental benefits.
  • RRSP / Pension plan and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match.
  • Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.

Ritchie Bros. has grown from a small-town auctioneer to a global asset management and disposition company. Through our family of companies, we help our customers buy and sell a wide range of used and unused equipment for construction, mining, transportation, agriculture, oil & gas, lifting & material handling, forestry & other industries.

Ritchie Bros. is an equal opportunity employer and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with all applicable laws. This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Candidate selection is made by Talent Acquisition. Only electronic applications can be accepted. No agency calls, please.

If you require any accommodation, please send an email to: careers@rbauction.com.


Primary Location: CA-ON-Bolton
Work Locations: Toronto 3 Manchester Ct Bolton L7E 2Y1
Job: Yard Operations
Job Posting: Mar 29, 2022, 3:18:46 PM

title: Office Administrator
description:
Reporting to the President of the Board of the Niagara United Soccer Club, the Club Office Administrator is responsible for the operations that occur within the office, including providing exemplary customer service to the Club’s membership.

General Duties and Responsibilities

The following are a list of general duties for which the Club Office Administrator is responsible (may not be fully inclusive):

Supervise, create and implement systems that will computerize general office administration including all forms of communication.

  • Supervise volunteers or provide individual support processing registrations at the clubhouse:
  • Handling cash
  • Debit/credit card transactions
  • Processing approved registration funds
  • Maintain inventory of office supplies and all related equipment.
  • Maintain cleanliness and organization at the clubhouse.
  • Enter registrations into the AIMS System through the Ontario Soccer Association.
  • Supervise, create, implement, and participate in new and existing fundraising events.
  • Supervise, create, implement, and participate in new and existing workshops or clinics.
  • Provide support at Club tournaments, clinics and camps where required.
  • Supervise, create and implement content for club website, newsletters and advertising material.
  • Create and improve upon social media presence on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and Instagram.
  • Manage Club sponsorship program.
  • Assist in management of house league program.
  • Assist Board Treasurer in routine processing of transactions.
  • Assist Board members as needed.
  • Liaise between the governing bodies: Ontario Soccer Association, Niagara Soccer Association, and various leagues.
  • Supervisor and control all outside contractors.
  • Create, implement, and participate in community outreach programs for youth.
  • Travel to other soccer locations within the area if assistance is required at remove events.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum three (3) years administrative experience
  • Ability to work flexible schedules, including increased hours and weekends during summer/soccer season months with less hours worked during the off season.
  • Strong communication and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated computer and organizational skills
  • Experience in reporting to an Executive Board
  • Must be willing to work non-traditional hours

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 20-40 per week

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Following Covid restrictions as required by government mandate.

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Front desk: 1 year (preferred)
  • Administrative experience: 1 year (preferred)

title: Marketing Communications Advisor (rep term) - #42/22
description:
BE PART OF THE TEAM THAT

BRINGS THE WORLD TOGETHER

Job Opportunity: Marketing Communications Advisor (replacement term for a period of up to one year)


Join an organization that plays a critical role in Canada’s economy. At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we focus on doing the incredible work it takes to become the world’s most sustainable port.


The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is responsible for the stewardship of the Port of Vancouver, Canada’s largest and most diversified port. Our mandate as a Canada Port Authority, as set out by the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada’s trade objectives, ensuring goods are moved safely and responsibly through the Port of Vancouver. That means providing infrastructure and ensuring the safe and efficient movement of marine traffic and cargo within the port. It also means we carry out reviews of proposed activities and developments on federal port lands and waters to determine whether a project can go ahead without impacts to the environment and community that cannot be mitigated.


We are passionate about the work we do and what it contributes to our local communities, the region and our country. This is reflected in our values of collaboration, continuous improvement, accountability and customer responsiveness.


Be a part of a team that advances initiatives to promote economic prosperity through trade, a healthy environment and thriving communities for the future generations of Canadians.

It’s a workplace where the intrinsic value of your contribution to help foster the continued growth of the Canadian economy becomes a tangible reality. Bring your unique strengths, perspectives and experiences to the port authority and join us in charting a course toward a sustainable future.


The marketing communications advisor is responsible for the research, analysis, development, implementation and evaluation of strategic marketing communications and trade media in support of Trade Development and divisional initiatives. This position actively participates in the development and implementation of strategic customer communications and provides advice to develop and implement integrated and multi-channel marketing communications to promote the Vancouver gateway in alignment with the port’s business plans, corporate messaging and related initiatives. The position develops trade specific content and marketing communications and undertakes other activities as directed.


The Marketing Communications Advisor will:


Marketing Communications Planning

  • Actively participates and advises on the development and implementation of the marketing communications strategy in support of the marketing plan across the business sectors, and consistent with the port authority’s customer engagement strategy.
  • Recommends opportunities to leverage the port brand at various industry trade shows, conferences, events and other customer engagement opportunities, and supports senior and executive leadership participation as required.
  • Provides advice and analysis in the selection, development, implementation and measurement of integrated and multi-channel marketing communications tactics.
  • Works closely with the marketing communications coordinator to implement tactics.

Earned and Paid Media Strategy


  • Develops and recommends departmental earned and paid media strategy.
  • Recommends proactive media tactics including pitching and writing articles, writing and producing features, industry award applications, as well as prepares content in response to information requests from industry publications.
  • Liaises with advertising agency, creative designer, publications and other external contractors to ensure key messages and branding are articulated across all creatives.
  • Identifies and pursues earned media opportunities.
  • Develops and implements the annual media plan.

Writing and Content Development

  • Creates original content to support customer strategic communications and increase awareness of the port authority’s mandate and role, as well as the importance of the Port of Vancouver’s competitive advantages, to industry audiences.
  • Researches, writes and develops content for distribution to business audiences across multiple mediums including, but not limited to print and digital publications, website, social media platforms, PowerPoint presentations, video and podcasts.
  • Works with internal market and customer intelligence personnel to design, publish and disseminate developed research, think-pieces and publications for internal and external audiences.
  • Provides divisional support by designing and developing marketing communications content and tools for the Division.

Customer Engagement and Outreach Support

  • In collaboration with customer facing representatives, builds relationships outside of the organization with key customers’ communications and marketing staff for the purpose of developing joint/aligned messaging

The successful candidate will have completed a university degree in communications, journalism, marketing, political science, or another acceptable discipline, along with a minimum of four years in strategic communications in a corporate environment, including a minimum three years related experience in developing marketing communication plans and producing business communications collateral for trade publications. Experience in integrated marketing communications which includes digital communications (eg. social media), digital advertising (eg. Search media) and digital trade marketing as required. Must have experience supporting complex customer engagement and dealing with large national and international customers. Must have excellent writing and editing skills with the ability to synthesize complex information.



Must be a self-motivated, creative and innovative individual who consistently demonstrates initiative. Must have excellent interpersonal skills, including tact, diplomacy and the ability to liaise and collaborate effectively and positively with staff and external contacts at all levels. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a talent for writing and editing. Must be a team player with a "customer service" focus and a tolerance for ambiguity. Good organizational skills, technological competency in web-based and social media content, a results orientation and flexibility to perform multiple tasks are required


The health and safety our of employees is a priority and the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is committed to ensuring a safe workplace. Vaccinations, in combination with other preventative health and safety measures, offer the best available protection against COVID-19 and that is why port authority employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Providing proof of vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment.


Candidates may be accommodated for this requirement if they are approved for a legal exemption; accommodation may be requested only for religious and medical reasons, or other protected grounds under the Canadian Human Rights Act. If you’re seeking accommodation to the COVID-19 vaccination requirement, please indicate your request during the recruitment process.


The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority offers a competitive total compensation package including an earned time off program. Please note this posting will remain open until filled.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.


At the port authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community.


Learn more about us at www.portvancouver.com

title: Representative - Outside Sales
description:
We are seeking an Outside Sales Representative. In this role, you will be responsible for developing new prospects and interacting with assigned customers to increase sales and margin of the company's products and/or services. Your primary focus is on face-to-face selling and account management activities to meet sales revenue goals by assessing customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and/or solutions and ensure a smooth sales process. There will be a certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. You will be expected to engage with all levels of the customers’ organizations including technical, operations, supply chain and executive management. You may be required to develop and deliver sales bids, presentations, proposals and/or product demonstrations.

Responsibilities:

  • Executes and expands assigned customer account plan(s) which is developed in conjunction with management.
  • Executes on billing margin initiatives through value added services, marketing programs, and supplier engagement.
  • Prospects potential customers, including cold calling and developing leads through referral channels.
  • Communicates with customers and leads to identify and understand their product or service needs; identifies and suggests products and services to meet those needs.
  • Demonstrates the functions and utility of products or services to customers based on their needs.
  • Ensures customer satisfaction through ongoing communication and relationship management; resolves any issues that may arise post-sale.
  • Maintains communication with existing and previous customers, alerting them of new products, services, and enhancements that may be of interest.
  • Utilizes sales management tools for sales planning, supplier planning and documenting opportunities.
  • Develops and grows product knowledge through WESCO and supplier training.
  • Develops strong relationships with suppliers, including performing regular joint sales calls.
  • Provides quotations directly or in conjunction with sales support team.

Qualifications :

  • High School Degree or Equivalent
  • Bachelor’s Degree is preferred
  • Prior sales experience required, outside sales preferred
  • Two years of industry experience preferred
  • Ability to travel to current and potential clients and suppliers.
  • Ability to work flexible schedule and occasional overnight travel.
  • Excellent sales and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to develop and deliver presentations.
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Effective communicator both written and verbally.
  • Ability to work in team environment.
  • Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills.
  • Knowledge of advertising and sales promotion techniques (Preferred).

Travel Requirements:

  • 50-75%

WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.

#LI-ES1


WESCO International, Inc. (NYSE: WCC), a publicly traded FORTUNE 250 company, is a leading provider of business-to-business distribution, logistics services and supply chain management solutions. Pro forma 2019 annual sales were over $17 billion, including Anixter International which it acquired in June 2020.

WESCO offers a best-in-class product and services portfolio of Electrical and Electronic Solutions, Communications and Security Solutions, and Utility and Broadband Solutions. The company employs over 18,000 people, maintains relationships with over 30,000 suppliers, and serves more than 150,000 customers worldwide. With nearly 1.5 million products, end-to-end supply chain services, and leading digital capabilities, WESCO provides innovative solutions to meet customer needs across commercial and industrial businesses, contractors, government agencies, institutions, telecommunications providers, and utilities.

WESCO operates nearly 800 branch and warehouse locations in over 50 countries, providing a local presence for customers and a global network to serve multi-location businesses and multi-national corporations.

At WESCO, we build, connect, power, and protect the world. We have the capabilities and expertise to deliver the latest technologies, including: Industrial networking, Intelligent buildings, Cloud computing, Alternative energy, Broadband communications, Critical infrastructure protection, LED lighting retrofits, and Physical security.

title: Paid Channel Strategist
description:
Landscape Management Network (LMN) is a SaaS software company, that works with tens of thousands of companies in the landscape and snow industries across North America.

Based in Markham, Ontario with offices in London, Ontario, and Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, plus a growing team in the U.S, we serve over 3,000 landscape and snow industry companies across North America each day.

Our software in 2021 created more than 695,000 invoices, tracked more than two million timesheets for crews, and provided more than $1.9 billion in service invoices and $865 million in invoice to the customers of contractors.

We are leading the shift to SaaS while revolutionizing the way contractors sell, service and innovate with their customers. LMN launched in 2009 and has seen record growth to today being a high-performing team of over 100 employees working towards a common goal: To develop a thriving landscaping industry that empowers great people to make a positive impact in the environment that surrounds us.

We also offer the industry’s most robust online training software in Greenius, and have introduced our own lending arm called LMN Lend to provide access to capital to the green industry to fuel their growth.

We’re also a Great Place to Work, having received the recognition from the workforce authority Great Place to Work Canada in November 2021.

At LMN, we fostered a “more human, less corporate” culture that is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success.

Why work at LMN?

  • LMN is the leading business management software focused on the landscape industry. We get to help amazing people every day build great businesses.
  • Enjoy our newly renovated office, close to downtown London and driving minutes from Springbank Park!
  • We value your feedback and do our best to incorporate your great ideas into our day-to-day operations.
  • We support professional development and back this statement up with fun, interactive training, and development opportunities!
  • We care SO much about our team and have a fantastic Culture Committee dedicated specifically to Communications and Culture, with the goal of making sure ‘LMN’ is the best place you will ever work!
  • You want to be part of a fun, fast paced, collaborative team.
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package (based on education and experience).

Summary of Position:

Leads all paid media channel strategy and team members.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Develop strategies for paid media campaigns for multiple brands across multiple social platforms, search engines, display networks and partner media to drive purchases and leads
  • Oversee and assist with planning, building and optimization of all paid media and paid partner campaigns
  • Manage and maintain budget pacing strategies as well as manage invoicing
  • Collaborate on data, measurement & reporting strategies to demonstrate a clear ROI from our efforts
  • Apply conversion rate optimization techniques and collaborate with digital marketing
  • Manage and develop direct report(s) by providing career development plans, regular reviews, coaching and real-time feedback on work and engagements
  • Assist with the digital advertising content development process for different brands including keyword research, copywriting, creative direction, scheduling, publishing, and gaining the necessary approvals
  • Stay up to date with the latest paid media trends, best practices and educate internal teams

Required Skills and Knowledge:

  • Spoken English (Fluent), Written English (Professional Level)
  • Ability to get to the root of the problem, address issues and follow up in a timely manner
  • Ability to pick up new concepts/technologies quickly
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with the ability to multitask
  • Ability to deliver the positive voice of LMN in all interactions
  • Knowledge of mentoring teammates and colleagues
  • Ability to handle ambiguity in a positive manner
  • Ability to show empathy and patience when interacting with staff and clients
  • Skills/experience in the field of paid media, paid search, paid social, display/programmatic
  • Skills/experience in developing integrated Paid Media programs that translate into results in lead generation, ecommerce, and SaaS environments

Qualifications:

  • Must have a post secondary education
  • 4-6 years of experience in the field
  • Must have appropriate transit to attend the directing branch office
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada

Job Type:

Full-time, Permanent, Monday to Friday, annual salary base $120,000, Annual Bonus, Benefits, 3% Health Care Spending Account, Disability Coverage, Life Insurance, Vacation Accrued, Sick Credits, RRSP Matching and more…

Location: Markham, Ontario

# Hires: 1

LMN is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, LMN will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any material or processes used to ensure your equal participation.


Apply Now

To apply click the button below.
