title: HR/Payroll Operations Specialist - Remote Global
location: Remote in National Capital Region, ON
description:
Our mission at BBE is to be premier Amazon strategists by successfully evolving and adapting to the ever-changing environment that is Amazon and e-commerce. Our strategic growth mindset and holistic approach encourage forward-thinking and provide the greatest potential for success for our Brand Partners.

The ideal candidate is a proactive learner and strong communicator with extensive knowledge about selling on Amazon. Our team members are expected to adopt all of BBE’s internal processes, master the art of Amazon selling, and have a proactive attitude.

If you are a talented HR/Payroll Operations Specialist with US based payroll processing experience, Buy Box Experts wants to speak with you!
We are a fast growing Amazon marketing agency looking for an HR/Payroll Operations Specialist to join our People Operations team. The ideal candidate pays attention to the details and has the ability to independently problem solve. Working for a fast-paced and growing agency makes this position an exciting opportunity!

Buy Box Experts is redefining e-commerce, boosting our clients’ revenue by leaps and bounds, by helping companies reach their potential on Amazon. Join Buy Box Experts where you can reach your professional potential.
Professional Development at BBE provides opportunities for our employees to continuously grow their skills and, ultimately, to achieve their personal and professional goals. We are committed to supporting the learning and development of BBEs’ most valuable resource: our people.

Responsibilities

  • Process semi-monthly US payroll in ADP Workforce Now.
  • Process international payroll through our 3rd party contractor provider system
  • Ensures payroll transactions are processed accurately and timely
  • Respond to and process HR Ticket requests via JIRA
  • Complete verification of employment requests
  • Work with global benefits provider to ensure newly eligible employees are added to the plan
  • Respond to benefit related inquiries and works with benefit vendor as applicable to resolve issues
  • Provision access to HR, Recruiting and Global Contractor Tools
  • Process HR transactions in the HR System such as departmental changes, job title changes, Manager changes, salary changes, worker category changes, promotions terminations and other data changes and corrections.
  • Initiates onboarding and creates employee records
  • Prepares and maintains human resources and employee benefits data and reports
  • Responds to benefit inquiries
  • Assist with creating/updating SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)
  • Partners with other teams to provide necessary information for successful onboarding and offboarding
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to create a partnership that yields success, predictable results and credibility
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

  • Experience with processing US Payroll
  • Strong working knowledge of Payroll Systems (ADP Workforce Now Preferred)
  • Timekeeping/Timecard Reconciliation
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Human Resources or related field or the equivalent work experience in Payroll and Human Resources
  • Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be able to speak, read, write, and understand English fluently
  • Ability to communicate professionally and effectively in person, on the phone, electronically, or through other means to individuals and groups.
  • Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to understand and follow written and verbal instructions
  • Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all organizational levels.
  • Commitment to excellence and high standards.
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of various teams.
  • Acute attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated ability to plan and organize projects.
  • Ability to effectively communicate with people at all levels and from various backgrounds.

What You Need

  • This is a remote position and requires candidates to have an available work-from-home setup
  • Desktop/Laptop system requirements:
  • 4th generation or higher, at least Intel i3 or equivalent processor;
  • at least 4GB RAM;
  • Windows 10 and above or MAC OSX operating system
  • A strong and stable internet connection (A DSL, cable or fiber wired internet service with 10 Mbps plan or higher for primary connection)
  • PC Headset
  • A high-definition (HD) external or integrated webcam with at least 720p resolution.
Buy Box Experts considers candidates who meet the specific job qualifications, whether they are located near our Lindon, UT office or have the ability to work remotely.

Please visit comparably.com/companies/buy-box-experts to learn more about us. ABOUT BUY BOX EXPERTS Buy Box Experts is a premier Amazon marketing agency, supporting brand executives as they seek to CONTROL and GROW their Amazon channel businesses (in the US and internationally).

As a team that includes 20+ former Amazon employees, we help our brand clients develop channel management strategies that reduce price erosion issues, and align marketing efforts with the brand's overall brand vision. We provide full platform account management (1P retail, 3P marketplace and hybrid) incorporating inventory management, listing optimization, advertising campaign management (including AMS, DSP), and customer service. We also operate traffic-building campaigns external to Amazon, designed to drive high-converting traffic to Amazon. We conduct Amazon channel due diligence for private equity and investors looking to acquire brands that depend heavily on Amazon as a sales channel. The Buy Box Experts leadership team is very focused on building a company culture focused on being inclusive, encouraging open discussion of issues, and developing the team through a growth-based mindset. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Product Manager, Off Platform Experiences (Digital)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
The Globe and Mail is a national icon and Canada’s most recognized media brand.

We’re also an international award winner for data visualization, design, and creative storytelling. A digital innovator with a global client list for our in-house AI-powered optimization, prediction and automation platform. And a place where Canadians come for the best journalism in the country.

We aim to reflect Canada in the stories we tell and in our workforce. The Globe is a proud partner of Pride At Work, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and a signatory of the BlackNorth Initiative. We understand our staff have lives outside of the office and offer flexible work arrangements and support programs. We also provide training and mentorships to staff to ensure you’re able to grow and challenge yourself and your abilities.

No matter what your role at The Globe, you’ll be part of an organization dedicated to making a difference to Canada.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Globe and Mail is seeking a digital Product Manager to work on developing off platform experiences that connect, engage and inspire audiences.

As the Product Manager of Off Platform experiences, you are the go-to expert for anywhere Globe and Mail content is available outside of our owned and operated sites and apps. You will work closely with platform partners to ensure that readers can find The Globe and Mail everywhere they are looking for timely and relevant news. This includes (but not limited to) platforms like Apple, Google, Facebook and Flipboard.

As a Product Manager, you work hand-in-hand with a Product Designer to fully understand who is using each platform and what problems they face in their daily lives that The Globe can help solve. From this deep knowledge of the customer, you will build out and pursue a roadmap that you can measure your progress against over time. Comfort with analytics and a mix of quantitative and qualitative data is a must.

As a Product Manager at The Globe and Mail, you must be the undisputed expert on your product. You are responsible for evaluating opportunities and ensuring that what gets built and delivered to customers is both valuable and viable. You do this by making sure that what goes into the product backlog is truly worth building so that readers can engage with our content everywhere they are.

In this role, you will be a member of The Globe’s Digital department and report to the Senior Product Manager. The position requires collaboration with development teams, design and UX, the newsroom, advertising, marketing and consumer sales staff across the organization.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Be the go-to expert on the following product areas: Apple News, Google News, Facebook, Podcasts, Feeds and technical SEO
  • Be the point of contact for all Off Platform vendors
  • Be the champion for Globe and Mail priorities when working with Off Platform vendors
  • Stay on top of the ever-changing digital news landscape and vendor’s roadmaps, identifying new opportunities or enhancements and ensuring that The Globe and Mail’s experience is best in class
  • Contribute to the long-term product vision and roadmap by owning the experience on all off-platform properties
  • Manage podcast platforms to ensure content is readily available on all appropriate streaming services
  • Perform periodic technical SEO audits of our website, making short and long term SEO strategy recommendations
  • Monitor SEO trends, best practices and techniques to identify opportunities to ensure globeandmail.com is maximizing crawl budget and indexing
  • Support RSS feeds and syndication projects
  • Define product metrics, collect user data and customer feedback as business intelligence, and communicate within teams to support data-driven decisions
  • Partnering with a Product Designer, identify problems, validate hypothesis and ideate solutions through continuous product discovery
  • Develop deep empathy for our customers by learning their needs, pain points, wants, goals, and motivations
  • Assume end-to-end ownership of off-platform projects by leading them through brainstorming, ideation, design, proof-of-concept, implementation, testing, launch and on-going maintenance
  • Prioritize while balancing the needs of the customer and the business
  • Collaborate with engineering teams to deliver feasible technical solutions and reasonable implementation timelines
  • Adopt agile methodologies and engage regularly with scrum teams by writing and clarifying user stories, defining acceptance criteria and participating in backlog grooming
  • Collaborate with cross functional stakeholders on business requirements, product delivery and handovers
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2+ years of digital product-management experience
  • Proven history working on and launching successful digital consumer experiences
  • Clear understanding of news media content as a product
  • Experience working with platform vendors like Apple, Google and Facebook (exposure to Apple News + or Subscribe with Google would be an asset)
  • Passion for emerging platforms, social media and podcasts
  • Comfortable working with external vendors and championing for the needs of our business
  • Experience working with digital advertising
  • Solid understanding of technical SEO (crawl budget, structured data, redirects, internal linking, sitemaps and site structure)
  • Familiarity with RSS feeds and content syndication.
  • Experience working in an agile environment
  • Experience using analytics to inform decisions and measure success
  • High attention to detail and follow-through
  • Creative and open-minded, with the ability to think critically and strategically
  • An aptitude for problem-solving and active-listening
  • Demonstrable meeting facilitation and presentation skills
  • Comfort with blending self-directed strategies together with business needs driven elsewhere in the org chart into a unified plan for the products you work on
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience

If you aren’t sure that you tick all of these boxes, please consider applying and explore in your cover letter why you feel you have the potential to grow into the role.

VACCINATION POLICY:
All offers of employment with The Globe and Mail are conditional upon the candidate being Fully Vaccinated. To be Fully Vaccinated is defined as someone who has received the full series of a vaccine or a combination of vaccines accepted by the Government of Canada (currently Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Janssen) and has received the last dose at least 14 days prior to their start date. To prove they are Fully Vaccinated, all new hires will be required to provide evidence by emailing a copy of their vaccine dose administration receipt(s) to Human Resources prior to their start date. Those seeking exemption based on one or more of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code will need to provide their request for accommodation to Human Resources for approval. If the accommodation request is not approved and the candidate is not Fully Vaccinated, any offer of employment will be revoked.

THE GLOBE AND MAIL IS DEDICATED TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION IN THE WORKPLACE

The Globe and Mail is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We believe this strengthens our business and our journalism. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, regardless of race, ethnicity, culture, gender, sexual orientation, religion, socio-economic status, age, and physical ability. As required by the Federal Contractors Program, The Globe also tracks the proportion of staff in the four Employment Equity categories (Women, Aboriginal Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, and Members of Visible Minorities) to ensure we are reflecting the areas in which we work.

The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: title
description: description

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Duration: 6-12 Months to start, renewals probable.

Must Have:

  • You take a user-centric design approach and apply design thinking and ideations across your work.
  • You have a portfolio demonstrating your experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments,
  • Building out user stories, journey maps, mockups, and prototypes.
  • Conducting user workshops and A/B testing.
  • Addressing heuristic analysis, usability, and accessibility concerns.
  • You have expertise in design software such as Sketch and Abstract, Adobe Creative Suite, Figma and Marvel.
  • You may have exposure to Balsamiq, Axure, InVision, and UXPin
  • The practical knowledge. You have experience in using UX best practices to design solutions, applying a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You can rapidly iterate designs and solutions intelligently and clearly communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to internal and external teams.
The Role:

You will utilize quantitative and qualitative research to generate meaningful insights that will drive creative concepts. You will translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and rapid prototypes - optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces, leading to intuitive user experiences. You will apply your findings to create detailed UI designs for the product and development team.

Be a thought-leader. You will identify design problems and devise elegant solutions drawing on best practices and past experience to make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Collaborate and iterate. You will collaborate with Product and Development, working with internal and external clients to answer critical business questions. You will elicit needs and draw on user research and insights to create user journeys and user stories. You will workshop and test ideas with customers, iterating designs based on findings and feedback; relaying your commitment to a positive, engaging user experience.

title: Communications Specialist
description:
Reference Code: IT044594

Details and Requirements:



Looking for Services of a Communications Specialist with the following (or similar) to assist in the delivery of professional communication services including the following:


• Create content (presentations, videos, articles, success stories, etc.) that develops awareness, knowledge, and understanding across the enterprise of high-level Digital initiatives.
• Develops and promotes communication channels to connect all Manitoba Hydro employees to Digital leaders to enable feedback, sharing, ideas, and dialogue.
• Consistently integrate Digital and Technology initiatives into channels and content.
• Collaborate with Corporate Communications for internal communications to ensure alignment with enterprise messaging, tone, and narrative.
• Arrange and coordinate key events (Brown Bag presentations, etc.).
• Collaborate/coordinate with Business Transformation Office communications and change activities,
• Lead the development of compelling messaging and execution of communication activities across all Digital transformation efforts.

• Provide expertise and support in writing, editing, and producing consistent and quality communications content.



Requirements:
A four-year degree in Communications, Public Relations, or Journalism from an institute of recognized standing and a minimum of five years of directly related experience in Communications, Public Relations and/or Creative Communications
OR
A two-year diploma in Creative Communications from an institute of recognized standing and a minimum of seven years of directly related experience in Communications, Public Relations and/or Creative Communications.
Excellent analytical, decision making, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information clearly and concisely both oral and written.
• Must demonstrate ability to work independently
• Are subject to a PRA (Personnel Risk Assessment)

title: P3 - UX Researcher
description:
Are you proficient in quantitative analysis and data management? If so, this would be a great
opportunity for you!

Our client is looking for a UX Researcher for a 12 month contract in Kitchener. This position is remote for
now, but they are going fully onsite in a few months. Seeking for candidates with below requirements.

Advantages
 Looking for someone to start as soon as possible
 Earn a competitive rate within the industry
 Remote for now
 Long term contract

Responsibilities
 Working independently to support game developer-facing UX Research work.
 Working closely with UX designers, engineers, and product managers, and other researchers,
gaining insights from a variety of people who create digital games.
 Owning individual research projects, including designing, setting up, analyzing, and presenting
results from usability tests, interviews, and surveys.
 Understanding study needs, create research plans, organize study materials, define respondent
/ participant criteria, and organize materials needed for research activities.
 Analyzing and reporting on data from research activities.
 Summarizing data from past research in new formats for various stakeholders.

Qualifications
 M.A/M.S. (completed) in Psychology, Sociology, Human Factors, HCI, or other fields emphasizing
human behavior.
 At least 2-3 years of industry experience working with xfn partners.
 Solid understanding of and comfort with qualitative methods and foundational research.
 Proficiency in basic quantitative analysis and data management.
 Demonstrated understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods,
including when and how to apply them during the product development process.
 Experience producing multiple reporting artifacts for diverse stakeholders.
 Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.
 Excellent organization skills and detail-oriented.
Nice to have:
 At least one year experience conducting research on enterprise-facing products or experiences.
 Familiar with the gaming industry.
 Experience working on video games or related experiences, or a strong intrinsic interest in video
games.

Summary
Interested in the UX Researcher role in Kitchener? Apply online today!
Candidates moving to the next step of the recruitment process will be contacted.

As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Senior Product Analyst REMOTE
description:
Are you a talented Product Analyst, keen to deliver solutions designed to improve customer value? Our Regina Saskatchewan client is seeking to hire a Product Analyst to join their team on a long-term contract with high potential for extension. Apply to this amazing Product Analyst opportunity today!

What’s in it for you!
As a Product Analyst with our Regina client, you’ll receive:
• Competitive market hourly rates.
• A 12-month contract with high potential for extension.
• Remote interview process.
• Opportunity to work from home during Covid-19.

What will you do?
As a Product Analyst with our Regina client, you will:
• Analyze business and data requirements, analyze and test large volumes of data, help build data models and data mapping, write complex SQL queries, and collaborate with development teams to facilitate application development and design
• Accountable for delivering solutions that enable organizational changes necessary to deliver value to employees and customers.
• Collaborates with the development team, product stakeholders, and end-users to understand, manage and document business requirements.
• Facilitates teamwork and seeks feedback from end-users and stakeholders.
• Involved in complex business and technical domains.
• Documents and executes user story acceptance tests.

How do you qualify?
To qualify for the Product Analyst role with our Regina client, you must have:
• 5+ years’ experience as a Senior Product Analyst/ Quality Analyst
• Experience with a variety of software solutions and technical applications.
• Strong technical quality assurance skills and experience
• General knowledge of systems analysis and design concepts.
• Experience working with data and data models
• Writing complex SQL

If the prospect of building a career in the technical and business domains by providing support while honing your product analysis skills intrigues you, then the Product Analyst role with our Regina Saskatchewan client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

title: Category Advisor, IT
description:
Client ID: 5162

Category Advisor, IT

On behalf of our client, Procom is seeking a Category Advisor, IT for a 6 months contract in Calgary, AB.

Category Advisor, IT Job Details

  • The Supply Chain Management team is seeking a Category Advisor, IT in their Enterprise Category Management team. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the portfolios of IT Hardware and Telecommunications.
  • This is a 6-month contract position. The candidate will be working in our downtown Calgary office three days per week and remotely two days per week.

Category Advisor, IT Responsibilities

  • Responsible for end-to-end Category Management of the IT Hardware and Telecommunications portfolios.
  • Execute on annual and long-term strategic planning and budgeting to secure supply of goods and services and manage the associated price and supply risks.
  • Review, interpret, and analyze legal and commercial contract terms and conditions in legal documents including master agreements, schedules, statements of work, pricing, confidentiality agreements or other documentation as required. These agreements will include but not be limited to software, hardware, services, hosted/cloud solutions, subscriptions and professional services.
  • Lead strategic sourcing initiatives including RFx activities, development of negotiation strategies and recommendations to award.
  • Ensure Cenovus is conducting business with financially viable, technically qualified suppliers, who operate within their expertise, and have a proven safety record.
  • Lead commercial negotiations with vendors ensuring goods and services are contracted in an efficient, effective manner bringing maximum value to the organization.
  • Interface with IT leadership team, subject matter experts and external vendors on contract management related tasks.
  • Ensure compliance to Supply Chain Business Rules, approved SCM channels, the Cenovus Code of Business Conduct & Ethics, company policies, standards, processes and regulatory requirements.
  • Provide administrative tasks required to manage contracts in the portfolio.
  • Conduct other related duties as required.

Category Advisor, IT Mandatory Skills

  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Post-secondary Business, Supply Chain or related degree
  • 5-7 years’ experience, ideally in an IT portfolio
  • Strong negotiation skills required
  • Experience leading and managing RFx activities
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills to effectively share ideas and issues with all levels of the organization
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail required
  • Oil & Gas experience is not required but will be considered an asset
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Office application suite
  • Experience within category management, strategic sourcing or supply chain
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills
  • Extensive experience leading and managing complex RFx activities
  • Undergraduate degree in Supply Chain Management, Engineering or Business discipline

Category Advisor, IT Assignment Length

6 months

 

Category Advisor, IT Location

Calgary, Alberta

 

Category Advisor, IT Start Date

ASAP

title: Marketing Specialist, Contractor Services
description:
Job Description:
Do you want to work in the heart of retail at one of the fastest growing and most successful retailers in the World?
Right now is an exceptionally dynamic time for retail and The Home Depot Canada is committed to being a leader in that transformation. We know that to do this, we need to invest in our retail experience, our technology but most importantly, our people. Our Associates’ talent is what has made us the #1 Home Improvement Retailer and what will keep us leading in retail. At The Home Depot, product innovation, customer service and exceptional value is why our customers keep coming back – our competitive advantage.
As part of the greater Pro, Loyalty Marketing team, the Marketing Specialist helps to plan and implement all marketing activities for the Contractor Services team, supporting our Pro, Home Services and Rental businesses, which includes all three of our growing base of customers – our Pro, DIFM (Do It For Me) and DIY (Do It Yourself) customers. In this role, the Marketing Specialist will lead and support campaigns ranging from brand building, product excitement and know-how focused, to CRM-based opportunities as we look to attract, retain and grow our customer base. Finally, the Marketing Specialist is empowered to lead their campaigns and partner with cross-functional teams to deliver on marketing objectives, as well as optimize current campaigns to improve performance.
This candidate will report directly into the Marketing Manager, Contractor Services.


What you will do:

The Marketing Specialist is a champion for our customers. In this position, the Marketing Specialist will develop their marketing skills by:

  • Leading marketing execution across cross-functional teams in display, social, digital flyer, email, online, TV, magazine, radio, other digital marketing channels Acting as the main point of contact for their cross-functional partners in order to help support the planning, production and launch of their marketing campaigns
  • Delivering campaign analysis, reporting and insights to influence and improve future campaigns
  • Developing test plans to continuously optimize and maximize campaign results
  • Building and maintaining an annual marketing and customer calendar, and competitive tracker
  • Communicating with internal partners to drive awareness and excitement for the marketing campaign
  • Executing against new and exciting marketing campaigns that will help differentiate and lead the market for the Contractor Services portfolio
  • Collaborating with key cross-functional partners such as the Pro, Home Services and Rental Operations team, Advertising, Production & Media partners, as well as merchants and other peer marketing teams to gain feedback and alignment in delivering against marketing campaigns goals
  • Influencing segmentation and targeting strategies to tailor the right message to the right audience



Who you are:
We are looking for people who are passionate about the customer and retail and:

  • Are a self-starter, driven by results and continuous improvement
  • Have strong project management and analytical skills
  • Build strong relationships and collaborate with colleagues, stake holders and vendors
  • Take the initiative to solve a challenge and seek new opportunities to test and learn
  • Focus on providing data and insights to guide key decisions
  • Love to plan and optimize resources to hit objectives
  • Are strong multi-taskers that can prioritize tasks to meet business objectives
  • Have strong communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders
  • Have a strong attention to detail


What you have done:

  • You have an undergraduate degree preferably in business, marketing or retail
  • You have 3+ years of previous marketing experience
  • You can build compelling presentations
  • You have a strong analytical mindset to measure marketing performance and identify key insights
  • You are a passionate marketer with experience in digital media
  • Brand Marketing experience is an asset


Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets Expectations and Consistently Demonstrates)

title: Marketing Analyst II
description:
Requisition Title: Marketing Analyst II | CAN

Description: The Canada Global Commercial Services (GCS) team offers a fast-paced environment with great opportunities for career growth and development. The team is responsible for developing and implementing innovative strategies across all Card and Non-Card Lending products to successfully target, acquire and nurture high-value customers.

We are seeking a Contractor to support Prospect Marketing Offer Strategy and Business Loans. The Contractor will be responsible for performing data analysis of past acquisition offers to help inform our go-forward strategy. They will also help lead the launch of our Business Loans product in the Outbound Telemarketing channel.

Primary responsibilities of this position include:

" Gather and maintain data analysis of Acquisition offers; provide insights into optimal offer constructs and opportunities to do further testing
" Co-ordinate across the broader acquisition team and other business units to ensure a cohesive product offer strategy and to gain alignment Manage the day-to-day relationship with the Outbound Telemarketing partner to drive acquisition performance, deliver reporting, and ensure operational excellence
" Enable Sales onboarding, training, call listening and best practice sharing to effectively manage performance with the vendor
" Gather Business Loan data insights, prepare reporting on Key Performance Indicators including conversion rates, average loan size, and risk profile of the acquired portfolio
" Develop and execute industry focused campaigns acquiring prospects
" Manage measurement, reporting, and analytics for the channel and continuously monitor performance against channel targets, analyze what is working / not working, identify areas for improvement and provide actionable recommendations
" Conduct regular performance review sessions with each vendor
" Execute performance based vendor compensation program

Qualifications

" Minimum 3 years experience in B2B marketing primarily in credit/lending would be preferred
" Personable, forward customer-first thinker that challenges the status quo with proven ability to drive results in a dynamic, collaborative and fast-paced environment
" Strong analytical and reporting skills with proficiency with MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint), Salesforce.com experience preferred
" Strong ability to learn quickly and adapt effectively with new dynamic plans, platforms and technologies
" A highly motivated self-starter with high energy and a very positive attitude
" Ability to work independently to manage multiple project priorities and details with multiple cross-functional teams
" A bachelor degree in business or marketing or related experience

title: Pricing Analyst- 8-month contract
description:
Eaton Electrical is currently seeking a Pricing Analyst (8-month contract) to join our Marketing team! This position is based at our Burlington, ON, facility.

Position Overview:

The candidate will be responsible for supporting the pricing function, aligned with Eaton’s growth strategy and Business- to- Business (B2B) customer journey. This includes, supporting the roll out of pricing tools, best practices and insights that help balance profitability and competitiveness.

The candidate should understand the importance of the B2B buyer journey and draw on the perspectives and needs of the customer, creating informative content that drives conversation, leads and sales. The role will require the candidate to collaborate with both sales and marketing teams.

In this function you will:

  • Partner with product managers to roll out the respective profit plan workbooks; responsibilities would include enhancing and maintaining the workbooks
  • Roll out advanced pricing methods, tools, systems, best practices, and technology to the commercial teams
  • Assist in execution of General Price Increase (GPI) including setting targets, coordinating market communications with division sales teams, and measurement of yield
  • Assist in implementation of pricing software and tools, profit waterfall projects, mix improvement, low margin opportunities
  • Analyze web and other sources of campaign data to provide insights for improvement
  • Support marketing events (webinars, distributor events, tradeshows)

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

  • University degree or college diploma in Marketing, Business or Communications from an accredited institution
  • Legally authorized to work in Canada on a permanent basis without company sponsorship
  • This position does not offer relocation

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with Microsoft Office specifically demonstrated advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerBI skills
  • Knowledge of the following software applications; QlikView, Business Intelligence, statistical and modeling software
  • Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills
  • Demonstrated leadership experience within campus and/or the community

Position Criteria:

  • Ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Effective time management and project management skills
  • Highly motivated, self-starting, enthusiastic, results oriented team player

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs. Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html

We make what matters work.

At Eaton, we believe that power, whether it’s electrical, hydraulic, or mechanical power -- is a fundamental part of people’s lives. Technology, transportation, energy, and infrastructure—these are things the world relies on every day. That’s why we are dedicated to helping our customers across the world find new ways to manage power more efficiently, safely, and sustainably. And we’re committed to improving people’s lives, the communities where we live and work, and the planet our future generations will depend on. Because that’s what really matters–and we’re here to make sure it works.

While our vision is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services, our culture and what we value can be represented in six essential leadership attributes expected of all Eaton employees.

  • We’re ethical -- we play by the rules and act with integrity.
  • We’re passionate -- we care deeply about what we do. We set high expectations and we perform.
  • We’re accountable -- we seek responsibility and take ownership. Wedo what we say.
  • We’re efficient -- we value speed and simplicity.
  • We’re transparent -- we say what we think. We make it okay to disagree.
  • We learn – we are curious, adaptable, and willing to teach what we know.

About Eaton:

As a power management company with 2020sales of $17.9billion, Eaton provides energy-efficient solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical power more efficiently, safety and sustainably. We haveapproximately 92,000 employees across the world and sell products to customers in more than 175 countries.

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Marketing

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

title: Leasing and Marketing Coordinator (12 Month Contract)
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

This is a perfect opportunity to join a well-established real estate company. As a Leasing Representative you will be an ambassador for the organization, so we are looking for someone who is a strong fit with our values and a positive reflection of our brand!

Responsibilities:
 
  • Maintain/establish strong relationships and ongoing contact with brokers, tenants and prospective tenants through meetings, luncheons, presentations, etc.
  • Negotiating financial and legal terms of leasing Proposals, Offers and Leases to achieve maximum value for our stakeholders.
  • Conduct property tours with prospects and develop in-depth knowledge of the portfolio.
  • Manage all marketing material to the brokerage community.
  • Coordinate communication between departments, i.e., asset management, construction, development, property management and accounting.
  • Strategically plan broker functions for the purpose of marketing space and maintaining business relationships.
  • Prepare and manage annual leasing budgets and other reporting as required.
  • Represent GWL Realty Advisors by maintaining the highest standards of professional ethics and integrity.
  • Attend industry related conferences and events.
  • Provide leasing/deal making support to the leasing department’s senior managers as required.

Qualifications:
 
  • Prior commercial leasing or brokerage experience (2-3 years)
  • Real estate license required
  • Strong working knowledge of offers, leases and the overall leasing process
  • Outgoing, articulate and well spoken with strong customer service skills
  • High attention to detail with strong abilities to multitask in an ever-changing environment
  • Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills and excellent presentation skills
  • Desktop publishing skills and working knowledge of Adobe InDesign
  • Post secondary degree or diploma in Business, Commerce or Real Estate Marketing while not required, is preferred.

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Marketing Specialist - 1 Year Contract
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract
Reference code: 103110
Primary Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
All Available Locations: Vancouver

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills...whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.

Do you want to serve as a trusted advisor and work with the Marketplace leaders to plan and execute a full complement of marketing initiatives to drive growth and enhance market positioning? Read more below!

What will your typical day look like?

As a Marketing Specialist, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency, responsible for end-to-end support of marketing and communications campaigns. You will have oversight for implementing marketing tactics such as thoughtware development, event planning, online activities, sponsorships, speaker and eminence programs. In this fast-paced role, you will deliver marketing campaigns on time, on schedule and on budget; all while delivering ROI. You will be working in close collaboration with our studio agency teams to deliver world-class campaigns to the client/business.

About the team

Deloitte's in-house marketing agency is seeking a Marketing Specialist to join the team.
As an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for working collaboratively with other team members and leading the execution of marketing programs, events and initiatives.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone who has:

  • Minimum 3-5 years of marketing experience
  • Completed undergraduate degree
  • Demonstrated experience in event coordination and collateral development
  • Experience working with senior professionals in a fast paced environment often with tight deadlines
  • Strong project management and event planning skills
  • Lead the implementation of marketing and communications campaigns or campaign initiatives as identified in the marketing plan. This may include, but is not limited to tactics such as:
    • collateral and thought ware development
    • event planning including virtual
    • digital and social media coordination
    • sponsorships
  • Have a high standard of quality and provide quality assurance review on all projects
  • Bilingualism is an asset

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Developer, Equity, QA, Quality Assurance, Marketing, Technology, Finance, Quality

title: Marketing Specialist - 1 Year Contract (Vancouver, British Columbia, C)
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract 
Reference code: 103110   
Primary Location: Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada 
All Available Locations: Vancouver 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. 

Do you want to serve as a trusted advisor and work with the Marketplace leaders to plan and execute a full complement of marketing initiatives to drive growth and enhance market positioning? Read more below!

What will your typical day look like?

As a Marketing Specialist, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency, responsible for end-to-end support of marketing and communications campaigns. You will have oversight for implementing marketing tactics such as thoughtware development, event planning, online activities, sponsorships, speaker and eminence programs. In this fast-paced role, you will deliver marketing campaigns on time, on schedule and on budget; all while delivering ROI. You will be working in close collaboration with our studio agency teams to deliver world-class campaigns to the client/business.

About the team

Deloitte’s in-house marketing agency is seeking a Marketing Specialist to join the team.  
As an integral member of a high performing team, you will be responsible for working collaboratively with other team members and leading the execution of marketing programs, events and initiatives.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

You are someone who has:

  • Minimum 3-5 years of marketing experience
  • Completed undergraduate degree
  • Demonstrated experience in event coordination and collateral development
  • Experience working with senior professionals in a fast paced environment often with tight deadlines
  • Strong project management and event planning skills
  • Lead the implementation of marketing and communications campaigns or campaign initiatives as identified in the marketing plan. This may include, but is not limited to tactics such as: 
    • collateral and thought ware development
    • event planning including virtual
    • digital and social media coordination
    • sponsorships
  • Have a high standard of quality and provide quality assurance review on all projects
  • Bilingualism is an asset

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You?
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

title: Marketing Specialist - Western Canada - 16 Month Contract
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

As a global leader in B2B assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, the insight we deliver at EY helps build trust and confidence in capital markets and global economies. We’re working together with leading Canadian organizations to transform their business for what comes next and prepare for what comes after that.

 

The opportunity


In this role, you’ll focus on market activation of priority campaigns for Western Canada and collaborate extensively across EY’s service lines, solutions and sector teams. You’ll leverage and effectively communicate EY’s capabilities and solutions to promote and launch marketing initiatives in Western Canada that underpin EY’s reputation, fuel our relationships, and help us stand apart from the competition. 
 
As a marketing generalist, in your day-to-day activities you’ll find yourself executing omni-channel marketing campaigns and events to build external visibility, while driving internal education and awareness for our West market stakeholders. You’ll be expected to contribute and collaborate as a get-it-done team member who’s committed to executional excellence.

 

Your key responsibilities: 

  • Understand the West market segment strategy set by our West Market leadership team and activate EY campaigns that best align to the West market’s goals and priorities 
  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to bring global and national EY campaigns to life by localizing content based on regional needs and priorities 
  • Focus on strengthening our brand with key West accounts, prospective clients and influencers 
  • Develop and write a range of strategic external and internal communications designed to connect with the firm’s values, goals and priorities. This includes articles, letters, speeches, leadership messages, briefing documents, talking points, statements, and more 
  • Support, organize and execute webinars and events for various audiences, leveraging different tools and formats for maximum engagement 
  • Evaluate and manage local sponsorship opportunities to strategically support existing programs and elevate our brand in the market 
  • Manage and execute people engagement initiatives, collaborating with Talent, Recruitment and local leaders to drive employee engagement 
  • Conduct market research to support sales and marketing efforts 
  • Support the development of thought leadership, articles and market-facing content 
  • Create PowerPoint presentations, including client decks, solution slip-sheets and internal team presentations 
  • Track and report ROI on all campaigns, programs, events, sponsorships and marketing efforts. 

 

Skills and attributes for success:

  • Well-rounded marketing generalist with excellent problem-solving skills and a flare for the creative 
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to navigate competing projects with ease 
  • Good with numbers; able to understand business data and perform basic analysis 
  • Enthusiastic team player who thrives on new challenges, big ideas, and curiosity 
  • Ability to quickly learn and understand all facets of EY’s business (service lines, solutions, industries) 
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the confidence to present at all levels 
  • Ability to build and foster collaborative relationships (internally and externally), including firm Partners 
  • Knowledge of digital marketing and social media 
  • Business development and growth mindset, with exceptional work ethic 
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, complex environment 
  • Strong organization and time management skills with the ability to prioritize
  • Strong team player with the ability to work independently and remotely effectively 

 

To qualify for the role, you must have:

  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, communications or relevant combination of experience and education
  • 5+ years of marketing experience creating, executing and measuring high-quality brand experiences, campaigns and programs that drive revenue and build relationships. B2B experience an asset. Professional services marketing experience preferred
  • Strong stakeholder management skills; comfortable working with senior leaders 
  • Superior writing skills and the ability to develop materials that are clear, concise and make an impact
  • In-depth knowledge of marketing trends, sponsorship, event management and measurement (analytics, dashboarding, reporting, etc.)

 

What we offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 

Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.

 

EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided. 

 

EY | Building a better working world 

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Marketing Analyst
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Marketing Analyst in the Credit Card company in Toronto, Ontario.
Are you interested in a Contractor role that will support Prospect Marketing Offer Strategy and Business Loans. The role requires performing data analysis of past acquisition offers to help inform the go-forward strategy. They will also help lead the launch of our Business Loans product in the Outbound Telemarketing channel. Does this sound like a role you will be interested to purpose and get your Career started?
How you will make an impact:
  • Gather and maintain data analysis of Acquisition offers; provide insights into optimal offer constructs and opportunities to do further testing
  • Manage the day-to-day relationship with the Outbound Telemarketing partner to drive acquisition performance, deliver reporting, and ensure operational excellence
  • Enable Sales onboarding, training, call listening and best practice sharing to effectively manage performance with the vendor
  • Gather Business Loan data insights, prepare reporting on Key Performance
  • Develop and execute industry focused campaigns acquiring prospects
  • Manage measurement, reporting, and analytics for the channel and continuously monitor performance against channel targets, analyze what is working / not working
  • Conduct regular performance review sessions with each vendor
  • Execute performance based vendor compensation program

You bring:
  • A bachelor degree in business or marketing or related experience
  • Minimum 3 years experience in B2B marketing primarily in credit/lending would be preferred
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills with proficiency with MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint), Salesforce
  • A highly motivated self-starter with high energy and a very positive attitude
  • • Ability to work independently to manage multiple project priorities and details with multiple cross-functional teams

You'll receive:
  • $26.48/hour -$27.12/hour
  • Hybrid - in office 1-2 days / week
  • Estimated Contract Length: 2022-05-16 to 2023-05-15

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by email hiqbal@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Ad Operations Coordinator (1 Year Contract)
description:
Samsung Ads l AdGear is an advanced Advertising Technology Company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry's most comprehensive data to build the world's smartest connected audience platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.

Samsung Ads is looking to add an Ad Operations Coordinator to our Ad Operations team.

This role will be based in Montreal Canada. Any roles based in Montreal will follow a hybrid work model. 

About the team

As an AdOperations Coordinator, you will work closely with Platform and AdOperations Specialists to own the success of digital advertising campaigns. You will have the unique opportunity to work on the leading edge of innovation with the company's proprietary ad platform and to learn hands-on about digital advertising supported by a hard-working and fun team. The ideal candidate would have a keen interest in new technologies and digital media and be highly motivated to grow and learn in this challenging fast-paced environment.

This role reports directly to the Ad Operations team lead

What you will do

  • Share campaign calendar with Platform and Ad Operation Specialists
  • Assist with the set-up and QA of creatives for trafficking purposes
  • Perform quality control of creatives, directly on the TVs
  • Monitor campaign pacing and performance based on given KPIs
  • Partner with the other members of the Campaign Management team to troubleshoot delivery issue and to enhance internal tools & processes
  • Assist in the development of custom client-facing performance reports
  • Generate reports across multiple brand safety and attribution ad servers

What you will need

  • 0 to 1 year experience in online advertising, marketing or digital media
  • Degree in Marketing, Communications, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Understanding of digital campaign life cycle and fundamental knowledge of online media metrics and analysis
  • Computer literate with superior knowledge of Excel
  • Effective time management, communication, analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

Benefits

  • 100% company-paid comprehensive health & dental coverage as of Day 1. Access to an employee assistance program  and a virtual care platform (wellness, medical & nutrition).
  • Personal spending account & Healthcare spending account with Sun Life
  • Competitive compensation package, including performance incentive bonus plan based on company, team and personal objectives
  • Minimum 21 days of paid time off 

Perks

  • Virtual social committee-lead activities such as monthly wine club night, games night as well as wellness initiatives like virtual yoga and meditation, art therapy, aromatherapy classes
  • Access to learning and development opportunities (your own LinkedIn Learning license, Pluralsight, professional development program, continuing education and more)
  • Officevibe - anonymous feedback from our teams to know how you're really doing and keep you engaged
  • Onboarding framework which ensures you're set up for success from Day 1 to Year 1. This also includes a buddy program (someone who will be there for you) from Day 1
  • Amazing discounts through Samsung Employee Discounts website and access to Perkopolis website with great rebates, coupons and promotions
  • Summer Fridays
  • Generous  Employee Referral Program
  • Giving Back Program which includes donation matching & volunteering initiatives including one paid volunteer day

*certain benefits & perks apply to only full time permanent roles. Please ask TA for additional details.

Life at Samsung Ads

Samsung Ads is an advanced Advertising Technology Company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry's most comprehensive data to build the world's smartest connected audience platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.

We are proud to have built a world-class organization, grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.

Are you hesitant to submit an application because you're not sure if you check every box? Apply anyway! We would love to hear from you and figure out what you can add to the culture here at Samsung Ads.

Samsung Ads cherche à ajouter un coordonnateur des opérations publicitaires à notre équipe des opérations publicitaires.

À propos de l'équipe

En tant que coordonnateur des opérations publicitaires, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les spécialistes de la plateforme et des opérations publicitaires pour vous approprier le succès des campagnes publicitaires numériques. Vous aurez l'opportunité unique de travailler à la pointe de l'innovation avec la plateforme publicitaire exclusive de l'entreprise et d'apprendre de manière pratique la publicité numérique avec le soutien d'une équipe travailleuse et amusante. Le candidat idéal aurait un vif intérêt pour les nouvelles technologies et les médias numériques et serait très motivé pour grandir et apprendre dans cet environnement stimulant et en évolution rapide.

Ce rôle relève directement du chef d'équipe des opérations publicitaires.

Tous nos employés travaillent actuellement à distance depuis leur domicile. À l'avenir, ce rôle sera hybride et nécessitera une combinaison de travail à partir de notre bureau de Montréal, QC et de travail à distance.

Veuillez noter que vous travaillerez pendant les heures de la côte ouest (12 h-20 h), car vous serez en contact avec notre équipe de la côte ouest. Il s'agit d'un rôle contractuel d'un an, avec possibilité de conversion.

Ce que vous ferez

  • Partager le calendrier des campagnes avec les spécialistes de la plateforme et des opérations publicitaires.
  • Participer à la configuration et au contrôle qualité des créations à des fins de trafic.
  • Effectuer un contrôle qualité des créations, directement sur les téléviseurs.
  • Surveiller le rythme et les performances des campagnes en fonction d'indicateurs clés de performance donnés.
  • Collaborer avec les autres membres de l'équipe de gestion de campagne pour résoudre les problèmes de livraison et améliorer les outils et processus internes.
  • Aider au développement de rapports de performance personnalisés destinés aux clients.
  • Générer des rapports sur plusieurs serveurs publicitaires de sécurité de la marque et d'attribution.

Ce dont vous aurez besoin

  • 0 à 1 an d'expérience dans la publicité en ligne, le marketing ou les médias numériques.
  • Diplôme en marketing, communication, informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.
  • Compréhension du cycle de vie des campagnes numériques et connaissance fondamentale des mesures et de l'analyse des médias en ligne.
  • Connaissances en informatique avec une connaissance supérieure d'Excel.
  • Compétences efficaces en gestion du temps, en communication, en pensée analytique et en résolution de problèmes.

La vie chez Samsung Ads

Samsung Ads est une société de technologie publicitaire avancée en croissance rapide qui vise à permettre aux marques de se connecter aux audiences de Samsung TV lorsqu'elles sont exposées aux médias numériques en utilisant les données les plus complètes de l'industrie pour créer la plateforme d'audience connectée la plus intelligente au monde. Faire partie d'une entreprise internationale telle que Samsung et faire des affaires dans le monde entier signifie que nous pouvons travailler sur de grands projets complexes avec des parties prenantes et des équipes situées dans le monde entier.

Nous sommes fiers d'avoir bâti une organisation de classe mondiale, fondée sur un esprit entrepreneurial et collaboratif. Travailler chez Samsung Ads offre l'un des meilleurs environnements du secteur pour découvrir à quelle vitesse vous pouvez grandir, ce que vous pouvez réaliser et à quel point vous pouvez être bon. Nous nous épanouissons dans la résolution de problèmes, en innovant et en profitant de chaque partie du voyage.

Avantages

  • Couverture médicale et dentaire complète payée à 100 % par l'entreprise dès le premier jour. Accès à un programme d'aide aux employés et à une plateforme de soins virtuels (bien-être, médical, et nutrition).
  • Compte de dépenses personnel et compte de dépenses de soins de santé avec Sun Life.
  • Paquet de rémunération concurrentielle, y compris un plan de primes de rendements basé sur les objectifs de l'entreprise, de l'équipe et personnels.
  • Minimum de 21 jours de congés payés.

À-côtés

  • Activités virtuelles dirigées par un comité social comme la soirée mensuelle du club de vin, soirées de jeux ainsi que des initiatives de bien-être comme le yoga et la méditation virtuels, l'art-thérapie, les cours d'aromathérapie.
  • Accès à des opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement (votre propre licence LinkedIn Learning, Pluralsight, programme de développement professionnel, formation continue et plus).
  • Officevibe : des commentaires anonymes de nos équipes pour savoir comment vous vous en sortez vraiment et vous garder engagé.
  • Cadre d'intégration qui garantit que vous êtes prêt à réussir du jour 1 à l'année 1. Cela inclut également un programme de jumelage (quelqu'un qui sera là pour vous) à partir du jour 1.
  • Des remises incroyables sur le site Web Samsung Employee Discounts et un accès au site Web de Perkopolis avec d'excellents rabais, coupons et promotions.
  • Les vendredis d'été.
  • Généreux programme de recommandation d'employés.
  • Le programme Giving Back, qui comprend des initiatives de jumelage de dons et de bénévolat, y compris une journée de bénévolat rémunéré.

*Certains avantages et à-côtés s'appliquent uniquement aux postes permanents à temps plein. Veuillez demander des détails supplémentaires à l'AT.

Vous hésitez à soumettre une candidature parce que vous n'êtes pas sûr de cocher toutes les cases? Postulez quand même! Nous aimerions avoir de vos nouvelles et découvrir ce que vous pouvez ajouter à la culture ici, chez Samsung Ads.
