title: Business Development Specialist, Controls- Alberta & Mid-West
description:
Business Development Specialist, Controls- Alberta & Mid-West

 

If projects, sales hold no secrets for you and you are a pro at achieving maximum product acceptance at end user, specifier, and contractor levels, the position of Business Development Specialist, Controls – Alberta & Mid-West is for you!

 

Reporting directly to the Regional Sales Director, working closely with the Director of Controls and in cooperation with the Territory Manager(s) is her/his area, the incumbent will be responsible for achieving maximum product acceptance at end user, specifier, and contractor levels through effective market intelligence, public relations, and product training efforts. S/he will be responsible for achieving Controls sales targets as determined on an annual basis in the appropriate territory and maintaining appropriate expenses.

 

  • Develop and maintain contact with all senior persons who specify Leviton products, including but not limited to architects, consulting engineers, electrical engineers, various Government-level purchasing departments, industrial specifiers and major electrical contractors. S/he will provide them with all services they require (such as sample, literature, specifier’s catalogue and copies of product specifications) and conduct informative meetings for all types of specifiers, as required
  • Ensure that there is proper follow-up on specifications and ascertain that, where Leviton products were specified, the company obtained the order and the product was utilized. When opportunity arises, put forth necessary efforts to secure orders. S/he will also report the needs of the specifier to Leviton management by suggesting new products, promotional literature, policy changes, etc.
  • Maintain complete records of specifier’s name, where Leviton was specified, description of job, etc., and advise Leviton headquarters so that they can transmit this information to other areas that may be involved.
  • Be responsible for product training on end user, contractor or specifier sites and, when required, at the distributor Level. Upon her/his superior’s request, s/he will co-ordinate training efforts with the local Territory Managers.
  • Keep up to date with applicable local energy codes; maintain and promote best practices of Leviton material applications in satisfaction of the former.
  • Actively participate in the marketing support programs (trade shows, dinner meetings, joint calls) that are planned in her/his area by the Territory Manager or on his/her own as required to promote and secure Leviton Controls as the product of choice.
  • Ensure proper technical coverage and support of Strategic and/or House accounts that are sold to on a direct basis to drive both regional sales and National Accounts

Success factors

  • College Degree and on-the-job training experience
  • Minimum of five (5) years of work-related experience
  • Excellent sales abilities and presentation skills
  • Knowledge in business and management principles
  • Project management and excel knowledge is an asset
  • Abilities in interpersonal relations including opening doors to new relationships
  • Good judgment and able to establish priorities
  • Available to travel within the territory and/or province under her/his responsibility
  • Ability to work autonomously and well under pressure
  • A self-directed learner

 What we offer

  • Work-life balance
  • A stimulating and friendly work environment
  • Complete group insurance program & group RRSP
  • Recognition programs
  • Skills development program

 The future looks brighter than ever. Join our team now! recrutementcanada@leviton.com

 Who we are

Leviton Canada is one of a family of companies affiliated with Leviton Manufacturing Company Inc., headquartered in Melville, New York. Leviton has been a private, family-owned company since its founding in 1906. Leviton Canada's head office and distribution center are located in Pointe-Claire, in the province of Quebec. Its sales force, which is made up of representatives and manufacturing agents, is present in all Canadian provinces. Today, Leviton Canada offers more than 25,000 products and systems, supported by a team of specialists in connectivity, telecommunications, controls,

automation, and lighting solutions for the residential, commercial, and industrial markets. Almost 90% of homes in North America use at least one product that we manufacture in one of our facilities, all of which are ISO 9000 certified.

title: Market Planning Analyst - 14 month contract
description:
This role is a 14 month contract opportunity

The primary role of the Market Planning Analyst will be to develop a SKU level forecast for the S&OP horizon (3-26 periods), facilitate the periodic Supply Review (SMR) and perform as the Business Process Owner of all the Supply Chain KPIs.

Demand Planning:

  • Keep FuturMaster database up to date
  • Provide updated forecast views on a period basis and articulate the risk/opportunity profile for designated brand family. Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Key Accounts and supply teams as necessary.
  • Develop a rolling 36-month demand forecast by SKU. The forecasting process synthesizes multiple inputs including key assumptions regarding market activities of the brand and sales managers as well as competitors, sales force inputs, syndicated market data, seasonal effects, and historical statistical models to arrive at a forecast of future demand.
  • Collaborate with Sales & Marketing to support and improve the sales forecast accuracy through identifying corrective course of action for gaps and errors. This will be achieved through improved joint forecasting, item level profiling and customer collaboration.
  • Responsible to represent the forecasting team in activity management meetings to ensure activity management projects are accurately updated in forecast models.
  • Translate promotional forecast to SKU level demand for Supply and Manufacturing visibility, driving replenishment and order management processes.
  • Create and monitor display tracking reports against forecast submission. This includes end-of-period reports as well as daily actual vs. forecast reports.
  • Drive business process improvement and adherence to Global forecasting best practices.
  • Support Demand Planning manager on DMR preparation.

Supply Planning
  • Lead the periodic Supply Review to provide a constrained outlook on inventory, shipments & warehouse capacity
  • Perform the duties of a Business Process Owner for all KPI and reporting which includes
  • Supply Chain KPI dashboard consolidation
  • Developing and maintaining the dashboard in Power BI
  • Trouble shooting report accuracy and data issues
  • Publish & own the Ageing Inventory (270 Day Report)
  • Collaborate with sales and marketing on ageing inventory
What can you expect from Mars?
  • Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
  • Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
  • Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
  • An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

title: Product Marketing - Outdoor
description:
We’re looking for a Product Marketeer to join our Professional Channel Team in Markham, ON.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As a Product Marketeer, you'll be responsible for leading the product marketing strategy for defined luminaire categories and managing the portfolio locally (across Commercial teams).

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What you’ll do

  • Lead the product marketing strategy for defined luminaire categories and manage the portfolio locally (across Commercial Teams).

  • Execute pricing and define price planning models, including associated analysis.

  • Manage the market introduction, forecasting and support market activation of new products, including competitor benchmarking.

  • Define phase-in phase-out plan and execute portfolio maintenance activities.

  • Develop technical product knowledge upon input toolkit and training by Division.

Your qualifications

  • You hold at least 5 years of professional experience working in a similar role preferably (but not essentially) in the lighting or electrical sector.

  • Previous experience working with the Canadian contractor & installer industry.

  • Understanding the Canadian lighting market is a big plus (including connected lighting, IoT, etc).

  • High knowledge of Excel and other reporting platforms.

  • You have excellent communication skills in English, and you are a strong technical presenter.

  • Team player, problem-solving mindset and proven can-do attitude, which means having the drive to succeed are attributes that define yourself.

We are an equal opportunity employer and is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

To be eligible for this position, you must legally be permitted to work in Canada and travel within North America, without any additional sponsorship support from Signify. #LI-TR1

What you’ll get in return…

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

Who we are

Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.

We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.

title: Spécialiste marketing et développement commercial / Marketing and Commercial Development Specialist
description:
VERSION FRANÇAISE

Spécialiste marketing et développement commercial

 

À propos du poste

Le groupe IBE est à la recherche d'un(e) spécialiste en marketing et développement commercial pour leur emplacement de Montréal.

 

À propos de l'entreprise

Le Groupe IBE est une entreprise d'entrepreneur général au sein du domaine de la construction qui se spécialise dans les secteurs résidentiels, commerciaux et institutionnels. Nous exécutons une variété de projets à l'échelle internationale. Nous sommes une équipe unie, diversifiée, ambitieuse et multidisciplinaire. Notre objectif est de fournir des solutions optimales à nos clients en leur apportant notre expertise en gestion de projet et notre expertise technique.

Nous sommes une équipe agile en pleine expansion. Nous valorisons la communication, la transparence, l'apprentissage continu et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous efforçons de nous développer et d'atteindre ensemble nos objectifs communs. Nous avons de grandes aspirations et nous apprécions les idées de notre équipe.

En rejoignant le groupe IBE, vous faites partie d'une équipe qui veut votre succès. Vous aurez les outils et l'opportunité de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire partie de projets passionnants.

 

Principales responsabilités:

  • Établir un plan de commercialisation
  • Analyser les tendances du marché, les offres des concurrents et les données démographiques
  • Création de niches et de slogans marketing
  • Préparation des outils de présentation
  • Traduction de tous les outils marketing
  • Recherche de clients potentiels avec différents moteurs de recherche
  • S'assurer que toutes les activités de marketing sont rentables
  • Créer un partenariat avec d'autres entreprises
  • Surveiller les performances marketing et ajuster les stratégies au besoin

 

Exigences du rôle:

  • Baccalauréat en marketing, en publicité ou dans une discipline connexe
  • 1 à 2 ans d'expérience dans un rôle marketing
  • Parfaitement bilingue en français et en anglais (parlé, lu et écrit)
  • Compétences en organisation et en priorisation
  • Maîtrise des outils d'analyse Web
  • À l'aise de travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide
  • Joueur d'équipe exceptionnel

 

Ce que nous offrons:

  • Salaire compétitif
  • Assurance collective pour soins médicaux et dentaires
  • Cotisations REER possibles
  • Accompagnement dans votre formation et développement
  • Possibilité d'évolution au sein de l'organisation
  • Prime de performance
  • Allocations et avantages sociaux éventuels (voiture, essence, etc.)
  • Stationnement gratuit au centre de Montréal (ou à 5 minutes à pied du métro)

 

Cela ressemble à la prochaine étape de votre carrière? Si oui, nous serions ravis de discuter avec vous!

 

ENGLISH VERSION

Marketing and Commercial Development Specialist

 

About the job

The IBE Group is looking for a Marketing and Commercial Development Specialist for their Montreal location.

 

About the company

The IBE Group is a general contractor company working in the construction industry in residential, commercial and institutional sectors. We execute a variety of projects internationally. We are a tight-knit, diverse, ambitious and multi-disciplinary team. Our objective is to provide optimal solutions to our clients by providing them with our project management and technical expertise.

We are an agile team in full expansion. We value communication, transparency continuous learning and teamwork. We thrive on developing ourselves and achieving our common goals together. We have big aspirations, and we value our team's ideas.

When joining the IBE group, you become part of a team that wants your success. You will be given the tools and opportunity to hone your skills and be part of exciting projects.

 

Main Responsibilities:

  • Establish a marketing plan
  • Analyze market trends, competitor offerings and demographics
  • Creation of niches and marketing slogans
  • Preparation of presentation tools
  • Translation of all marketing tools
  • Search for potential customers with different search engines
  • Ensure all marketing activities are profitable and cost-effective
  • Create a partnership with other companies
  • Monitor marketing performance and adjust strategies as needed

 

Role Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising or a related discipline
  • Between 1 to 2 years of experience in a marketing role
  • Perfectly bilingual in French and English (spoken, read and written)
  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills
  • Proficiency with web analytics tools
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
  • Exceptionnal team player

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Group insurance for medical and dental
  • Possible RRSP contributions
  • Support in your training and development
  • Possibility for advancement within the organization
  • Performance bonus
  • Possible allowances and perk benefits (car, gas, etc.)
  • Free parking in the center of Montreal (or 5 minute walk from the metro)

 

Does this sound like the next step in your career? If so, we'd love to talk with you!

title: Senior Advisor, Marketing & Communication Strategy, Specialized Aircraft (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Senior Advisor, Marketing & Communication Strategy, Specialized Aircraft-MON18610

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will:

- Manage the defense and special mission product portfolio by:

- Creating and implementing a strategic marketing communication plan to support sales campaigns and overall brand awareness.
- Working with various teams in developing and disseminating marketing communications material: key messages, videos, press releases, brochures, factsheets, print and digital advertising campaigns, direct mail pieces, etc.
- Producing digital content to broadcast through our Social Media channels and website.
- Optimizing the mix of communication channels for the above-mentioned material.
- Monitoring budget according to the annual plan.
- Suggesting innovative solutions to communicate in a primarily B2B / Government / Institutional landscape.
- Liaising with a wide matrix of business units internally, as well as third-party prime contractors.

- Lead the governance for major marketing projects and specialized events through:

- Rigorous project management
- Regular meetings with different management levels of the Marketing, Government Affairs, Communications, Sales and Specialized Aircraft teams
- Pro-active follow-ups with stakeholders
- Represent all branches of the Marketing, Communications and Public Affairs team participating directly on the Bombardier Specialized Aircraft (BSA) leadership team
- Attend regular BSA business planning and governance meetings
- Track active sales campaigns and cascade relevant information to Marketing, Communications and Public Affairs colleagues
- Report on all Marketing, Communications and Public Affairs to the BSA team.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

- You have 5-8 years of relevant experience in marketing and communications (defense industry or prime defense contractor experience a key asset; previous classified authorizations in U.S. an asset)

- You have past experience developing a multi-channel go-to-market strategy in a B2B / Government landscape
- Self-sufficient, you are detail-oriented and have a strategic mind
- You demonstrate strong problem-solving skills
- You respect timelines and can manage many projects, while remaining calm in a fast-paced environment
- You bring creativity, passion and enthusiasm to your work and can motivate a team to generate results
- You can set clear targets while tracking and reporting on progress
- You like challenges and demonstrate initiative and creativity
- You are eager to learn and develop yourself
- You enjoy teamwork and like to establish good interpersonal relationships
- You are very proficient in English, spoken and written, with a keen eye for editing (French proficiency an asset)

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: FIG Product Specialist
description:
S&P Global Market Intelligence

TheRole: FIG Product Specialist

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 9A

The Location: Toronto, ON; Charlottesville, VA; NYC, NY; Los Angeles, CA; Buenos Aires, AR

The Team: Within the S&P Global Market Intelligence Commercial organization, Product Specialists are expected to identify, analyze, and propose solutions relating to specific products and services. Within Risk Services, Quantamental Solutions, Desktop, MMD, LCD, Industry Solutions, Product Specialists become domain and knowledge experts


The Impact: These roles drive revenue growth and client retention by working with Sales, Relationship Management, Product Management, and Client Operations to promote Market Intelligence’s products, data content and delivery business, and other services across all client segments. You will have a ‘seat at the table’ while leading or participating in these external and internal conversations and negotiations. Your input will help clients identify needs, construct solutions that utilize our products, and ultimately position Sales teams for success in their contracting discussions and support successful ongoing outcomes for Relationship Managers.

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $46.6 - $95.9k. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for a commercial incentive plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires.

Responsibilities:

  • Possess a firm understanding of the diagnostic sales process and employ its principles and techniques when engaging with a prospect or client.
  • Support existing platform and/or content and feed clients with a strong focus on renewal rate. Respond attentively to client questions, help clients get the most out of our solutions, and work with Sales and Relationship Management to drive usage and adoption of products across the client organization.
  • Assist the trial process with a thorough understanding of the client’s workflow, and how Market Intelligence’s solutions may enhance that workflow.
  • Conduct product demos as needed and help to design the best solution to fit a prospect’s or client’s needs.
  • Master the specific technical knowledge of each Product Specialist domain in order to advise clients and prospects on Market Intelligence solutions. Some roles require significant hands-on application of technical knowledge of systems and feeds.
  • Act as a product specialist for a given product segment business by understanding the application of Market Intelligence products and content for complex workflows, conduct training, troubleshoot problems, answer product questions, and work on proof-of-concept projects to ensure that the client has the tools that will make their experience a success.
  • Act as a regional market feedback consolidation source for regional product, content and delivery enhancements. Partner closely with Product Management, legal and client support teams to provide feedback and rank feed enhancement requests, assist with contract issues or coordinate client support requests as needed. Collaborate across borders with other Product Specialists serving in similar capacities.
  • Learn and understand new product enhancements and relevant datasets as they are deployed through our platforms, and communicate the advantages of these products and datasets effectively to clients and prospects.
  • Develop a complete understanding of competitors’ products and be able to articulate Market Intelligence’s relative capabilities.

What We’re Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Strong understanding of at least one of the segments we serve and the FIG specialized solutions
  • Firm understanding of workflow solutions within Market Intelligence Desktop platform.
  • A mixture of Finance, business, commercial and technical skills are necessary.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Independent, self-starter capable of working without close supervision or daily guidance
  • An understanding of the value of careful attention to documenting activities
  • Team player with an ability to collaborate across functional and geographic boundaries
  • Some experience and ability to apply the core concepts of our diagnostic sales methodology
  • Demonstrates drive, initiative, energy and sense of urgency
  • Passion for data driven analytic solutions
  • A high level of client service and communication skills
  • Thorough understanding of the equity, fixed income/credit or industry specific investment process (with a focus on either quantitative or qualitative security analysis). Prior experience in selling to or interacting with the types of firms and individual personas we target is highly desirable.
  • Prior experience in selling to or interacting with the types of firms and individual personas we target is highly desirable
  • Degree in business, corporate finance, commerce or a numerate discipline such as Finance, Accounting, Economics, or equivalent experience is required depending on the role. A strong understanding of fundamental data is necessary
  • Strong level of computer skills including MS Office proficiency; programming, databases, computer science and other specific skills are highly desirable for some roles
  • Constructive team player, capable of balancing and prioritizing multiple projects across different teams or business segments

S&P Global Market Intelligence

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction.

S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence.

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to:

EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com

and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

US Candidates Only:

The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdfdescribes discrimination protections under federal law.

Please note that S&P Global is a federal contractor, and in keeping with the US Government’s federal contractor vaccine mandate, the company plans to require all employees in the US to be fully vaccinated if and when such requirements becomes enforceable. S&P Global will also follow other state and local vaccine requirements which may apply.

title: Market Risk Analyst
description:
Client ID: 3825

Market Risk Analyst

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Market Risk Analyst.

Market Risk Analyst – Job Description

  • The Model Control & Governance team within Market Risk & Model Development services the analytic and quantitative modeling needs of valuation and risk models for various stakeholders
  • Strong candidate to join the group to support model implementation testing for Murex system upgrade project
  • Work primarily with the team to perform model implementation review and testing, version control, as well as providing the analytic and quantitative modeling expertise to various internal partners
  • Perform model implementation testing and version control process for Foreign Exchange, Base Metal, and Precious Metal derivative models across PnL, Risk, VaR and CCR from bank's global trading businesses.
  • Design testing scenarios and conduct quantitative verification on model review and analysis as requested to ensure the timely delivery.
  • Review and provide effective challenge to model developer or model validation.
  • Create detailed model implementation testing documentation report.
  • Ensure to acquire an understanding of processes and methodologies followed by the business requirement.
  • Work on a project within securities
  • Communicating with different departments (deal with different people in different teams, some will not have a financial background so they will need to be able to take financial and/or technical terms and put it in layman’s terms)

Market Risk Analyst – Mandatory Skills

  • Solid quantitative finance knowledge associated with excellent understanding of derivative products, as well as the valuation and risk management methodologies
  • Solid understanding of pricing theory, stochastic calculus and numerical techniques used in derivative pricing (PDE/trees, Monte Carlo simulation, optimization)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical issues for the benefit of others
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematical/Computational Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering

Market Risk Analyst – Nice to Have Skills

  • Previous working experience with Murex system on Foreign Exchange, Base Metal, and Precious Metal derivative models
  • Computational and programming knowledge (Python or VBA)
  • Experience in Model Development, Model Validation or related quantitative role – 3-5 years

Market Risk Analyst - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Market Risk Analyst - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

title: Brand Manager, AbbVie Care, 15 Month Contract
description:
About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Joining AbbVie means, you will be part of a team of outstanding professionals dedicated to making a remarkable impact on patients' lives. At AbbVie, we conduct ground-breaking science on a global scale every day. AbbVie Canada is one of the Best Workplaces in Canada whereby 92% of our employees are proud to say they work for AbbVie.

When choosing your career path, choose to be remarkable.

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio.

We have an opportunity for Brand Manager, AbbVie Care to join our Patient Experience team. The focus of this position is strategic brand management and tactical implementation of core strategies. The incumbent will also be responsible for enriching the patient experience by leading and understanding insights across Brand Teams and evolving the patient journey for to focus on delivery of patient-centric strategies.

The incumbent will report to Marketing and Training Lead.

Key Responsibilities:

Insights

Lead synthesis of insights from cross-functional teams and Immunology brand teams to determine program positioning. Leverage market research and insights collection to inform the patient journeys for each asset within Immunology.

Facilitate and synthesize cross-stakeholder discussions to strengthen insights; collaborate with AbbVie Care Immunology Management team and Immunology brand team colleagues to engage critical opinion leaders from all customer groups to ensure competitive positioning and market dynamics.

Patient Journey

Develop robust and accurate patient journeys for all assets within AbbVie Care Immunology, facilitating workshops to securing input & cross-stakeholder viewpoints with a patient-centric focus.

Propose Strategic Objectives for Brand Team review based on findings from the patient journeys; challenge and critique Brand Team strategies to ensure patient-centricity.

Brand story and guardianship

Lead the development of marketing inputs to the strategic brand plan, securing appropriate budget to deliver marketing objectives.

Become ‘guardian of the brand’ and bring the Brand Story to life by ensuring that all functional deliverables, including Marketing materials and campaigns, remain consistent with branding and deliver emotional messages aligned to the Brand Story.

Work with team on tactical implementation of program tools and messaging.

Manage and appropriately spend advertising and promotional budgets to prioritize growth opportunities while considering cost containment measures.

Monitor marketing initiatives Key Performance Indicators and communicate them regularly. Propose tactical adjustments as needed.

Coordinate the activities of functional areas, advertising agencies and suppliers. Develop and maintain a continuous feedback loop with internal and external customers to inform Brand decisions. Work closely with all functional areas including trade, market access, training, marketing, community relations, CHE team, and all other stakeholders.

Respond to field team requests in a timely manner and encourage ongoing communications.

Oversee the development of all promotional (traditional and digital) pieces and messaging including patients support materials in close collaboration with the Community Relations team.

Multi-channel expertise

Optimize channel mix for marketing and cross-functional campaigns

Guide the design and implementation of all marketing activities to include:

    • Cross-channel opportunities to strengthen campaigns
    • Innovative Marketing tactics to deliver holistic solutions
    • Traditional and non-traditional partnerships.
    • Multi-channel opportunities to strengthen campaigns
    • Multi-stakeholder initiatives

  • Consolidate the 1-year tactical Brand Plan, collecting inputs from cross-functional colleagues.

  • Maintain an up-to-date understanding of customer perspectives through regular engagement with stakeholders (e.g. in-field visits).


Qualifications

Education / Experience Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in science, Commerce or Marketing, or any related field.
  • Pharmaceutical sales experience (minimum 2 years)
  • 3 to 5 year of brand management experience preferred, notably in immunology

Essential skills & abilities:

  • Patient Support Program marketing experience preferred
  • Experience in integrated multi-channel marketing including print, digital, face-to-face and social media
  • Understanding of Canadian Healthcare environment and evolving landscape.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Proven track record of innovative accomplishments.
  • English and French must be at advanced level, oral and written
  • Proficient in using MS Office Suite and all related new technologies in relationship to the role and the work environment.

Key Leadership Competencies:

  • Operate and communicate effectively in a matrix environment and ensure the flow of information.
  • Think at a strategic level and challenge status quo.
  • Prioritize to ensure effective time management and multi-tasking.
  • Analyze complex data and translate it into opportunities.
  • Negotiate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Prepare and deliver effective presentations.
  • Tailor message to the different stakeholders
  • Demonstrate interpersonal skills to build strong relationships

This position entails 5-10% of travel within Canada and possibly occasional travel outside Canada. Valid passport is required.

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.

Covid vaccination new hires amendments:

Full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment for this position, with possible accommodation for validated exemptions, within the limits of applicable legislation. AbbVie employees are also required to comply with any COVID-19 related external requirements, including any testing requirements, applicable to their work activities outside AbbVie premises (for example, travelling and visiting stakeholders and customers).


Travel
No
Job Type
Temporary Work
Schedule
Full-time
Job Level Code
IC
Equal Employment Opportunity
At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients. As an equal opportunity employer we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

title: Experience Designer, Greenhouse (Contract)
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract
Reference code: 104503
Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada
All Available Locations: Calgary

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.
Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.

What will your typical day look like?

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Operations/Reporting/Finance, and working cross functionally with the Greenhouse Partner, Creative Strategy Lead, RML's & Marketing Committee, the Marketing Contractor is a position that will support the Greenhouse program on a temporary one year basis.

As the Marketing Contractor, day to day tasks will vary by project, but the main project areas will be bucketed into internal Marketing & external Marketing:

Internal Marketing:

• Update & streamline internal myDeloitte sites and links

• Develop and execute Yammer Strategy for Greenhouse program

• Ideate and execute on internal business development initiatives that align with the finance & revenue strategy

• Update and development of internal communication strategies for all regions

• Contribute to the curation of thoughtware and content (multi-media) for the Greenhouse

• Support Marketing initiatives for the Business Chemistry Program

External Marketing:

• Work closely with the Creative Strategy Lead on eminence building activities

• Vancouver Greenhouse launch - video development, launch support, specific launch initiatives around social media, communications etc..

• Greenhouse social media & content strategy

• Update the external Deloitte.ca Greenhouse website

• Support the team by providing new ideas for unique & creative session experiences

• Manage video production for new Greenhouse flagship video

About the team

Enough about us, let's talk about you

Qualifications:

To qualify for this position, you should possess the following:

• Proficient in MS Office (Specifically Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Teams, OneNote & Word)

• Experience using CRM & Microsoft productivity tools is an asset

• An expressed interest in developing world-class client experiences & communications

• Ability to work in a fast paced changing environment

• Must be comfortable with interacting with executive clients and presenting to various groups

• Quick learner with creative problem-solving skills

• Comfortable managing multiple internal stakeholder relationships and third party vendor relationships

• Strong organizational skills

• High attention to detail

• Strong project management skills

• Fluent spoken and written English

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by (insert date).

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Developer, Equity, Content Strategy, Project Manager, CRM, Technology, Finance, Marketing

Apply now "

title: Experience Designer, Greenhouse (Contract) (Calgary, Alberta, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract 
Reference code: 104503   
Primary Location: Calgary, Alberta, Canada 
All Available Locations: Calgary 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.
Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.

 

What will your typical day look like?

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Operations/Reporting/Finance, and working cross functionally with the Greenhouse Partner, Creative Strategy Lead, RML's & Marketing Committee, the Marketing Contractor is a position that will support the Greenhouse program on a temporary one year basis.   

As the Marketing Contractor, day to day tasks will vary by project, but the main project areas will be bucketed into internal Marketing & external Marketin  

 

Internal Marketin 

 

• Update & streamline internal myDeloitte sites and links 

• Develop and execute Yammer Strategy for Greenhouse program 

• Ideate and execute on internal business development initiatives that align with the finance & revenue strategy 

• Update and development of internal communication strategies for all regions 

• Contribute to the curation of thoughtware and content (multi-media) for the Greenhouse 

• Support Marketing initiatives for the Business Chemistry Program 

 

External Marketin  

 

• Work closely with the Creative Strategy Lead on eminence building activities 

• Vancouver Greenhouse launch – video development, launch support, specific launch initiatives around social media, communications etc..  

• Greenhouse social media & content strategy 

• Update the external Deloitte.ca Greenhouse website  

• Support the team by providing new ideas for unique & creative session experiences 

• Manage video production for new Greenhouse flagship video 

About the team

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

 

 

Qualifications: 

To qualify for this position, you should possess the followin  

• Proficient in MS Office (Specifically Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Teams, OneNote & Word) 

• Experience using CRM & Microsoft productivity tools is an asset  

• An expressed interest in developing world-class client experiences & communications 

• Ability to work in a fast paced changing environment  

• Must be comfortable with interacting with executive clients and presenting to various groups 

• Quick learner with creative problem-solving skills  

• Comfortable managing multiple internal stakeholder relationships and third party vendor relationships 

• Strong organizational skills  

• High attention to detail  

• Strong project management skills  

• Fluent spoken and written English 

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by [insert date].
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Product Marketing Manager (1-year contract with possibility of extension)
description:
Here's your chance to join one of Toronto's fastest-growing technology companies! Statflo provides a one-to-one outreach platform for front-line staff in retail to build authentic relationships and increase sales with their customers. Statflo's proprietary platform is deployed in thousands of stores in North America. Statflo operates as a remote-first work environment. We are committed to investing in great people, to build a great product and a great company!

What we do:
- Engage retail staff by providing an intuitive workflow and holistic customer lifecycle and outreach strategy that allows retail sales reps to reach out to customers directly.
- Enable stores to stay in touch with local prospects and current customers using 1:1 conversations via messaging or phone.
- Motivates and empowers teams by connecting the dots between the outreach they do and the return they get, demonstrating that with the proper coaching and messaging they can have an incredible 10% increase in same-store sales.

Why it matters:
- Millions of retail workers are handed a broom or they're left unsupervised and resort to keeping up with their Snap streaks during the 8 hours they are idle each week. We challenge this status quo by empowering them to increase sales themselves and ultimately make more money.
- Millions of customers of wireless carriers and technology retailers want a better customer experience that is personal, proactive, and timely.
- Customers and retail reps want to engage via messaging. 89% of shoppers want two-way conversations with brands and local businesses, via messaging and 83% of shoppers say they expect regular communication about their past purchases. Similarly, retail reps are uncomfortable with cold calls and prefer to start conversations in a medium that is more natural for them.

The Role:
Now more than ever, we want every single Statflo customer to enjoy a simple, singular, and human-centered experience. We're looking for a Product Marketing Managerwith experience in SaaS, who can put themselves in the shoes of users and help the Product team develop clear and compelling messaging that inspires our customers to learn about, try, and adopt Statflo.

About the Product Team:
The Product Team is the crafty mastermind at Statflo. Although small, the team is mighty and powerful. Members are ultimately responsible for the process of releasing products and new functionalities, which includes implementing strategy, designing roadmaps, and feature definitions. The Product Team provides cross-functional leadership, uniting and inspiring internal teams to work towards a shared product vision.

The team consists of:
Product Managers, who are responsible for individual features, products, and services.
Product Designers, who manage the look and feel of the products.
Product Marketers, who maintain the brand, messaging, and positioning of the product.

Your Responsibilities Include:

  • The key objective of this position is to improve how we bring our products to market, establish positioning and messaging, engage current users, conduct market/competitive analysis, as well as develop scalable training assets, sales enablement tools, and go-to-market processes.
  • You'll be the go-to person for messaging and value proposition around our products and features
  • You'll work collaboratively with Marketing, Product Management, Customer Success, and Sales teams to deliver your GTM strategy, influence product roadmaps, and advocate for experiences that drive growth and customer satisfaction
  • You'll develop and own the results for individual features and product launches from start to finish
  • You'll need to maintain a deep understanding of our customer and user personas to translate insights into strategies that help support and drive our roadmap
  • You'll lead and develop the long-term strategy, priorities, and organization that will meet the brand and product marketing needs as we expand into new industries
  • You'll improve cross-functional alignment on product knowledge through effective internal communication and training
  • You'll engage and retain users through external communications, training materials, and gamification (e.g. product updates, knowledge centre content, demo videos, in-app tooltips)

You'll be Successful in this Role If:

  • Have a Bachelor's degree in Business, Arts, or a related degree
  • Have a minimum of 3 years experience in a SaaS product marketing role (preference given to B2B SaaS)
  • You are self-driven and able to work with little supervision towards a common goal or company purpose
  • You have strong critical thinking skills for determining the best approach towards ambiguous tasks and consolidating information from multiple sources
  • Demonstrate proven ability to develop and execute a go-to-market strategy
  • You are a great communicator who has excellent communication skills and are comfortable speaking with a variety of different stakeholders, both internal and external
  • Have Curiosity and experience conducting market research and product positioning
  • Have the ability to work well within and across teams that have multiple priorities
  • Are highly detail-oriented and able to set high expectations for how our brand and product story is portrayed
  • You have an obsession with understanding how user personas influence product marketing
  • Are confident enough to proactively grasp problems/challenges/opportunities when you encounter them even if it's not your direct responsibility
  • You have a healthy drive to improve our products and do whatever it takes to support the team
Statflo welcomes and encourages applications from all backgrounds and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment selection process.

Equal Opportunity Employment:
Statflo is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We are happy to consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, neurodiversity, protected veteran status, Aboriginal and Native status or any other legally-protected factors. Statflo has a zero-tolerance policy for discrimination and prides itself on assessing talent needs based on an objective methodology.

If accessibility accommodations are required during the recruitment process, please contact careers@statflo.com and we will gladly make the necessary arrangements to ensure Statflo is able to support all interested applicants.

title: Reality Capture Specialist
description:
Company Description

Bantrel is proud to be a leading provider of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services in Canada.

Since our inception in 1983, we have delivered end-to-end solutions for some of Canada’s most challenging and complex energy, mining and infrastructure projects, with an unrelenting focus on safety, while delivering to the highest degree of quality. Bantrel performs design and procurement services from our Calgary, Edmonton and Toronto offices and delivers construction management and self perform construction services at various Client sites across Canada.

Our global reach and local touch is demonstrated by our affiliation with our parent company, Bechtel Corporation, one of the largest EPC companies in the world, and with McCaig Investments, a Canadian owned private company with longstanding ties to the local business community.

www.bantrel.com

Bantrel Co.: My Company | LinkedIn

Job Description

Hatch and Bantrel have formed the Hatch Bantrel Joint Venture (HBJV) to execute engineering and construction on the BHP Jansen Potash Mine Project in Saskatchewan. After successfully completing the Definition Phase Study for the project, the HBJV is currently carrying out the Detailed Engineering Phase for the Processing, Non-Process Infrastructure (NPI) and Mining Areas of the 4.5 Mtpa Stage 1 Potash Mine. With a published TIC of US $5.3-5.7 Billion this will represent one of the largest projects and private investments in Canada. The HBJV will use a hybrid of best-in-class new developing technologies and systems as well as the proven HBJV suite of tools to execute this exciting project.

The Reality Capture Specialist will be responsible for executing the reality capture program for the Jansen Project. This includes carrying out the following activities in accordance with project standards and requirements: performing and managing 360 image capture; drone orthomosaic photogrammetry; and mobile and terrestrial laser scanning. 

* Please note this position is not eligible for a relocation subsidy or living out allowance. This will be a camp position on a rotation.

In this full-time permanent role, you will be a champion of diversity & inclusion.

Duties & Responsibilities

Role responsibilities include:

  • This role will work closely with the Jansen project’s field engineering and construction supervision teams who require digital footage as well as the project’s quality assurance site survey contractor.
  • The role is responsible to manage, plan and implement the Jansen project’s potash ‘remotely piloted aircraft system’ (RPAS) program
  • The role is responsible to conduct regular and frequent:
    • Sitewide drone orthomosaic photogrammetry flights utilizing the ‘Drone Deploy’ software.  Note that all drone flights follow the Visual Flight Rule (VFR) minimums for controlled and uncontrolled airspace, as per Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs), Part VI General Operating and Flight Rules, Division VI – Visual Flight Rules
    • Sitewide laser scanning constructed installations using the Veerum software
    • Sitewide 360 image capture utilizing the ‘Openspace’ software
  • Maintaining positive relationships and open communication with internal and external stakeholders, maintaining professionalism in all company related activities and upholding the company values
  • Attending and actively participating in meetings
  • Excellent presentation, written and oral communication skills, listening & interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills
  • Pro-active, highly motivated and a strong team player with a positive attitude
  • Strong ownership and responsibility for a project or task of high importance to see it through to completion
  • Ability to effectively prioritize, execute and deliver tasks in a high-pressure/stress environment under tight deadlines.
  • Strong attention to detail

Following may be required:

  • Travel to module assembly yards and vendor package units
  • Conducting oral presentations to varying audiences 
Qualifications

Suitable qualifications for this role include but are not limited to:

  • A recognized degree in an engineering or scientific discipline
  • Certified/diploma engineering technologist/technician
  • Specialized courses in engineering, surveying or other relevant specialized disciplines
  • Appropriate recognized trade qualifications and experience
  • Current Canadian drivers license issued from candidates point of origin

Essential capabilities:

  • Proficiency in the use of desktop PC with Microsoft and other various software
  • Proficiency with cutting edge hardware technologies and associated software/applications including mobile devices (e.g. tablet, phone) etc.

Preferences, but not pre-requisites are:

  • Field experience
  • Practical work experience in fields of design engineering, environmental, construction, operations, commissioning etc.
  • Technical knowledge and experience in the application of engineering, environmental and construction practices sufficient to comprehend specified engineering, environmental and construction requirements
  • Proficiency and experience with laser scanning LIDAR (light detection and ranging) and photogrammetry devices, laser scanning devices, drones, and 2D & 3D camera (still and video) devices
  • For this role, a ‘remotely piloted aircraft system’ (RPAS) license is required, but is not pre-requisite.  The project will provide the training and support to obtain the necessary licence(s) required as per the Transport Canada drone operating categories (i.e. basic operations, advanced operations and possibly special flight operations)
  • There is a preference for local candidates to apply who can work 5 days on (Monday to Friday) and two days (weekend) off each week


Additional Information

Please note there is a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. Prospective employees will not be asked to disclose their vaccination status and only successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination and/or to seek accommodation pursuant to the mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy prior to starting work.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for further review will be contacted. All other resumes will be retained for future consideration.

title: Trade Marketing and Events Manager (2 year fixed term contract)
description:
Trade Marketing & Events Manager – 2 year Fixed Term Contract

We are worldwide Augmented Hospitality leaders, the best at what we do. Heartists is what we call ourselves, generous, passionate, attentive and free, whether we are welcoming guests, connecting with our peers or serving others.

Our entire Accor estate expands across the world. With over 300,000 experts committed to rejuvenating the hospitality experience we pride ourselves in being the employer of choice, so live limitlessly, be ALL you are, grow with us, work with purpose and explore the endless opportunities in store.

With summer in the not distant horizon, we have a fantastic 2 year fixed term opportunity to help add some sunshine to your next career move.

Join us in the Sales Team as Trade Marketing & Events Manager where you will play a pivotal role in increasing market share and driving sales amongst our B2B community and growing sales leads.  This high impact role will work across all sales segments and commercial teams within the hub J

Here is a summary of some of the great things you will be doing:

Planning & Performance analysis

  • Support to create an annual Trade Marketing plan (including KPI‘s for all activities) in agreement with all commercial teams.
  • Ensure a regular analysis of the performance of all actions that had been carried out, in exchange with sales leaders & other commercial teams

 

Sales Enablement:

  • Provide the right materials, content & arguments to sales teams to sell professionally
  • Manage the content in our sales enablement tool, ensuring it‘s always updated and measure the adoption
  • Have experience in content creation and optimisation through data driven insights and consumer journeys.

Client events:

  • Work alongside the Trade Marketing & Events team and relevant sales teams to organise B2B activities & events
  • Ensure maximum impact and effectiveness from trade marketing activities
  • Provide necessary tools for sales teams to prepare small events on their own

Lead generation & marketing automation

  • Support B2B trade marketing campaigns to raise awareness and drive sales
  • Grow interest with targeted, segmented & automated communication

B2B loyalty

  • Help the sales teams grow strong relationships with customers
  • Support the sales teams with marketing and sales materials, presentations
  • Work in close collaboration with other commercial teams to put the needed actions in place

Your profile? A university graduate with a Sales and Marketing background. You will be results driven, a great team player with outstanding communication skills! Additional languages; Hungarian, and/or Dutch are highly desriable!  

To acknowledge your hard work, loyalty and commitment to us, we offer an extensive benefits package; competitive salary, bonus, season ticket loans, subsidised gym membership, private medical healthcare, pension, and of course complimentary hotel stays (to name a few). 

Your Accor experience begins now, so if you are entrepreneurial, hands on, a great multi tasker, and eager to learn then we want to hear from you!

title: Marketing Operations Intern (8 month contract)
description:
DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, is currently hiring for a Marketing Intern on an 8 month contract. Preferred start date for the role is September 5, 2022, although there is some flexibility depending on candidate availability. The position can be office-based (Markham) or remote anywhere in Canada.



DePuy Synthes provides one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. Our solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com.



The Marketing Operations Intern candidate will have the opportunity to gain experience in such areas as Product and Customer Strategy, New Product Launches, Planning, Sales, Event Management and Operations. The ideal candidate would be a results and performance driven individual, who has the ability to demonstrate these qualities through characteristics such as being innovative, adaptable and eager to learn from others.



Key Responsibilities:





+ Work closely with the Marketing team to develop Account and Product strategies that will be incorporated into the business planning process and our day to day operations



+ Assist in the execution of strategies and tactics for projects and new product launches.



+ Collaborate with Marketing, Operations, Sales, Planning and Deliver teams to process and prioritize requests for new Implant and/or Instrument set builds



+ Analyze recent set deployments and provide the Marketing and Operations teams with insights on their performance



+ Manage Not For Human Use products and samples including processing requests, deployments, usage tracking, returns, inventory reconciliations and reporting



+ Partner with Marketing, Sales and Operations teams to coordinate items and logistics related to Trade Shows, Education Events, Dinner Meetings, Labs, etc...



+ Work with Marketing and Sales teams supporting and fulfilling requests for product information



+ Review the various components that make up implant and/or instrument sets and make recommendations to optimize their performance in collaboration with the Marketing team



+ Co-Op will be provided with a list of projects of importance to the organization from which they have the opportunity to select one based on their personal interests and development opportunities. They will lead this project with cross functional support through to implementation, presenting updates and outcomes to Sr. Leadership.



+ Support internal and external ad-hoc requests





Qualifications




+ Student in good standing, working towards the completion of an undergraduate degree, graduate degree or diploma



+ Legally authorized to work in Canada



+ Must be eligible to work an 8 month work term beginning in September 2022.



+ Strong interpersonal and communication skills.



+ Ability to work with cross functional teams and build relationships.



+ Independent thinker who actively takes the initiative to complete tasks.



+ Strong organizational skills with a proven ability to multitask and follow up on actions/ issues.



+ Strong Microsoft office skills - Excel, PowerPoint, Word



+ Ability to travel up to 10% of the time





At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.



For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.



Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing, and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive, and accessible work environment where all employees can achieve their potential.



Primary Location

Canada-Ontario-Markham-200 Whitehall Drive

Organization

Johnson & Johnson Inc. (7695)

Job Function

General Administration

Requisition ID

2206038050W

title: Brand Manager-Contract
description:
Overview:

PMA Canada is the largest private Sales and Marketing execution partner of fine spirits, wines, beer and coolers in Canada. We represent a number of premium brands in the beverage alcohol industry.   We have delivered strong, uninterrupted sales growth since the Company foundation 40 years ago. We pride ourselves on providing Service Excellence for our Brand Owners, Customers & Consumers.

 

The Brand Manager fosters strong relationships with brand owner partners and trade development to develop the brand vision and goals for Canada. Collaborating closely with the key internal stakeholders in the development and execution of ATL & BTL budgets and plans. The Brand Manager is the go to expert in Marketing/ Brand Management for the brands to achieve annual brand objectives that outpaces category growth.

 

Deliver superior brand performance by enabling saliency and advocacy with the influencers (OP Bartenders, Customers, Consumers and Media where applicable) and lead the charge to recruit new and lapsed consumers working in conjunction with the PMA Marketing and Customer Marketing team, Agencies, the PMA Sales Force and Customers (Retail, On-Premise outlets & chains). This is a contract role.  

Responsibilities:

Key Deliverables:                                        

â€¢             Commercial Results: Brand Depletions (Sales), Market Share & brand ROI (at the level of Can $ income less A&P) beats plan.

â€¢             Brand Owner Engagement: Proactively engages the Brand Owner team and Director, Brand Development to align on annual Brand Plans and Activations within brand guidelines.

o     Develop and establish clear brand communication & activation strategies that drive brand growth, image & equity.
