title: Marketing Campaign Manager, Ecosystems & Alliances - 1 yr contract
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract
Reference code: 99825
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto; Montreal; Ottawa; Saint John; Vancouver; Windsor

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills...whatever those may be.
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.

Do you have a passion for marketing? Are you driven to make smart marketing decisions that impact growth, enhance market positioning, and account and relationship focused in your approach? Here's an exciting opportunity to flex your strategic muscle supporting Deloitte's Ecosystems & Alliances business strategy which collaborates with some of the world's leading technology providers to address business challenges and meet new market needs.

What will your typical day look like?

As a Marketing Campaign Manager, Ecosystems & Alliances, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency and an integral member of a high performing team, responsible for developing the strategy and leading the execution of strategic marketing initiatives. You will have oversight for the project management and execution of business driven marketing campaigns on time, on schedule and on budget; working in close collaboration with our studio agency teams and internal stakeholders to deliver world-class campaigns to the client/business. You will collaborate closely with the Senior Marketing and Business Leaders for Ecosystems & Alliances, who are responsible for setting the strategic marketing and communications strategy and marketing plans.

  • Support delivery of effective marketing programs and collaborating with Canadian and global counterparts which build pipeline and eminence for alliance programs and drive business growth for Deloitte's Alliances go to market initiatives
  • Work closely with Ecosystems & Alliance Senior Marketing and Business leaders to develop and execute annual and quarterly marketing plans to meet business goals and work closely with leadership and cross-functional teams to execute agile plans and support tracking of marketing budgets aligned to alliance strategy.
  • Measure effectiveness of marketing activities and adjust plans and tactics based upon collected metrics; Contribute to the creation of ROI reports
  • Create and leverage strategic messaging and positioning to differentiate Deloitte and advance awareness of capabilities, offering, solutions and successes across the broader organization and in the marketplace
  • Produce deliverables with a cross-function internal agency including, thought leadership (whitepapers, reports, surveys, etc.), Deloitte-hosted and third-party events, externally facing videos and webcasts, speaking opportunities for alliance leaders, social media and blogging, and digital advertising.
  • Collaborate with key relationship managers, alliance, and sales teams to develop integrated alliance marketing campaigns
  • Maintain processes to ensure consistently high quality of marketing deliverables, coordinating internal service providers and external vendors supporting projects as required

About the team

Deloitte's in-house marketing agency is seeking a 1-year secondment role for a Campaign Manager. As a Campaign Manager, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency and an integral member of a high performing team, responsible for developing the strategy and leading the execution of strategic marketing initiatives. Why Deloitte? Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. The team consists of passionate individuals seeking ways to bring data into daily business conversations. The team's purpose is to put data and insight at the forefront of Marketing conversations. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Ecosystems & Alliances, the manager is self-motivated, energetic, driven for success, methodical, process and detail oriented. The manager will be expected to work closely with many across the agency: senior marketing advisors, campaign leads, studio team leads, resource managers and operations leads as well as SMEs in IT, Finance and Privacy.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone with:

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field
  • 5+ years of enterprise B2B marketing experience in professional services
  • Experience in creating demand generation programs and digital marketing strategies
  • Strong performance in developing, managing and executing multichannel marketing programs, with a collaborative mindset, to consistently deliver high quality results
  • Experience in developing digital advertising, branding and social media to support event marketing activations
  • Experience creating written messaging, thought leadership and B2B collateral as well as presenting concepts and ideas to colleagues, internal clients and alliance partners
  • High proficiency with MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Up to 30% travel required

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Developer, Equity, Manager, Marketing Manager, Marketing, Technology, Finance, Management

Apply now "

title: Brand Manager - 12months Contract
description:
Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic brands, such as Hunts, Aylmer, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, VH Sauces, Pogo and Vlasic®, and emerging brands, including Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein®, and Frontera®. We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit www.conagrabrands.ca. Conagra Brands est une des principales entreprises d’aliments de marque en Amérique du Nord. Son histoire est jalonnée de grands succès alimentaires qui sont le fruit du travail d’une équipe passionnée par l’innovation et la croissance. Conagra offre des choix pour toute occasion grâce à des marques réputées comme Hunt’s®, Aylmer®, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, les sauces VH®, Pogo®, Vlasic® et des marques émergentes, dont Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein® et Frontera®. Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir la culture la plus influente, la plus dynamique et la plus inclusive du secteur alimentaire. Pour en savoir plus, visitez www.conagrabrands.ca.

Position Summary:

The Brand Manager, Brand Management will focus on delivery of annual financial/marketplace targets through leading and assisting in the development and setting the direction for the Annual Operating Plan (“AOP”). Sets and tracks brand(s) budgets based on AOP and owns decision for any out of plan activity (excluding innovation) that impacts the budget. Analyzes all elements of the P&L, sets direction, and makes decisions to achieve financial/marketplace outcomes. Focused on brand equity and translates strategic consumer insights into meaningful marketing activation plans. Responsible for developing brand vision as a result of the strategic planning process and leads the branded strategic planning process. Responsibilities: 70% Planning and P&L Management: Lead Annual Operating Plan (AOP) for brand and strategic planning process. Oversee the development and execution of marketing plan including pricing, media/activation plans, sales material (sales decks, sell sheets), packaging, merchandising (display units and mix), product assortment/distribution. Delivery of annual financial targets for assigned brands/portfolio(s) according to plan. Manage and deliver on all lines of the P&L (volume, COGS, A&P). Proactively recommend corrective action if necessary. Identify opportunities for cost reductions working in partnership with RQI and plant personnel. Drive revenue growth management activities via integrated Margin Management and Pricing recommendations Anticipate future business needs and proactively gain alignment with cross functional partners Drive demand centered insights and jobs theory for brand(s). Develop, align and lead growth strategy initiatives. Develop and manage Brand equity (language, vision, strategy). Solid understanding and use of consumer insights and competitive analysis. Align business processes, drive priorities, and initiatives across assigned brand team/function to create seamless integration (deliver share, penetration and/or buy rate objectives) Ensure Brand initiatives are consistent with agreed upon goals, priorities, strategies, and brand equities Work closely with Brand Development team on understanding innovation pipeline for brand(s)/portfolio. Create and execute comprehensive marketing activation plans. Collaborate with and ensure effectiveness of working relationship with Market Strategy and Planning (MS&P) partners to ensure that go-to-market strategy and trade spend effectiveness is being followed and executed Work with MS&P on the commercialization of innovations and ensure Sales have all the tools required (sell sheets, etc) for innovations and for branded news. Work with Digital and E-Commerce team to ensure go-to-market strategy is being followed and executed 20% - Strengthen & Build Brand Management Process Build organizational technical capabilities by providing day-to-day coaching and mentoring to cross-functional team and external partners. Ensure successful presentation, comprehension and integration of AOP, strategic plans, business reviews, and briefs to senior leadership team or business partners. Lead the relationship building with US, International and Canada innovation teams 10% - Admin Support Manage A&P spending to ensure spend is within specified budget(s). Monitor brand(s) budget and track associated expenses in Allocadia (P&D); reconciling invoices against approved projects Assist SBM, Brand Management with process enhancement projects, as required Qualifications, Education & Experience: 3-5 years experience in Brand management within Consumer Packaged Goods, ideally in Tier 1 food manufacturing. Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA a strong plus. Successful experience in developing and executing marketing programs, brief writing, and managing P&L’s Proven ability to deliver initiatives that have been realized and contributed significant gains in the capture of market share, revenue and volume growth, and operational efficiencies. Demonstrated success anticipating future business opportunities or problems and developing strategies that address them proactively. Ability to make sound business decisions that balance a variety of factors in a complex operating environment and ultimately achieve optimal outcomes. Good strategic and analytic capabilities. Comfortable utilizing data to support business decisions. Experience working with a cross function team including sales, finance and research. Demonstrated organizational, prioritization, and multi-tasking skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to function effectively as a leader and in a team environment. Our Modern Workplace: Conagra’s culture of collaboration enhances our ability to meet critical business goals, deliver value to customers and consumers and provide you with the flexibility you need to achieve a better work-life balance. We carefully consider each role and how often each team member needs to collaborate in-person. This position requires you work from our Mississauga office [3] days a week. Notre lieu de travail moderne: La culture de collaboration de Conagra améliore notre capacité à atteindre les objectifs d’affaires critiques, à offrir de la valeur aux clients et aux consommateurs et à vous offrir la flexibilité dont vous avez besoin pour parvenir à un meilleur équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée. Nous examinons attentivement chaque posts et la fréquence à laquelle chaque membre de l'équipe doit collaborer en présentiel. Ce poste exige que vous travailliez de notre bureau de Mississauga [3] jours par semaine. SF:LI Conagra Brands is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or any other protected factor. ConAgra Foods is committed to working with and providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail Canada.Recruitment@conagrafoods.com. We will make a determination on your request for accommodation on a case-by-case basis. À titre d'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, Conagra Brands considère les postulants qualifiés pour les offres d'emplois sans égard à la race, la couleur, les croyances religieuses, l'origine, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, la langue parlée, l'âge, le handicap ou tout autre facteur discriminatoire. Conagra Brands s'engage à travailler et offrir des accommodements aux individus ayant des handicaps. Si vous avez besoin d'assistance ou si vous avez des besoins spécifiques pour votre emploi, vous pouvez transmettre votre demande par courriel à Canada.Recruitment@conagrafoods.com. Nous prendrons en considération votre demande d'accommodement au cas-par-cas.

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Marketing Specialist (15 month contract)
description:
:

Do you have a passion for connecting to customers through an array of digital, social channels and events? Do you enjoy aligning with sales teams and other internal audiences to help drive demand and revenue through various marketing activities? If so, then you might be our newest team member! We're ready for you to make an immediate impact. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.

 

What you'll do

As a B2B Marketing Specialist, you'll build and execute marketing activities associated with the planning of go-to-market efforts aligned to SAS' overall sales and marketing strategy. You'll liaise with internal sales and business teams, including taking a lead role in communicating marketing results and strategic direction, upcoming campaigns and key corporate events. You'll be a part of a global team, planning and executing global marketing efforts across SAS' key geographies.

 

You'll be responsible for

  • Developing the cross-channel go-to-market strategy for various industry verticals within Western Region, ensuring that marketing programs and initiatives have tight alignment with both sales and customer goals.
  • Developing, leading, and executing marketing programs and campaigns that help drive awareness, education, pipeline generation, and revenue through various live events and digital channels.
  • Creating go-to-market plans for the key initiatives or industry by working collaboratively with global counterparts to build integrated campaigns at each stage of the customer journey.
  • Developing the marketing program details, designing and executing the strategy and communicating the effort accordingly.
  • Analyzing metrics and communicating results, including traffic and conversion statistics, lead generation, pipeline impact and return on investment.
  • Managing sales and marketing alignment by showcasing campaigns, methods and metrics.
  • Working collaboratively to build specific offers at each stage of the customer journey. Offers can extend to many channels, including web, social, search and email.
  • Collaborating as part of a global team representing the growth initiative area, delivering on the initiative's strategic goals.
  • Performing other duties, as assigned.

 

What we're looking for

  • Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Business, Marketing, or related discipline.
  • At least four years of experience in demand generating marketing or related function in the technology or other business-to-business industry.
  • Strong track record and understanding of digital marketing concepts.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to build strategic working relationships at all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to convey in-depth knowledge of marketing metrics, including revenue, pipeline, and leads and be able to tell a story through the metrics.
  • Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with a wide variety of audiences.

 

The nice to haves

  • Experience working with a multi-national or global organization, collaborating across different cultures, time zones and geographies.
  • Demonstrated project management and meeting facilitation skills.
  • Demonstrated understanding of marketing communication concepts/functions and software tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, HTML). Plus, experience with marketing tools including sales force automation, marketing automation, and social media tools.
  • Creativity and a willingness to experiment and take risks.
  • Preferred location is Toronto.

 

Why SAS:

  • We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.  
  • Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn't about fitting into our culture, it's about adding to it - and we can't wait to see what you'll bring.

 

Additional Information:  

  • To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada.  
  • SAS is an equal opportunity employer.   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.  
  • Equivalent combination of education, training and relevant experience may be considered in place of the education requirement stated above.      
  • The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience.  
  • Resumes may be considered in the order they are received.  
  • SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

title: Marketing and Strategy Manager - 12 - 18 Month Contract
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

As a global leader in B2B assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, the insight we deliver at EY helps build trust and confidence in capital markets and global economies. We’re working hand-in-hand to help leading Canadian organizations transform their business for what comes next and prepare for what comes after that. 

In this role, you’ll provide strategic planning, business enablement and marketing support for go-to-market initiatives. You will be the marketing and enablement point of contact, owning program management, execution and measurement of results. You will work hand-in-hand with the national leadership teams as well as sector, service line and geographic leadership teams, marrying together business goals to drive the strategic planning process, and determine the most impactful go-to-market programs and initiatives and grow pipeline and revenue. You’ll leverage and effectively communicate your strong knowledge of the full suite of EY capabilities and solutions to enable our client-facing teams to converse with clients, build opportunities and increasingly win in the market.
 
From reputation through to relationships and revenue, succeeding in this role will mean understanding our business, our sectors, our clients and our brand – and then continuously evolving our strategy and tactics to help us win. 

Your key responsibilities: 

  • Be a key member of the leadership team to enable desired growth of the practice. 

  • Focus on strengthening our brand with key accounts, prospective clients and influencers.

  • Facilitate the strategic planning process for the team to identify the appropriate go-to-market activities required to achieve market growth across key sub-service lines and solutions.

  • Drive and manage the execution of the go-to-market strategy, specifically focusing on marketing campaigns. Work closely with the leaders and sub-sector leaders, to identify business needs and areas for investment. 

  • Project manage go-to market activities and prioritize initiatives that supports our strategic plans and opportunity development.

  • Identify demand, trends and opportunities through insightful analysis of the market and the priority accounts, and continuously identify new opportunities for improvement.

  • Oversee the delivery of various requirements for reporting pipeline and revenue to track the impact of go-to-market initiatives on pipeline, revenue and growth targets, and provide status updates to leadership. 

  • Track and report ROI on all campaigns, programs, events and marketing efforts. 

  • Be the knowledge curator, leveraging the full suite of EY’s services and solutions to deliver relevant insights, and to equip and enable client conversations.

  • Drive internal connectivity, engagement and communication across the sectors. Be the connection to global sector leaders and teams, including BD, Operations, Marketing and Knowledge. 

 

Skills and attributes for success:

  • Prior experience with marketing campaign management and content development roles 

  • Ability to work alongside and effectively communicate with senior executives, being seen as a credible, trusted advisor

  • Strong business acumen and grasp of leading brand-to-demand tactics

  • Experience bridging thought leadership, solutions, and client issues to build meaningful conversations and bolster relationships

  • At ease managing multiple high-priority projects and navigating ambiguity in a deadline-driven and matrixed environment

  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills – comfortable in reviewing reports, interpreting data and identifying trends that will assist in further targeting appropriate go-to-market activities that will generate pipeline growth

  • Strong strategic, organizational, and autonomous project management skills 

  • Compelling public speaker, writer and communicator who articulates concepts and ideas clearly

  • Process-driven, always looking for ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness

  • Ability to work both independently and with the team, relying on strong influencing skills to achieve results

  • A strong executive presence

  • Excellent relationship building skills, adapting to all levels of internal and external stakeholders at Global scale

  • Enthusiastic team player who thrives on new challenges, big ideas, and curiosity

 

Qualifications:

  • A bachelor’s degree; graduate degree preferred, in Business Administration, Marketing or related field. 

  • 8+ years of relevant business experience; Knowledge of B2B marketing experience an asset.

  • Past experience in professional services is highly desirable.

  • Strong program/project/campaign management and execution experience

  • Strong stakeholder management skills; comfortable working with senior leaders

  • A proven ability to manage multiple go-to-market initiatives, resulting in pipeline creation and sales

  • In-depth knowledge of marketing trends, execution and measurement (analytics, dashboarding, reporting, etc.) 

  • Strong organizational and time management skills; demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, stakeholders and complex projects and initiatives at one time

  • Strong team player with the ability to work independently and remotely effectively 

 
What we offer
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Plus, we offer:

  • Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry

  • Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

 

Diversity and Inclusion at EY

Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.
 
EY Way of Work and your health and safety

EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely.  To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at client or other locations.  A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided. ​​​​​​​

 

What we offer

 

If you join EY full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options.  Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances.  You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

 

  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

 

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

 

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 

EY | Building a better working world

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

 

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

 

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at

ssc.customersupport@ey.com

.

title: Brand Manager (14M contract)
description:
Victoria Newitt Recruitment Inchas been retained by
our 'Client'to search for aBrand Manager.

This role will report to the Director of Marketing, and will be responsible for the development of marketing plans, advertising and promotional programs, pricing and sales forecasts to support the achievement of company growth targets. This person will have a big hand in both developing + executing the brand strategy to drive + accelerate growth.

A Bit About You:
  • You believe that plant-based is more than just a way of eating but a total lifestyle shift
  • You are passionate about changing the world through a plant-based movement and the impact that can have on the world (but being vegan isn’t necessary)
  • You want to spend your days working with cool people who love what they do
  • You want to have impact and are proactive in finding opportunities to make a difference
  • You thrive in a fast paced environment + aren’t afraid to get your hands a bit dirty
  • You have a passion for growth and a proactive approach to personal development
  • You are a people person that enjoys collaborative team sessions and isn’t scared off by discussions with senior leadership
  • You pay attention to the details and are a great problem solver when fires are burning

Key Responsibilities:
  • Develops and executes strategic marketing plans to facilitate volume and profit growth to meet company objectives. Includes ongoing brand reviews/analyses, monitoring P&L, promotional plans, media/ad plans, competitive analyses, and accurate forecasting for Brands and products.
  • Develop consumer insights through trend gathering and competitive monitoring
  • Uses research and available data to identify business issues and growth opportunities and track the performance of the market, our brands and the competition.
  • Budget management.
  • Provides input and guidance on pricing and margins.
  • Recommends and manages research with our various agency partners
  • Plans and develops advertising and promotion activities.
  • Leads development and production of marketing materials.
  • Identifies opportunities for product improvements and line extensions and manages their implementation.
  • Evaluates market reactions and results to advertising programs, merchandising activities, product packaging and formulation.
  • Works closely with Sales to ensure trade/consumer marketing programs meet brand and sales objectives. Attends and presents at Sales calls and conferences as requested
Qualifications
  • Education: Degree or Diploma in Business, preferably Marketing.
  • Experience: At least 5 years’ experience in Marketing, preferably with 2 years at a Manager’s level
  • Proven ability to develop effective marketing programs, translating marketing objectives into functional plans that achieve targets.
  • Strong understanding and working knowledge of Nielsen Homescan, MarketTrack and related market analysis tools.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to lead cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to work individually as well as part of cross-functional teams.
  • Proactive and willing to take initiative when appropriate.
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and oral.
  • Highly organized and able to multitask.
  • Excellent ability to build relationships.
  • Excellent computer skills, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Good attention to detail.
If this position suits your skills and experience, we want to talk to you!

Please apply by submitting your resume and a covering letter outlining why you are a suitable candidate for this exciting role.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
About Dimagi

Dimagi is an award-winning social enterprise and a certified B-corp and Benefit Corporation. We build software solutions and provide technology consulting services to improve the quality of essential services for underserved populations. Our open-source technology platform, CommCare, is the world's most widely-used and researched mobile data collection platform for frontline workers. Our choice to be a certified B-Corp and Benefit Corporation sends a clear signal to our partners, our team members, and our communities that we not only believe but also take action in using business as a force for good. Together they combine our passion and commitment to tackle complex health and social inequities and work towards a brighter future for all.

About the position

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to focus on growing our CommCare user base and SaaS revenue through the exciting growth stage of getting from 300 to 1,000 SaaS customers. This new hire will help us formalize our Go To Market (GTM) plan (formalization of buyer personas and their buyer journeys, positioning, marketing strategy) and be accountable for messaging and sales enablement. As Product Marketing Manager for CommCare, you will think like a general manager with strong customer empathy, creative problem-solving skills, and the ability to research, synthesize and analyze data to drive impact. 

Responsibilities

Product Marketing Operations

  • Develop a marketing plan for Dimagi's CommCare product in conjunction with our product, sales and marketing teams, to support the retention and expansion of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers
  • Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the iNGO and digital development market(s), our competitive landscape and target buyer personas
  • Collaborate with product management and sales to develop product positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas
  • Plan the launches of net-new features and releases of existing products, and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan
  • Understand and support our sales channels; train them on the problems we solve for our buyers and users; develop product demos, internal tools and external collateral and teach them how and when to use them
  • Develop external collateral such as webpages, case studies, playbooks, success stories, brochures
  • Ensure marketing assets and collateral are maintained and organized across different systems for accessibility
  • Partner closely with marketing team members to deliver on business objectives
  • Support the development of best practices for product marketing across Dimagi in collaboration with the Global Marketing Director and US Health Marketing Director

Demand Generation Support

  • Work closely with the Marketing Campaign Manager, the product team, the sales team, and our customers to develop and deliver high-value webinars for prospects and existing customers
  • Partner with the Marketing Campaign Manager and the digital marketing team to build and execute digital campaigns including developing content, defining target audience, testing, launching and analyzing results
  • Work with digital marketing to perform regular marketing automation improvements, hold share outs and share learnings 
  • Define product marketing KPIs; regularly track results and provide updates to business stakeholders

Market Intelligence

  • Conduct market research to assist in defining product marketing strategy by collecting data focused on competitor landscape and voice of the customer
  • Maintain consistent reporting cadences across the marketing team by using our data to communicate performance, areas for improvement and share successes or failures
  • Analyze the performance of marketing campaigns and work with the marketing team to improve the ROI and impact of the program

Relevant Skills

  • 3+ years of related work experience
  • Experience working in global health, digital for development, technology in public health and related industries
  • A broad functional understanding of sales and marketing
  • Ability to grasp new technical concepts quickly
  • Strong written and oral communication skills as well as storytelling with PowerPoint/Google Slides and other tools; English fluency
  • Strong analytical skills and proficiency using Excel
  • Highly organized and autonomous, but also collaborative and able to work cross-functionally
  • Proficient in Microsoft office suite and Google suite
  • BA or BS in marketing, communications or equivalent experience
  • Comfortable working in fast-paced, high-growth environments
  • Able to prioritize and meet deadlines without sacrificing quality
  • Experience creating organizational alignment

Strong Pluses:

  • Strong understanding of demand generation campaigns
  • Product management and product marketing experience, particularly in a B2B SaaS environment
  • Experience with Marketing Automation technology (Hubspot, or similar), Salesforce, and Google Analytics or similar analytics tools
  • General copywriting and editing skills
  • Intermediate project management skills
  • Energetic with a growth mindset
  • Proven track record of driving growth and enabling sales

Please Note: As a federal contractor Dimagi, Inc. is required to comply with the federal mandate that employees of federal contractors be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. All Dimagi, Inc. employees based in the United States, both in-office and remote, are required to provide a record of full vaccination or an approved vaccine exemption claim. Your offer of employment will be contingent upon meeting this requirement.

Compensation and Benefits: 

We aim to make a difference, not just as a company, but as an employer as well. We are transparent about salaries at all levels of the organization and have a standard, global pay scale for all positions. Given our social mission, our budgeted salary scale is more in-line with that of a non-profit organization. However, the benefits we offer are geared towards having a strong impact on our staff's well-being. A few of our key benefits are outlined below:

  • Access to a Health Spending Account with an employer contribution of $166 CAD per month
  • Access to a RRSP employer match of up to 4% of base salary
  • 30 days paid time off inclusive of public holidays
  • Unlimited sick time and personal emergency leave days
  • Access to a flex-time policy that allows employees to work based on a flexible work schedule
  • Access to Life, AD&D, and LTD insurance benefits
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) through Magellan Healthcare

 

Dimagi is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate and support diversity and are committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, ethnicity, gender identity and expression, national origin, family or parental status, veteran or disability status.

title: Associate Brand Manager - Cat Treats (12 month contract)
description:
This role is a 12 month contract role

The Brand Leader on the Cat Treats portfolio will develop and drive the brand plan on a fast-paced, innovative segment. They will be data-driven and ambitious, and will be the strategic hub for cat treats across the organization.

What are we looking for?

  • Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business
  • 2+ years professional experience in marketing, preference to CPG marketing experience
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability work with cross functional teams
  • Data-driven decision maker, with a passion for insights that drive action
  • Advanced user of MS office
What will be your key responsibilities?
  • Develop and implement brand plans, with the support of your team lead
  • Develop and implement promotional activities, including initiatives that support brand goals
  • Regularly analyze sales and market data, consumer research, and other brand metrics to analyze brand health and make strategic recommendations for the business
  • Collaborate to develop best-in-class consumer communication and sales materials in partnership with Customer Marketing and other functions
  • Develop recommendations to support the existing brand strategy
  • Track and effectively manage the brand budgets
  • Collaborate with CMI on research projects gathering insights and/or testing new concepts
  • Lead Canadian Cat Treats innovation/commercialization process

What can you expect from Mars?

  • Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
  • Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
  • Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
  • An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

title: Business Development Associate (4 month contract)
description:
Business Development Associate (4 month contract), Wealth Management
Vancouver – Job # 3977

Summary:

Through its principal subsidiaries, Canaccord Genuity Group Inc. (the “Company”) is a leading independent, full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry: wealth management and capital markets. 

Since its establishment in 1950, the Company has been driven by an unwavering commitment to building lasting client relationships. We achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional and corporate clients through comprehensive investment solutions, brokerage services and investment banking services.

The Company has Wealth Management offices located in Canada, the UK, Guernsey, Jersey, the Isle of Man and Australia.  Canaccord Genuity, the international capital markets division, operates in North America, UK & Europe, Asia, Australia and the Middle East.  

Our Canadian operation, Canaccord Genuity Corp., is currently looking for a self-motivated and energetic individual to join our Wealth Management team in Vancouver. The successful incumbent will be supporting an established wealth management team. They must be driven, professional, resourceful, self-motivated and have a strong work ethic.

This is a part time temporary role for 4 months with a possibility of extension.

Responsibilities:
 
  • Prepare e-mail and general mail outs to clients and prospects including tracked email marketing;
  • Organize and maintain a database of prospects;
  • Utilize social media platforms for posting marketing literature.
  • Perform outgoing sales calls (cold and warm calls) aimed at identifying and qualifying potential investors ;


Skills & Qualifications:
 
  • Personable and outgoing with excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Strong customer service skills;
  • Proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook);
  • Demonstrated interest in investment products and aspects of retail wealth management;
  • Social media proficiency.
  • Previous telemarketing and/or sales experience preferred;

Canaccord Genuity Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including persons with disabilities. We will provide reasonable accommodations upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection cycle.

Qualified applicants are invited to submit a resume and covering letter including salary expectations. All applications will be held in strict confidence.

Upon offer, candidates are required to show proof of citizenship, permanent residence or eligibility to work in Canada with no restrictions.

We wish to thank all candidates for their interest but only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Relationship Manager - York, ON (F/T 12-14 Months Contract)
description:
*Excellent Opportunity for those who love working with Students/Youth*

Are you a self-motivated individual with a passion for working with international students (adults and youth), and connecting them with Canadian families? The Canada Homestay Network (CHN) may be the right fit for you!

We are a remote organization that is seeking a Full-Time (40 hours/week) Relationship Manager in York, ON for a 12-14 month maternity leave coverage contract.

*Relationship Managers must be available for infrequent on-call emergencies and have access to a vehicle.

Who We Are

The Canada Homestay Network Society is a family-run, non-profit society, that has helped tens of thousands of students find a home away from home in Canada. CHN has been connecting international students to compassionate and caring Canadian families for over 25 years.

More about the Relationship Manager position

The Relationship Manager (aka. Homestay Coordinator), is an integral member of our Operations team and is responsible for homestay coordination within their region, including in-person student and host support. The Relationship Manager works collaboratively with school boards, international homestay agents, Canadian host families, and international students. All Relationship Managers also assume Custodianship for students under the age of 18 within their local community if required by the client.

Responsibilities:

  • Helps homestay hosts, natural parents, and students interpret cultural differences;
  • Available to meet with students regularly;
  • Some travel throughout York and the surrounding area;
  • Monitor, manage, and bring closure to homestay issues such as interpersonal conflicts, cultural differences, and issues related to student or host behaviour;
  • Deliver student orientation in person or virtually when the student arrives;
  • Respond to crises in a prompt and caring manner and refer cases to health professionals where appropriate;
  • Develop a local network of host families and continually develop and enhance relationships with both new and existing hosts in the region;
  • Assume custodianship for the local region/community (up to 100 km); and,
  • After hours, On-Call may be required for associates who work 30+ hours per week.

The successful candidate will be enthusiastic about

  • Working from home
  • Travelling within your local community (up to one hour)
  • Relationship building and customer service
  • Learning and understanding cultural differences within and outside of Canada
  • Building relationships, especially between students and host parents
  • Orienting students when they arrive in Canada
  • Helping students and families with social, emotional, and physical wellbeing
  • National travel from time-to-time

How we sweeten the deal

  • Remote working including a flexible workday (ideally available during school board hours, M-F 8:30 am to 4:30 pm)
  • Full benefits package (with shared premiums)
  • Paid Vacation and Personal Days
  • Wellness subsidy
  • Paid volunteer days
  • Paid professional development
  • Opportunities for individual and career growth

The successful candidate will have

  • At least two years of homestay or related work experience
  • One-year Community College Certificate or Diploma
  • International experience including hosting students or travelling abroad (preferred)
  • Innate ability to work independently and autonomously in a virtual office environment
  • Great judgment and decision-making skills while exercising a high degree of confidentiality
  • Exceptional Customer Service skills and experience
  • Excellent Word, Excel, Email, and Database skills
  • The ability to confidently communicate in English; its ideal to speak a second language too
  • Superior organization skills and the ability to hold yourself accountable

Other key tools required for the job

  • Readily accessible transportation appropriate for these responsibilities
  • A suitable computer and high-speed internet access
  • A mobile phone for emergency support
  • A valid Criminal Record Check and Vulnerable Sector Check

Our Core Values

Listening Curiously

Collaborating Optimistically

Growing Courageously

Guiding Compassionately

And Giving Wholeheartedly

title: Product Designer
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Select Groups client is looking for a Product Designer for a long term contract role. If you are on the market and open to new roles, please apply directly to the posting. We look forward to working with you! 
 
 Reason for need and project: To help re-platform a few different self serve applications for every day banking. This is a backfill for a consultant leaving the team for a full time engagement

Must Have Skills: 

Sketch and Invision

Someone with strong design thinking

Problem solving - very complicated space

Process mapping skills

FI experience an asset

Day to day responsibilities:

 * Support our growing Digital portfolio
 * Create holistic design solutions for online banking experiences across multiple platforms
 * Shape experiences through hands-on contribution, while ensuring consistency and coordination across design teams
 * Work side by side with customers, product managers, developers, and fellow designers
 * Lead design sprints, mentor junior designers, and guide design efforts from concept through user research, development, and iterative feedback loops
 * Balance business goals, customer needs, and technological capabilities to create solutions that are scalable and future-proofed
 * Rapidly sketch and prototype ideas in order to share concepts and learn from users
 * Translate customer data and insights into design decisions, improvements, and opportunities
 * Drive creation of customer journeys, UX strategy, and future state visions
 * Produce UX deliverables such as user flows, site maps, and wireframes
 * Communicate design rationale and evangelize user-centered design practices
 * Contribute to planning, conducting, and analyzing usability testing and other user research
 * Ensure use of existing design patterns, style guides, and accessibility guidelines, while contributing to their continuous improvement
 * Experience working with front-end developments teams as well as the skill to communicate your ideas clearly</section>

title: Intermediate UI/UX Designer
description:
As an experienced UX/UI designer you will play an integral role in designing next-generation user interface for core digital signage platforms. You will review existing user interface and with your design expertise, understanding of platforms, and gathering feedback from internal users and clients, design a new HTML5-based interface to ensure efficient use and navigation through various user flows.

Advantages
Global provider of in-venue shopper engagement technology. Products influence
consumers at point of decision using wide range of digital touch-points including digital signage,
touch-screens kiosks, mobile phones, web, and social media platforms. Their mission is to provide end-to-
end communication solutions that provide venues with rapid ROI. They power global and well-recognized
brands and the growth of the company is reflected in their successes with their customer base.


Responsibilities
• Determine design interactions and work flows for improved customer experience
• Develop and/or review conceptual wireframes, including design layout, navigation, accessibility requirements that align to product/feature specifications
• Lead, solicit and facilitate user research to get feedback on usage and design considerations
• Present design concepts at stakeholder review meetings, engage in collaborative sessions to come up with a great design
• Involved in planning, coordinating, and facilitating usability testing, including creation of prototypes
• Analyze industry best practices, customer feedback, new vendor offerings, learnings from metrics tracking, competitive analysis and recommend opportunities for improvements to customer experience, products, tools, etc.
• Actively participate in working sessions to determine requirements; review project requirements and production
qualifications
• Work closely with Product Owner, Sales, Development and QA teams to ensure User Interface is following design principles you set out
• Act as design resource and advocate for users during all product review and planning meetings with peers and stakeholders
• Design and execute user research including stakeholder interviews
• Design and implement new user interface for content management system - assist in building and improving user interface design system
• Work closely with other team members on designs, ensure high quality design implementation and user experience
• Work with other team members to understand information architecture, technical requirements/limitations, and implement/drive product requirements, roadmap and deliver high quality software
• Act as design/technical resource to customer support, documentation and quality assurance as needed


Qualifications
• University degree - Computer Science, Interaction Design, Graphic Design or equivalent education
• Minimum of 3 – 5 years in User Experience (HCI and Internet Design principles, W3C standards, accessibility considerations, user research techniques, and usability testing)
• Deep knowledge of design thinking, usability testing, user centric design practices
• Experience executing successful online customer experience, including experience with visual design, navigation, and information architecture
• Experience working independently and as part of cross-functional teams on small/large projects
• Experience working closely with other teams on time estimates, feature trade-offs
• Ability to adapt to fast-paced environment with changing priorities/technologies
• Knowledge of web technologies (platforms, devices, HTML, CSS, SASS, Java Script, Angular (1.6 and later)
• Advanced knowledge in mobile-first design principles and responsive design practices
• Exceptional design software/presentation skills, including working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Balsamiq, Figma or other wireframing/mockup/prototyping tools
• Representative portfolio (minimum of 3-5 projects) highlighting your working designs from concept to delivery including wireframes, user flows, user interface designs and/or prototypes (flats acceptable, but fully or partially functional demos would be ideal)
• Digital Signage/Retail an asset


Summary
As an experienced UX/UI designer you will play an integral role in designing next-generation user interface for core digital signage platforms. You will review existing user interface and with your design expertise, understanding of platforms, and gathering feedback from internal users and clients, design a new HTML5-based interface to ensure efficient use and navigation through various user flows.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Are you the newest UI/UX Designer at Pagefreezer?

What we do and why:

  • No one can ignore the internet these days—and a lot of great things are happening online—but we also know that online harms are damaging many individuals, communities, and organizations. It’s Pagefreezer's vision to make the Internet a safer place by delivering solutions that transform how people protect integrity online, ensuring accountability, and enabling the pursuit of justice.
  • Pagefreezer simplifies compliance and litigation by automatically archiving websites, social media, mobile text messages, and enterprise collaboration platforms for every stage of the information governance lifecycle. We enable organizations to create and share defensible records of their data, quickly and easily in our dashboard, in real-time—every like, share, edit, and deletion.

What’s special about us:

  • Our compensation is comprehensive, competitive, and can include benefits like extended health insurance, a $600 Lifestyle Spending Account, a $1000 annual learning budget, a Tax-Free Savings Account and a matching Retirement Savings Plan and paid time off, if you’re in Canada.
    • Not in Canada? We’ll create a compensation package you’re excited about together.
  • Our coworkers are collaborative, proactive, and interesting -- and they care about the right things. We’ve built a culture based on values that mean something to us and we practice them daily.
  • Our employees’ priorities matter. Career growth? Balancing work and life? Growing your own side-hustle? Helping you live your best life is #goals.
  • Our track record is strong, our market opportunity is growing, and we’re already providing solutions to some of the biggest companies in the world-- and you'll be helping us accelerate even faster. Come join a sustainably profitable, small company and see the impact of your work.

What our UI/UX Designers do:

  • As part of the Product team, create the end User Experience for Pagefreezer’s customers in your assigned product area.
    • Designing highly usable and accessible flows, prototypes and screens for Pagefreezer’s web applications.
    • Creating UX artifacts (flow diagrams, experience maps, user personas, etc) that ensure product designs align with our users and their needs.
    • Using your knowledge of typography, colour, illustration and images to design pleasing and consistent product user interfaces.
    • Working with other designers to manage a UI library, design files, and other UX documentation.
    • Testing and iterating throughout the design process to achieve confidence in your designs before they go to development.
  • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to execute the complete UX workflow
    • Validating and transforming feedback and ideas into new designs that can be implemented to improve the user experience of the product through feedback sessions and user testing.
    • Work closely with the Engineering team to ensure designs are built to match the mockups or prototypes, and refine the collaboration process to achieve our roadmap on time.
    • Performing periodic reviews of the product user experience, as well as our competitors’, to evaluate and improve usability, interface consistency, information architecture and more.

What makes you a great fit:

  • Alignment with our Core Values
  • 3+ years of experience in a Product Design, UI or UX role for a B2B SAAS company
    • Experience creating interactive wireframes
    • A knowledge or interest in accessibility design
    • Ability to write concise and accurate documentation
  • Experience leading user testing of prototype designs and integrating test learnings into a better final result.
  • Enough familiarity with software development and technology (such as HTML and CSS) to be able to collaborate closely with developers
  • Familiarity with how apps get made and the development lifecycle in a Scrum setting
  • A strong sense of initiative, ownership and accountability. Comfortable seeking answers and facilitating challenging conversations around design decisions with various stakeholders.
  • Ability to organize multiple projects on the go while meeting deadlines, budgets and expectations
  • A keen eye for details, ensuring that all the boxes are checked and everyone is informed
  • Trustworthiness, and the ability form meaningful working relationships
  • Experience using tools like: Figma, Photoshop, Jira, Confluence and other UX tools.
  • Comfortable with figuring things out as you go and using creativity and critical thinking to quickly and confidently tackle challenges.
  • Confident communication skills – both written and verbal – can communicate complex ideas clearly to various audiences
  • Able to work 40 hours a week and either:
    • Authorized to work in Canada (anywhere in Canada works for us (except Quebec))
    • Willing to work remotely as a contractor
      • Can be anywhere in the world as long as you commit to overlapping 6-8 hours of time with Vancouver and can work with a team in English

Sound interesting? Time to apply!

title: Business Development Specialist
description:
Are you energetic, passionate about long-term projects, highly organized and motivated to earn significant bonus money?

Walker ClimateCare has a membership-based program named WeCare. WeCare members represent our most valuable clients. They pay a monthly fee per piece of equipment (like a furnace or air conditioner, for example) that entitles them to a free precision tune up each year, in addition to discounts on any parts or labour required to repair that equipment, if needed.

The Business Development Specialist primary responsibility is to grow the portfolio of members. This can be done by:

- Reducing member attrition

- Directly identifying opportunities and converting them with campaigns by e-mail, outbound calling, direct mail, etc.

- Coaching technicians and other customer-facing staff towards excellence in membership conversion

- Adding new equipment coverage to existing WeCare member profiles

The Business Development Specialist will also administrate all aspects of the program; ensuring monthly invoices are paid and following up on any that are outstanding and working with the Service Coordinator to arrange yearly tune up service calls.

As part of its commitment to responsible corporate citizenship, Walker has developed a WeCare Gives Back Program where each month a charity is the beneficiary of a charitable donation. The Business Development Specialist will help identify and coordinate these opportunities as well as leverage them (we have relationships with local newspapers and social media platforms to enable this).

Candidates must have a strong command of the English language in both written and verbal disciplines. Une forte préférence sera également accordée aux candidats qui possèdent également cette aptitude en français.

Sales experience is necessary, and experience in Customer Services or Administrative Assistant type work would be a strong asset.

A working proficiency of common applications like Microsoft Office (Excel particularly) is necessary. We offer training on our custom-software platforms.

Find out why Walker ClimateCare is THE biggest and most reputable HVAC contractor in Cornwall and surrounding area - apply today!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000 - $52,000 /yr

title: UX Design Researcher
description:
Our client, the largest bank in Canada, is looking for a UX Design Researcher to join their team as a full time contractor. The UX Design Researcher will be remote for the time being but needs to be in the Toronto area.

The UX Design Researcher will shape the experiences we create through each of our digital products.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Build relationships with key stakeholders within and outside of the design team
-Support designers and business stakeholders in prioritizing potential research activities
-Develop research fieldwork approaches (moderated or unmoderated) which address business and design objectives
-Develop research activities to evaluate prototypes, improve understanding of current context, or to generate new understanding of changing user needs
-Moderate live sessions with users and RBC people covering high-complexity or sensitive topics
-Communicate core themes and implications from your research activities to the design team and other stakeholders
-Design and facilitate ideation sessions and collaborative work activities

REQUIREMENTS:
-BA/BS degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Information Studies, Design
-A minimum of 3 years of experience in research
-Technical understanding of design research theory / design research tools and working on web-based applications
-Banking/financial experience
-Working knowledge of a variety of design research methodologies

If this sounds like you, please apply today!

title: Senior Advisor, Marketing %26 Communication Strategy, Specialized Aircraft
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Manage the defense and special mission product portfolio by:
    • Creating and implementing a strategic marketing communication plan to support sales campaigns and overall brand awareness.
    • Working with various teams in developing and disseminating marketing communications material: key messages, videos, press releases, brochures, factsheets, print and digital advertising campaigns, direct mail pieces, etc.
    • Producing digital content to broadcast through our Social Media channels and website.
    • Optimizing the mix of communication channels for the above-mentioned material.
    • Monitoring budget according to the annual plan.
    • Suggesting innovative solutions to communicate in a primarily B2B / Government / Institutional landscape.
    • Liaising with a wide matrix of business units internally, as well as third-party prime contractors.
  • Lead the governance for major marketing projects and specialized events through:
    • Rigorous project management
    • Regular meetings with different management levels of the Marketing, Government Affairs, Communications, Sales and Specialized Aircraft teams
    • Pro-active follow-ups with stakeholders
  • Represent all branches of the Marketing, Communications and Public Affairs team participating directly on the Bombardier Specialized Aircraft (BSA) leadership team
    • Attend regular BSA business planning and governance meetings
    • Track active sales campaigns and cascade relevant information to Marketing, Communications and Public Affairs colleagues
    • Report on all Marketing, Communications and Public Affairs to the BSA team.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have 5-8 years of relevant experience in marketing and communications (defense industry or prime defense contractor experience a key asset; previous classified authorizations in U.S. an asset)
  • You have past experience developing a multi-channel go-to-market strategy in a B2B / Government landscape
  • Self-sufficient, you are detail-oriented and have a strategic mind
  • You demonstrate strong problem-solving skills
  • You respect timelines and can manage many projects, while remaining calm in a fast-paced environment
  • You bring creativity, passion and enthusiasm to your work and can motivate a team to generate results
  • You can set clear targets while tracking and reporting on progress
  • You like challenges and demonstrate initiative and creativity
  • You are eager to learn and develop yourself
  • You enjoy teamwork and like to establish good interpersonal relationships
  • You are very proficient in English, spoken and written, with a keen eye for editing (French proficiency an asset)
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.
