title: Senior Manager Brand - Contract
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Fredericton; Laval; Moncton; Montreal; Ottawa

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Build a network of colleagues for life

Are you an experienced brand or marketing leader seeking an opportunity to elevate the brand of the top professional services firm in Canada? Then this role might be for you!

What will your typical day look like?

The opportunity each day is to use your experience in brand activation and management to elevate Deloitte's position in the market. You will lead the brand strategy and develop campaigns that will help ensure that the firm stands alone and apart from its competitors. You will also provide strategic advice and counsel relating to brand governance and activation, and liaise with your counterparts from other Deloitte firms across the globe. Your role is integral to ensuring that Deloitte shows up in a consistent and unified way, so you will work with many different teams and leaders across the firm.

About the team

The Brand team is part of the Brand & Positioning (B&P) team within Marketing, which supports purpose-driven initiatives and activities on the most pressing national issues facing business and society. Collectively the B&P team tells the story of Deloitte to differentiate our brand, and strengthen our influence and reputation to make an impact. In addition to brand activation and management, the Brand team supports our Corporate Responsibility; Diversity, Equity and Inclusion; and Indigenous teams. You will lead a small team and inspire them to challenge traditional methods to bring new bold ideas to life.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone who is/has:

• 10 - 12 years marketing, brand or communications experience preferably in a corporate environment
• Experience and fluency in brand fundamentals and brand strategy/campaigns or initiatives, including brand research and campaign measurement
• Strong collaboration and relationship building/management skills across all levels of an organization, and the ability to interact, work with and advise senior leaders in a complex, matrix environment
• A passion for storytelling
• Inspiring leader who can effectively engage, lead, and coach a talented team
• Exceptional written and verbal communications skills
• Agency experience a nice to have; experience working with creative agencies strongly preferred

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We're also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mindset, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively - that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan , Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative .

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We'd love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Job Segment: Brand Manager, Branding, Senior Brand Manager, Developer, Equity, Marketing, Technology, Finance

Apply now "

title: Campaign Manager, Marketing - 1 Year Contract (Multiple Locations, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract 
Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Edmonton; Fredericton; Gatineau; Halifax; Kanata; Langley; Laval; Moncton; Montreal; Ottawa; Prince Albert; Prince George; Quebec City; Regina; Saint John; Saskatoon; St. John's; Vancouver; Victoria; Winnipeg 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Have many careers in one Firm.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Experience a firm where wellness matters.

Do you want to serve as a trusted advisor and work with the Marketplace leaders to plan and execute a full complement of marketing initiatives to drive growth and enhance market positioning? Read more below!

What will your typical day look like?

As a Campaign Manager, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency and an integral member of a high performing team, responsible for developing the strategy and leading the execution of strategic marketing initiatives. You will have oversight for the project management and execution of business driven marketing campaigns on time, on schedule and on budget; working in close collaboration with our studio agency teams and internal stakeholders to deliver world-class campaigns to the client/business. You will collaborate closely with Senior Marketing Leads, who are responsible for setting the strategic marketing and communications strategy and marketing plans.

About the team

Deloitte’s in-house marketing agency is seeking a 1-year contract role for a Campaign Manager. As a Campaign Manager, you will be part of an overall internal marketing agency and an integral member of a high performing team, responsible for developing the strategy and leading the execution of strategic marketing initiatives.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

•    Minimum six years of marketing/communications experience, with a focus on strategy, planning and implementing integrated marketing campaigns designed to build relationships and revenue
•    Serve as a trusted advisor to market leaders, and work with Senior Marketing Leads to plan and execute a full complement of marketing activities to drive marketplace growth—with an emphasis on conference/event planning and execution, and developing internal and external communications
•    Create and execute marketing plans aligned to local go-to-market strategy and priorities, and to support lead generation and build eminence
•    Ability to keep the business focused on priorities and differentiate between the important and the less important
•    Strong budget planning and reporting experience
•    Excellent interpersonal and client service skills, including experience working with and presenting to senior leaders and leadership teams
•    Demonstrated ability to link marketing to lead generation and experience with demand generation, lead tracking, and ROI
•    Strong negotiation and project management skills. Detail oriented, organized and able to juggle multiple tasks and timelines 
•    Demonstrated skills as a team player by leading through trust and professional respect, including demonstrated evidence of strong leadership and people coaching
•    Skilled in project management
•    Agency experience is an asset 

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? 
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Brand Manager Contract - Wines
description:
Overview:

PMA Canada is the largest private Sales and Marketing execution partner of fine spirits, wines, beer and coolers in Canada. PMA represents a number of premium brands in the beverage alcohol industry, including Glenfiddich, Hendrickâ€™s Gin, JÃ¤germeister, Jack Danielâ€™s, El Jimador, Disaronno, Amarula, and more. PMA has delivered strong sales growth since the company began over 40 years ago, and we pride ourselves on providing Service Excellence for our Suppliers, Customers & Consumers.

 

The Brand Manager Contract-Wines fosters strong relationships with brand owner Supplier partners, Trade Development, & Sales colleagues to develop the brand vision and objectives for Canada. Collaborating closely with the key internal stakeholders (Trade Development, Customer Management, and Sales Execution) in the development and execution of marketing budgets and plans, the Brand Manager is responsible for the achievement of brand volume and value targets, outpacing category growth.

 

Lead the acceleration of volume and value growth of brand portfolio by taking a consumer centric approach to brand management, while supporting the PMA selling organization in the successful delivery of commercial goals. This will be a 12 month duration.

 

Responsibilities:

Key Deliverables:                                                                                              

â€¢             Commercial Results: Brand Depletion and Share Targets

â€¢             Supplier Engagement: Serves as the direct point of contact for Suppliers. Proactively engages brand

         Suppliers, Director, and Sr. Director to develop and align annual Brand Plans and volume targets.

o     Develop and establish clear brand communication & activation strategies that drive brand growth, image, & equity.

o     Develop activity plans from aligned consumer strategies and provide direction, tools and materials for activation.

â€¢             Builds and ensures effective management of Supplier A&P budgets

â€¢             Aligned Consumer Centric Brand Pricing Strategy

â€¢             Aligned Direct to Consumer Programs: Creative Development, Media Buying, PR, Consumer Engagement

â€¢             Aligned Retail Programs: Rolling 18 month Activity Grid including Event Activation Details & Tie Back to

        Brand Strategy

â€¢             Aligned Agency Management Directives: Scopes of Work and Consumer Centric Project & Activity Briefs

â€¢             Commercial Tools: Permanent Visibility , POS & Promotional Items and Selling & Category Management

         Informational Tools

â€¢             Collaborates with Trade Development Team, Regional Sales colleagues, and PMA Key Account team for

        Customer management to drive achievement of Brand Plans

â€¢             In collaboration with Suppliers & Trade Development colleagues, sets annual Sales KPIs & Distribution

         targets

â€¢             Provides monthly & quarterly performance reporting to Suppliers (volume, distribution, KPIs),

         performance tracking, A&P reconciliation

â€¢             Support and coach Wine Marketing Coordinator

â€¢             Other duties as assigned

 

Company Values:

â€¢               Team Work

â€¢               Professionalism

â€¢               Leadership

â€¢               Enthusiasm

â€¢               Creativity

â€¢   Be Supportive

â€¢   Be Better

â€¢   Be Pioneering

â€¢   Be Accountable

â€¢   Be Enthusiastic

 

Behavioural Competency Requirements:

â€¢   Accountability

â€¢   Transparency

â€¢   Consumer Centricity

â€¢   Inspection of Expected Results

â€¢   Ownership of the Business

â€¢   No Blame Fixing

â€¢   Strategic Thinking

â€¢   A Bias for Action

 

 

Management Competency Requirements:

 

â€¢             Business Performance Management including Budget Management and/or P&L experience

â€¢             Proactive Stakeholder Engagement & Management Approach

â€¢             Effective Two Way Communication Style

â€¢             Workflow & Project Management Capability

â€¢             Strong Commercial & Financial Acumen

â€¢             Judgment & Decision Making

â€¢        Leadership

 

Functional Competency Requirements:

 

â€¢             Consumer & Trade Driven Strategy Development

â€¢             Brand Planning (On-Premise / Retail including recruitment components of brand planning)

â€¢             Strategic Thinking rooted in consumer Insight with bias for action including Annual Brand Plan

         development and execution with strong

         understanding of market, category, competitor and consumer trends

â€¢             Commercial & Financial Acumen, ability to prepare a business case and secure buy-in from stakeholders

â€¢        Analytical and influencing skills with fact-based approach  

 

 

 

Qualifications:

Knowledge Competency Requirements:

 

â€¢ Canadian Beverage Alcohol Industry: Pricing Models, Route-to-Market Structure & Implications and Marketing

   Regulations

â€¢ LCB Retail, OP, & Digital Marketing Program Alternatives & Differing Regulations by Jurisdiction

â€¢ Market, Category, Competitive Set & Consumer Trends

â€¢ Understanding of Marketing Disciplines and their respective Intended Impact on Consumer Behaviour &

   Attitudes

â€¢ Consumer & Shopper Research Methodology & Alternatives

â€¢ Canadian Advertising Regulations & Standards

â€¢ Principles of Agency Partner Management

â€¢ Computer Literacy: Microsoft Office Software (Excel, Power Point, Word) Google Docs, Analytical Tools and

   Socail Channels

 

Experience Required:  

â€¢             3+Years of experience in marketing/brand management preferably within Beverage Alcohol, CPG,

         Food/Hospitality sectors

â€¢             University Degree in Business with emphasis in Marketing or Business Management

â€¢        Canadian Wine Brand Management Expeirence a strong asset  

 

The successful candidate will be required to submit proof of full vaccination in accordance with PMAâ€™s Covid-19 Vaccination Policy. Accommodation requests for new hires that are unable to get vaccinated against COVID-19 for a reason related to a protected ground pursuant to the applicable human rights legislation may request accommodation by providing proof of required accommodation.

title: Sr Brand Manager - Dog Main Meal - 12 month contract
description:
Sr. Brand Manager - Dog Portfolio

The Senior Brand Manager is responsible for identifying opportunities and developing plans that drive growth of the portfolio while achieving the objectives for each brand. This is accomplished through the development, recommendation, and planning for implementation of strategies and programs to support business objectives across the portfolio.

This includes:

Brand Management

Financial Management

Product Performance and New Product Launches

Consumer & Category Insights

Long Term Planning

Project Management

What are we looking for?

  • 5+ years of Marketing/Brand Management experience
  • Undergraduate degree in a relevant field or comparable business experience required
  • Previous experience lead a major project from start to finish
  • Successful leadership of cross-functional teams
  • Previous experience managing a portfolio or brand(s)
  • Previous people management experience is an asset

What would be your key responsibilities?

  • Responsible for the development and deployment of brand strategies that accelerate growth of the portfolio to deliver on short and long-term corporate goals.
  • Responsible for the co-ordination and development of marketing plans. This requires in-depth analysis of general market, consumer research, competitive trends and development of objectives and strategies for all key functional areas of the business (product, pricing, availability, media, comms, and tactical promotions).
  • Responsible for managing brand P&Ls to deliver topline and profit targets, focusing on quality growth with a category growth mindset
  • Representing the portfolio and brands through the S&OP+ process (portfolio management reviews)
  • Lead cross-functional team through category analysis, planning, portfolio reivew, risks and opportunities, as well as escalating critical decisions
  • Manages fiscal budgets within guidelines
  • Lead the project management for product initiatives, including cross-functional leadership
  • Lead the development and execution of strategies related to new product launches within the portfolio. This includes identifying and/or validating winning propositions, and the development of executional and launch strategies within the Canadian Market
  • Coach, develop and engage junior marketers, leveraging The Five Principles and MARS functional competencies

What can you expect from Mars?

  • Chance to work on world-renowned brands such as Pedigree, Whiskas, Iams & Nutro.
  • Opportunity to make the world a better place for Pets.
  • Opportunity to work with one of the largest privately held organizations
  • An industry competitive compensation plan
  • The opportunity to learn and develop, taking charge of your own career across Mars

A criminal records check will be required for this position.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: UX/UI Designer I
description:
Are you a Junior UX/UI Designer looking for a new remote contract,

This is a 6+ month contract with our client in the telecommunications industry? Are you passionate about IT and looking to work with a team that thinks the same way? Please keep reading for this exciting opportunity, is in a agile environment.


Advantages
As a UX/UI Designer you will be responsible for supporting an agile digital product team on a variety of tasks and projects including website optimizations, campaign initiatives, feature functionality, customer experience enhancements and other production and sustainment-related tasks.

Responsibilities
Specific accountabilities include:
• Digital design practice
• Collaborate with business stakeholders, internal teams and external agencies to ensure UX/UI design solutions deliver on business objectives
• Ensure a high level of execution consistent with design and brand standards
• Maintain knowledge of latest design and user experience best practices
• Establish, document and enforce design standards, patterns and process
• Effectively advocate for the importance of UX/UI to achieve business objectives
• Define the operational needs within UX/UI and advocate for solutions and resolution
UX and UI research
• Collect/source and analyse data to inform design solutions and provide data-informed insights to improve existing experiences
• Advocate research findings through reports and presentations
Delivery
• Responsible for leading UX/UI design on projects and initiatives
• Strategy, scope and effort level definition
• Interpret creative briefs and independently translate them into UX/UI design concepts
• Communicate design concepts and rationale to the project team and business stakeholders
• Develop design artifacts to support project delivery
• Provide support and sustainment for all digital properties

Qualifications
• Degree or diploma in a related field or equivalent experience, with portfolio
• Cumulative 3-5 years design experience with 2-3 years in a digital environment
• Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and working knowledge of current technology, equipment and software
• Excellent organizational skills with specific attention to detail and accuracy
• Excellent time management skills, able to juggle multiple tasks simultaneously with the capability to evaluate and assess priorities to create focus
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – a team player
• Proven ability to work with and respond positively to constructive criticism
• Ability to work autonomously within an agile environment as part of a larger team, capable of self-directing and taking the initiative to drive towards outcomes

Summary
If this role is for you send your resume to Candice.Wright@randstad.ca, for more details!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Interaction Designer
description:
Our client, the largest bank in Canada, is in needs of an Interaction Designer to join their team as a full time contractor. The interaction Designer will be remote for now but return to the Toronto office as it is safe.

The ideal Interaction Designer will have an online portfolio, experience with IXD and experience with large UX/UI teams.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Understand user interface patterns and behaviours, and use that understanding to drive user comprehension, and improve task performance
-Facilitate design critique, evaluate interactions for inclusivity and provide expert advice and guidance to cross-functional teams
-Act as the interaction design subject-matter expert for the product design team
-Use a comprehensive understanding of interaction design theory, research data and best practices to inform design decisions
-Design artifacts of high complexity to communicate task flows, touchpoints, behaviours, and the exchange of information
-Create complex low-fidelity sketches, wireframes, and prototypes to explore, communicate, validate ideas, and complex prototypes to provide delivery specifications for development
-Present interaction design work to more senior stakeholders
-Research interaction design strategies in the financial services sector and perform competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals

REQUIREMENTS:
-BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field or equivalent practical experience
-5+ years of experience in designing usable interfaces across multiple channels and platforms
-Experience in an applied research setting including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices
-Demonstrated expertise with design, prototyping, and research tools such as Figma, Sketch and Axure RP, InVision, or UserTesting.com

If this sounds like you, please apply today!

title: Senior Manager Brand - Contract (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract 
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Fredericton; Laval; Moncton; Montreal; Ottawa 

 

Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.

Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Build a network of colleagues for life

Are you an experienced brand or marketing leader seeking an opportunity to elevate the brand of the top professional services firm in Canada? Then this role might be for you!

What will your typical day look like?

The opportunity each day is to use your experience in brand activation and management to elevate Deloitte’s position in the market. You will lead the brand strategy and develop campaigns that will help ensure that the firm stands alone and apart from its competitors. You will also provide strategic advice and counsel relating to brand governance and activation, and liaise with your counterparts from other Deloitte firms across the globe. Your role is integral to ensuring that Deloitte shows up in a consistent and unified way, so you will work with many different teams and leaders across the firm.

About the team

The Brand team is part of the Brand & Positioning (B&P) team within Marketing, which supports purpose-driven initiatives and activities on the most pressing national issues facing business and society. Collectively the B&P team tells the story of Deloitte to differentiate our brand, and strengthen our influence and reputation to make an impact. In addition to brand activation and management, the Brand team supports our Corporate Responsibility; Diversity, Equity and Inclusion; and Indigenous teams. You will lead a small team and inspire them to challenge traditional methods to bring new bold ideas to life.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

You are someone who is/has:

•    10 – 12 years marketing, brand or communications experience preferably in a corporate environment
•    Experience and fluency in brand fundamentals and brand strategy/campaigns or initiatives, including brand research and campaign measurement 
•    Strong collaboration and relationship building/management skills across all levels of an organization, and the ability to interact, work with and advise senior leaders in a complex, matrix environment
•    A passion for storytelling
•    Inspiring leader who can effectively engage, lead, and coach a talented team
•    Exceptional written and verbal communications skills
•    Agency experience a nice to have; experience working with creative agencies strongly preferred 

 

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
     
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
     
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
     
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
     
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.



The next step is yours
 

Sound like The One Firm. For You? 
 

At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Demand Manager - Pet Nutrition - 12 month contract
description:
Demand Planning Manager - 12 month contract

The Demand Planning Manager is responsible for building and managing the demand forecast (short term and long term) whilst delivering strong forecast accuracy and demand control. This role reports to the Demand Planning Leader, delivering Demand Planning objectives in partnership and guidance with Demand Planning Leader

The Demand Planning Manager co-pilots End-to-End planning via leadership collaboration with Demand & Supply functions into the S&OP+ process. This includes:

  • Focus both short-term (next 12 weeks) and long-term (Yr 1-3) time horizons
  • Responsibility for period end demand related reporting and inputs into S&OP process.
  • Lead period Key Account Review meetings, partnering with Sales and other cross-functional team members. Direct and coach Demand Planning Manager in similar tasks and process
  • Identify areas of Risk and Opportunity to the demand forecast
  • Is a key stakeholder in delivery of Step 2 (Demand Management review - DMR) meeting within the S&OP+ process
  • Drive continuous improvement and improved capability for Demand Planning for total organization

What are we looking for?

  • University Degree
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent analytical skills (mathematical aptitude and information filtering)
  • Strong computer skills (Excel modelling, Power Point presentations) & ability to understand and adapt to in-house finance/forecast systems
  • Prior Demand Forecasting experience preferred

What would be your key responsibilities?

  • Responsible for Forecast Accuracy and Bias for total volume forecast.
  • Lead the delivery of the most accurate demand forecast using the customers' demand and supply chain data, historical data, best practice planning methodology, accurate base and promotional forecasts, Sales LE tracking & reporting, and Demand Planning systems
  • Key stakeholder of delivery the DMR step 2 process for all Customers and Brands driving accountability with the total organization and facilitates to drive quality decision making within each periodic review. Adopt a continuous improvement mindset, proactively identifying areas of improvement whilst keeping focus on execution excellence.
  • Be responsible for managing the process that converts the agreed demand plan into production requirements and working with Supply Chain to ensure the product is delivered on time, in full to meet customer needs.
  • Drives analysis of forecast performance and leverages modeling techniques to develop tactical and operational accurate demand forecasts.
  • Partner with sales leadership and key customers to support strategic demand planning and develop and execute solutions that enable efficiency, effectiveness and growth.
  • Identifying opportunities to improve systems and processes to introduce better, faster, more accurate and scalable solutions that better meet customer needs and deliver strong forecast accuracy.
  • Utilize operational reviews, supply chain trends, sales achievements, internal and external data to proactively gain insights, identify issues and propose improvements solutions. This includes accurate identification, analysis and reporting of data e.g. loyalty, market, new product forecast, pipeline fill, and cannibalization.
  • Supports the building of an effective and high performing team across Sales, Supply and Marketing creating strong morale and encouraging and facilitating open dialogue
  • Provide Demand insights to KPIs linked to the organization's strategies

What can you expect from Mars?

  • Chance to work on world-renowned brands such as Pedigree, Iams & Whiskas
  • Opportunity to make the world a better place for Pets.
  • Opportunity to work with one of the largest privately held organizations
  • An industry competitive compensation plan
  • The opportunity to learn and develop, taking charge of your own career across Mars

A criminal records check will be required for this position.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Mars Canada is committed to equity in employment and diversity. Mars Canada will provide an inclusive and barrier free recruitment process to applicants with accessibility needs in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require a disability-related accommodation during this process, please inform Mars Canada of your requirements. For more information please review Mars Canada's Accessibility Policy and address any questions about that policy to MarsCanada.Accessibility@effem.com.

title: Interaction/Visual Designer
description:
Our client, the largest bank in Canada, is looking for an Interaction/Visual Designer to join their team as a full time contractor. The role will be 100% remote until it is safe to return to the Toronto office.

The Interaction/Visual Designer shape the experiences we create through each of our digital products. The Interaction/Visual Designer work within an agile environment and iterative process, collaborating with interdisciplinary team members and stakeholders to analyze, design and convey your design vision.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Understand user interface patterns and behaviors, and use that understanding to drive user comprehension, and improve task performance
-Use visualizations and interactions to support analytic thinking with large data sets
-Facilitate design critique, evaluate interactions for inclusivity and provide expert advice and guidance to cross-functional teams and stakeholders
-Facilitate ideation sessions and collaborative work activities
-Act as the interaction design subject-matter expert for the product design team
-Use a comprehensive understanding of interaction design theory, visual design theory, research data and best practices to inform design decisions
-Create complex low-fidelity sketches, wireframes, and prototypes to explore, communicate, and validate ideas.
-Create complex prototypes to provide delivery specifications for development
-Present interaction design work to more senior stakeholders
-Facilitate usability testing
-Participate in or initiate research activities
-Research interaction design strategies in the financial services sector and perform competitive audits pertinent to specific design or business goals
-Perform pattern, micro-interaction and component design audits where appropriate

REQUIREMENTS:
-BA/BS degree in Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field or equivalent practical experience
-Portfolio that includes application design samples
-5 years of experience in designing usable interfaces across multiple channels and platforms
-Experience in an applied research setting including experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices
-Demonstrated expertise with design, prototyping, and research tools such as Sketch and Axure RP, InVision, UserTesting.com and Figma
-Experience working within a large organization and within an agile environment

If this sounds like you, please apply today!

title: Sr. UX Researcher
description:
Our client, the largest bank in Canada, is in need of a Sr. UX Researcher to join their team as a full time contractor. The Sr. UX Researcher will be 100% remote for the time being until it is safe to return to the Toronto office.

The Sr. UX Researcher will embed in a product, journey or channel, you will identify upcoming decisions that need research inputs, propose methodologies, carry out fieldwork, analyze, and socialize the implications.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Build relationships with key stakeholders within and outside of the design team
-Support designers and business stakeholders in prioritizing potential research activities
-Develop research fieldwork approaches (moderated or unmoderated) which address business and design objectives
-Develop research activities to evaluate prototypes, improve understanding of current context, or to generate new understanding of changing user needs
-Moderate live sessions with users and internal stakeholders by covering high-complexity or sensitive topics
-Communicate core themes and implications from your research activities to the design team and other stakeholders
-Design and facilitate ideation sessions and collaborative work activities

REQUIREMENTS:
-BA/BS degree in Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Information Studies, Design (e.g. interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field or equivalent practical experience
-A minimum of 3 years of experience in research
-Technical understanding of design research theory / design research tools
-Working knowledge of a variety of design research methodologies
-Experience working within a large organization and within an agile environment
-Experience contributing to the launch of a digital product

If this sounds like you, please apply today!

description:
Our client, a large bank in Canada, is looking for a UX Researcher to join their team as a contractor. This opportunity will start as soon as the candidate is found. The role will start remote and eventually move back into the Toronto office.
The UX Researcher will work with a cross functional group of designers, product managers and developers. title: UX Researcher
description:
Our client, the largest bank in Canada, is looking for a UX Researcher to join their team as a full time contractor. This role will begin remote and transition into the Toronto office with a flex schedule as it is safe.

The UX Researcher is responsible for working directly with Product Owners and product design teams to identify research opportunities for any given situation to ensure the deepest understanding of our clients as possible. The successful candidate will have proven skills in prioritizing and planning research activities, proposing appropriate research methods, carrying out fieldwork, analyzing, and socializing the research insights.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Prepare research reports to communicate recommendations and design implications based on outcomes of research activities
-Support designers and business stakeholders in proposing potential research activities
-Develop research fieldwork approaches which address business and design objectives
-Seek opportunities to evaluate design approaches and prototypes to meet the product experience objectives
-Plan and execute single-stage research activities of moderate to high complexity to evaluate prototypes, improve understanding of current context, or to generate new understanding of changing user needs
-Synthesize complex or ambiguous data sets from primary or secondary research
-Communicate core themes and implications to the design team and stakeholders
-Present research insights to senior stakeholders

REQUIREMENTS:
-3 years of experience in design research
-Degree preferred (Psychology, Human Factors, Anthropology, Sociology, Information Studies, Human-Computer Interaction, Design, Industrial Design, Computer Science) or comparable work experience
-Proficiency in Figma is preferred
-Experienced with variety of design research methods
-Technically proficient with UX research theory, techniques and tools
-MA/MS degree is preferred
-Experience working in the Financial industry, specifically with Wealth Management is a plus
-Experience working within a large organization and within an agile environment is preferred

If this sounds like you please, apply today!
